loans.name: Sokphun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokphun A. (age 24) married in 2002 and has two children (see photo). She and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. She is requesting this, her second loan with Maxima, to buy materials for weaving.

Sokphun learned to weave when she was a teenager over the course of a year in which she traveled to a nearby island in the Mekong. It’s not uncommon in this area for young people to apprentice with experienced weavers. Initially they weave the simplest designs and, as their skills improve, their output is exchanged as fees for instruction. Sokphum has since passed along the craft to a younger sister.

In addition to weaving, Sokphun and her husband also farm rice to feed the family. He also does construction work in the area. She explained that the loan will help her by allowing her to buy weaving materials for cash rather than by barter with a middleperson. If she works with a middleperson, she trades two of every three finished pieces just to pay for the weaving thread. She, in turn, gets the sales price from a single piece. If she pays cash for the thread, the cost is cheaper. If she sells for cash, she can increase her profit by as much as 10% or more per piece. Sokphum smilingly expressed confidence that she could easily repay her loan because, with the quality of her weaving, she can sell all she makes.

loans.use: To purchase thread and other weaving materials

loans.name: Dafrosa

texts.en: Dafrosa, age 33, is married with a 4-year-old child. She also lives with her sister and her kids. Dafrosa has a business of selling traditional alcohol, which she began doing in 2005. She makes about $85 a month, and works from 11am to 7pm daily. She hopes for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Aida Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Aida Maria was a housewife before she started selling products at her own convenience store. Her spouse’s earnings were not enough to provide for herself and their two children, and that is why she decided to start her business by setting up a neighborhood store in the city of Leon which is where she resides.

Today Mrs. Aida Maria is very thankful since she has obtained three loans with Ceprodel with have enabled her to increase her working capital as well as help her improve her quality of life thanks to the profits that she gets from her neighborhood store in Leon. Currently she needs to urgently obtain more products so that she can sell them in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Aida Maria, antes de tener su negocio de venta de productos de variedad (pulpería) se desempeñaba como ama de casa. Sin embargo, por ser madre y tener a cargo dos hijos en edad escolar los ingresos que obtenía su cónyuge no eran lo suficiente para la subsistencia de su familia, por lo que decide iniciar su negocio poniendo una pulpería en la ciudad de León que es su localidad.

Hoy en día la Sra. Aida Maria se siente agradecida ya que ha obtenido 3 créditos con Ceprodel y gracias a esto ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo además de mejorar su nivel de vida por la ganancia que genera su pulpería en la ciudad de Leon. Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir sus productos para comercializarlos en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy products for her convenience store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Mrs. Delia, as hard-working as always, is ready to get ahead and make herself useful. She says that she carries youth in her heart everyday, and that's the reason she decided to sell various types of foods seven years ago, particularly her chicken soup. This business makes her happy because she also has the opportunity to try a delicious chicken soup while sharing it with others. Day after day, she gets up at dawn to make, in addition to this tasty dish, the well-known national food cau-cau, and various hot coffees to suit the cold season. She dreams of having a big restaurant where she can prepare and server an immense variety of specials. Her efforts all go toward her dream of sending her children to the university in the city. With this loan, she will purchase more china, spoons, and cooking utensils to improve those that she has and also to improve the facility where she serves her famous chicken soup.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Delia, como siempre tan trabajadora esta presta a seguir adelante y a sentirse útil, la juventud se lleva en el corazón es lo que dice cada día y esta la razón por la que ha decidido vender diversos tipos de comidas, especialmente caldo de gallina hace 7 años, este negocio es de su agrado porque también tiene la oportunidad de probar un suculento caldo de gallina y compartir con los suyos. Día a día se levanta de madrugada para preparar además de este delicioso plato, cau cau plato nacional muy conocido y adicionalmente ofrece cafecitos calientes para esta época de frío.Aspira tener un restaurante grande donde pueda preparar y ofrecer una inmensa variedad de especialidades. Sus esfuerzos tienen el propósito de ayudar a cumplir los sueños de sus hijos que estudian en la universidad de su ciudad.Con el préstamo que obtenga comprará más platos de lozas, cucharas y utensilios de cocina para renovar los que ya tiene y también para mejorar las instalaciones en las que ofrece su conocido caldo de gallina.

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Bupe

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Bupe M.. She is married and has 3 children aged 1, 5 and 13. In 2001, Bupe established her genge business. Bupe has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot, icky dough, made from maize flour), a plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel S. is from the sector of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She is a very hard-working woman with the goal of providing her two young children the best conditions in which to live. Her business for the past four years has been the sale of materials in her sector, offering her clients the materials that they come to buy.

In order to grow and develop her business, she is currently seeking support from Ceprodel to obtain the credit necessary to buy her materials. She trusts that she will be given credit and will thus be able to succeed with her business and be able to provide for her children, who so depend on her.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Anabel Sánchez es originaria del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama muy esforzada en su trabajo con el único fin de brindarles a sus dos pequeños hijitos las mejores condiciones para vivir. Su negocio desde hace cuatro años ha sido la venta de granos básicos en su sector ofreciéndolos a sus clientes que la visitan para realizar sus compras.

En vistas de crecer y desarrollarse en el negocio, hoy en día ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de sus granos básicos. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente a que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio beneficiando a sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella.

loans.use: Purchasing materials

loans.name: Ama Florence

texts.fr:
At 46, Mrs. Ama Florence E., born in Ariva in the plateau region, is married and responsible for 4 children. She is a seamstress and three years ago, she had the brilliant idea to add to her dressmaking business the sale of sewing notions and cellular phone card refills. This differentiates her from the competition and at the same time, she has become their supplier for sewing notions.

She needs this loan to bolster her stock in view of the increasing demand.

/Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 46ans, madame E. Ama Florence, née à Ariva dans la région des plateaux, est mariée avec 04 enfants à la charge. Elle est couturière et il y a trois ans de cela, elle a eu l’idée géniale d’associer à son activité, la vente des articles de mercerie et des cartes de recharge pour cellulaire. Ceci la différencie de ses concurrentes et en même temps elle devient leurs fournisseurs en articles de mercerie.

Elle nécessite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock vue que la demande augmente.

loans.use:
Purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

Achat des articles de mercerie

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema has owned a business selling food in Arusha for one year.  She is married with three children, ages 3, 6, and 9.  Every day she works from 6:30am to 10:00pm, which allows her to generate a monthly profit of approximately $150.  Neema is hoping to take out a loan to expand her business and increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more inventory and expand her business.

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: This is the second time Mrs. Phann K. E. has taken out a loan to improve her business. She is a Khmer Cheese (Prohok) maker in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. In this business, Mrs. Phann K. E. can earn around $4 per day. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Phann K. E. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more small fish to make Prohok to sell. Her husband, Mr. Nheb Tuot, assists his wife in business. Mrs. Phann K. E. is 51 years old and the mother of seven children, four of whom are employed in different business activities while the others are attending school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more small fish to make Prohok (Khmer Cheese) to sell.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Alhaji M. is the leader of Trust, a group consisting of three other members: Aminata K., Aminata M. and Isatu M..  Having repaid their previous loan, they are seeking a new one in the amount of $1100 to improve their businesses and their families’ living standards.

Alhaji M. is 26, and was born in Kabala, Koinadugu District, North of Sierra Leone, but he and his wife, a businesswoman who sells cigarettes, now live in Makeni. For the past five years, Alhaji has owned and operated a kiosk (a telephone-centre) where he makes calls for people, sells top-up cards for all 4 mobile networks, charges mobile phones and sells mobile phone accessories. He also sells drinks and cold water at his kiosk, and with this loan he will increase the volume of drinks he sells. This will certainly generate more income, the profits of which he will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Oeurng

texts.en: Mrs. Oeurng S. is a villager in Trapaing Krasang Village in Takeo Province, and breeds pigs for a living. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it so is requesting a loan to buy six more piglets. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more pig food. She is a 27-year-old widow with three children, one of whom attends the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are just one and five years old.

loans.use: To buy six more piglets and more pig food.

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: Khary  est agée de 39 ans elle est mariée et mere de plusieurs enfants son activité principale est la vente de tissus teintés "thioup" tres prisés par les femmes sénégalaises.les revenus tirés de cette activité qu 'elle meme depuis plus de 4ans lui permet d 'entretenir ses enfants .elle sollicite un pret pour augmenter ses marchandises .
texts.en:
Khary is 39 years old, married, and the mother of several children. Her main business involves selling dyed 'thioup' cloth that is highly prized by Senegalese women. The income derived from this work, which she has been doing for over four years, enables her to care for her children. She is requesting a loan to augment her merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia D. is 34 years old, married, and has five children who are all in school. She is a very hard working and resourceful mother. She sells charcoal and smoked fish in her neighborhood in Obuasi. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Afia obtains her charcoal from the surrounding villages and resells it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of charcoal and smoked fish to sell to her customers. She hopes to increase her savings so she can pay her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the community group called “Kristo Tease” (Jesus lives) Trust Group. Her picture was taken at a group meeting. In this group, members provide social collateral for one another to guarantee the repayment of loans. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and smoked fish.

loans.name: 13- Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 13 consists of six poor women, all of whom live in the Dong Son ward, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Luong is the lead borrower of the group. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are at school: a 10 year old son and a 6 year old daughter.

This is Mrs. Luong's first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women ("FPW").  She will use the proceeds from her loan to buy clothes for her market stall.  

She buys women's clothes in the Vuon Hoa market and sells them in the Dong Thanh market. With this loan, she will be able to buy 10 jackets on which she expects to make a 13% profit. She buys jackets for 160,000 VND (~US $9.15) and sells them for 180,000 VND (~US $10.30).  On a good day when the weather is chilly (as it is now), she can sell 5 jackets a day.

Mrs. Luong will use the profits from her loan to pay for her children's school fees and for general household expenditures. 

The loan will be split equally between 6 borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:

* Mrs. Yen is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$93) to buy material that she will use to make and sell women’s clothes.
* Mrs. Chien will buy many kinds of small fish to sell in the Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Bien will buy outfits to rent to others for special occasions (Teacher Day, Army Day, etc.)
* Mrs. Nguyet will buy pork to make lean pork paste and grilled chopped meat to sell in the Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Minh Quyet will buy bowls and dishes to sell in the Dong Thanh market.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Aditcha

texts.fr: Dame A. Aditcha,âgée de 45 ans ,est revendeuse de condiments,liqueurs et divers autres articles (piles, conserves, huile rouge et autres).Elle n'a jamais été à l'école  et réside dans un quartier lacustre ,périphérique de Cotonou. Elle a commencé à faire le petit commerce depuis qu'elle est adolescente. Elle a été initiée par sa défunte tutrice. Dame A. Aditcha a sollicité ce 2è prêt pour renforcer son activité et s'approvisionner surtout en liqueurs et sucreries dont les stocks sont totalement épuisés.Originaire de Ganvié, elle est mariée et n'a pas eu la chance d'avoir des enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Aditcha A., age 45, is a retailer of condiments, liqueurs, and various other goods (batteries, canned foods, red palm oil, and more). She never attended school and resides in a lakeside district on the edge of Cotonou. She started in small-scale commerce as a teenager, being introduced to it by her deceased tutor.

Ms. A. is requesting this second loan to bolster her business and to stock up, especially with liqueurs and soft drinks, which are totally depleted from her inventory. She is from Ganvié, married, and without children, since she has not had the chance.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 2 boxes of liqueurs and 3 cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Mr. M. Abel is 40 years of age. He has been running a small retail shop in Kabwohe for the last four years. He is married to a woman who is a primary school teacher and a hard working mother. The couple has 3 children, whom they take care of very well.

Abel is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, rice, flour, and cooking oil. He dreams of transforming his retail shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đỗ Thị Chỉ, năm nay 35 tuổi ở Mê Linh, Hà Nội. Anh chị có ba con nhỏ và hiện đều đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2002 với hoạt động chính là chăn nuôi, buôn bán rau  và tiền công làm thợ xây của chồng. Hiện tại thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị 5.000.000/tháng. Vòng vốn tới anh chị mong muốn được vay thêm 20.000.000  một phần gia đình chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua bò về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng đầu tư thêm vốn để buôn bán rau.
texts.en:
Mrs. Do Thi C. is 35 years old, living in Me Linh, Hanoi. She and her husband has three young children who are going to school. She joined TYM Fund in 2002. Her main source of income comes from livestock raising, selling vegetables and her husband's salary as a construction worker. Currently, her average income grosses at 5,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 20,000,000 VND to invest in buying cows and in her vegetable selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and business

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 34 year old woman who lives Borj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Nada has been working as an esthetician for eight years. Nada is special in her work because she does it well. Her clients can be anybody from her region.

Nada has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her work. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Nada has requested a loan of 3,000 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her business

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо Мамурова 1976 года роджения замужем,  имеет 3 детей.  Она работает учителем математики в средней школе . По совместительству торгует детскими вещами на рынках разных регионах. Она ездит за товаром за пределы страны и по мере возможности отвозит по регионам для продаж. На рынке она почти 11 лет. В Микроинвест обратилась для  расширения ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en:
Marhabo M. was born in 1976, is married with 3 children. She works as a mathematics teacher in middle school. In addition to this she sells children's clothing in various regional market places. Marhabo travels out of the country to get her goods and then travels around the region selling them. She has been doing this for almost 11 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Akwata Empola Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is now 26 and her youngest is just 17. The 17-year-old is still in a private secondary school in the area. Mariam also cares for her late sister's four children.

Mariam has a boutique where she mainly sells dresses and dressmaking materials. She has owned the shop since 1997 and recently branched out into providing other goods like mattresses, suitcases, bed sheets, and decorative home items.

Mariam is requesting a loan of 2 million USH. With this money she will buy 10 mattresses, 4 suitcases, 12 bed sheets, and other needed stock. She says that her loans help her to have the variety of items that her customers demand.

loans.use: To buy 10 mattresses, 4 suitcases, 12 bed sheets, and other stock

loans.name: Kosar Muhammad Awais Group

texts.en:
Kosar Baji is a very hardworking lady. She sells bangles to the community. Her husband, M. A., also helps her in her business. He sells bangles by going to different areas and announcing his products in a loud voice. They have been living in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Kosar Baji has been in this business for five years. She is applying for a loan to buy more bangles to expand her business.

Kosar Baji is the leader of a group of six other women from her locality. Raeesa Kanwal Baji and Shamim Akhtar Baji each want a loan to buy sewing machines for their tailoring businesses. Ghafooran Baji wants a loan to buy decorations to sell. Naseeban Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Abida Hafiz Baji wants a loan to buy stationary (pens, pencils and notebooks) to sell. Naseem Akhtar Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bangles to sell

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina R. is from the town of Liposong, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Nina owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Nina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig-feed. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for family needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig-feed

loans.name: Abdurabi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Абдураби на закончивший займ смог увеличить свой оборотный капитал по бизнесу купли продажи скота. Сейчас у него два больших быка темно коричнего цвета шведской породы.Скот данной породы очень ценится на рынке.На следующий кредит Абдураби планирует купить ещё пару молодых бычков этой породы.
texts.en:
Abdurabi, upon paying back his loan could increase his working capital for his business buying and selling cattle. He currently has two big dark cinnamon-colored bulls of Swedish breed. Cattle of this breed are highly valued in the market. In his next loan, Abdurabi plans to buy several more young bulls of this breed.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Сурайё 1971 года рождения. Замужем, мать троих детей. Сурайё портниха. Её муж тоже портной. Он занимается пошивом чехлов для машин и покраской кожаных изделий. Сурайё больше года кредитуется нашей организации. У неё в областной больнице города Худжанда есть цех. Она занимается пошивом спец. одежды для медицинского персонал. Также ей заказывают матрасы для коек больницы.Сейчас Сурайё заказали халаты и матрасы, поэтому она намерена досрочно погасить оставшуюся займ. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить ткань для пошива халатов и матрасов.
texts.en:
Suraiyo was born in 1971. She is married and is a mother of three children. Suraiyo is a seamstress. Her husband is a tailor. He makes car seat covers and dyes leather goods. Suraiyo has been our client for over a year. She has a factory at the district hospital in the city of Khujand. She sews uniforms for the hospital personnel. Suraiyo also gets orders to make mattresses for the hospital beds. Suraiyo recently received orders for lab coats and mattresses; thus, she is determined to repay her remaining loan amount early. She wants to use this loan to purchase fabric for sewing the lab coats and mattresses.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Hadji

texts.en:
Hadji P. is from the town of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. He is 28, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Hadji owns & operates a motorcycle transportation service. Hadji has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hadji joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hadji is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP; this will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Elsa Emerita

texts.es: La señora Elsa Emerita V. Suazo  ella tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad. Ella tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en genera. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace  25 años, sin embargo ya tenía 2 años de estar vendiendo de forma ambulante cuando logro establecer  su negocio en el mercado. Ella empezó vendiendo ropa y calzado, y con el tiempo logro vender una mayor cantidad y variedad de vestuario. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de productos para el colegio de ambos sexos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una pulpería para obtener más ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group in Kinyanambo, iringa. She is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 20,16,11 years old.

Amina has owned a business selling chicken for 12 years, she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Amina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Chicken for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Amina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: T buy more chicken for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hair dryer, hair extensions, and beauty products

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane G. is a 30-year-old rice farmer from Norala, South Cotabato. She lives with her husband, Joey, and their six children. Their eldest child is 13 years old. Mary Jane manages a 1.5-hectare rice field, and the farm's income meets the family's basic needs.

Mary Jane now needs additional capital for her farming business. She has joined Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. Provided with proper farm inputs, her farm would have a good and bigger harvest.

loans.use: To finance her farm, e.g. buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sabouratou

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans la vente de matériaux de construction. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2001 dans le quartier d’Avédjie à Lomé ; elle connaît parfaitement son secteur d’activité, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Elle a loué un local dans lequel elle stocke ses marchandises. Elle a tissé de bonnes relations avec beaucoup de chefs chantiers qui viennent s’approvisionner chez lui. Pour disposer de nouveaux stocks, elle sollicite en ce moment un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 04 WC ainsi que plusieurs autres articles essentiels. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This lady specializes in the sale of construction materials. She began this business in 2001 in the Avédjie area of Lomé; she has mastered this field of business perfectly, which allows her to meet the majority of her needs. She has rented a place in which she stocks her merchandise. She has developed good relations with many construction site managers who come to her to obtain their supplies. To establish new stocks of merchandise, she is currently seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 4 toilet fixtures as well as several other essential items. She is unmarried and has no children in her care.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toilet fixtures and various other items for resale

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn B. is a villager in Chan Teab village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since the pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living situation with this loan. Mrs. Lorn B. is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Dus Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Dus Maiya M., a resident of Thecho, lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children. Her daughter and son are studying in grades 6 and 3, respectively. 


Mrs. Dus Maiya M. and her husband, Mr. Nucha M., are both engaged in idol making. They make different types of traditional gods' idols. They make idols according to the demands of their customers. Nowadays in their area, the demand for idols is increasing so to meet the demand, they need to invest funds in their business. But due to lack of funds, they are unable to meet the demands of their customers. So Mrs. M. is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy raw materials like wax, silver, bronze, etc. for their business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
These are borrowers in the small town of Waterloo, twenty-two miles from Freetown. They are a petty traders who want a loan of SLL 1,400,000 to enable them to further expand their businesses. With a loan, they will add more goods to their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living.

On the left of the photo is Kadiatu Conteh. The 29-year-old is the leader of this group. She was born in Waterloo, is married and has two children and fosters two more children. All of these children are attending school but one, who is in nursery school.

For more than ten years now, Kadiatu has been selling oil, rice, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), shrimp, and plastic bags. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by adding bags of rice, gallons of oil and palm-oil to it.

loans.use: adding bags of rice, gallons of oil and palm-oil

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria V. is from the village of Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Gleceria is married and has six grown children. To make a living, Gleceria owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community. Gleceria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through the business.

In 2009, Gleceria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gleceria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gleceria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Gleceria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Wan Word Movement Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Wan Word Movement' group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,500,000 each to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing, and in their academic pursuits. 

Aminata K. (in the middle of the photo) is the leader of this group. She is 35 years of age, married to a driver and they have 2 children, both of whom are attending secondary school.

Aminata sells market foods – rice, peppers, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy peppers, margi, onions, salt, rice to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy peppers, margi, onions, salt, and rice for resale

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa M. is a 59-year-old married woman who lives in San Jose Valing, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store.

Ninfa’s husband, Jose, helps her run the business. They have four children who are between 21-31 years old. All of their children are college graduates and now help support the family's needs.

Ninfa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000 from her business activities.

Ninfa is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 20th loan in the amount of PHP 29,500, which she intends to use on her general store.  Ninfa is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Felicidad's Group

texts.en:
Felicidad B. is from the village of Remus, Baggao, Cagayan. She is thirty-three years old. Felicidad is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Felicidad is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Felicidad owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP whenever she sells an animal she raised.

Felicidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Felicidad's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: El Sr. Elias es casado y tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  vive y trabaja en surutu hace 21 años,  trabajan justamente con su esposa, siembran maiz, arros, mani, y papa, tiene 33 años   y hace 4 años que el viene trabajando con EMPRENDER por la facilidad de pago. surutu se encuentra al oeste de el torno a 41 km, El Sr. Elias es una persona responsable nunca tubo problemas con el pago de su cuota, es muy trabajador y siempre esta viendo que mas plantar en sus tierras ya que con 4 hijos aveces no le alcanza el dinero y tiene que darse modos para llevar el pan de cada dia a su casa. Con el dinero del credito comprara semillas para plantar Papa en sus tierras ya que es temporada de siembra, esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elias, 33, is married and has 4 school-age children. He has lived and worked in Surutu, which is 41 kilometers west of El Torno, for 21 years. He and his wife work together farming corn, rice, peanuts and potatoes. He has collaborated with EMPRENDER for 4 years because of the easy payment terms. Elias is a responsible person; he never had any problems repaying his loans. He is very hard-working and is looking for other products to plant on his lands because, with four children to raise, sometimes income isn't sufficient and he has to find ways to provide sustenance for his family. The funds will be used to buy potato seed because now is planting season. He is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seed.

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam S., age 36, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is engaged in the agriculture sector growing rice, earning approximately USD 1 per day.  Her husband helps his wife in the business and also operates his motorbike to give transportation services. He is able to earn an income of USD 6 per day. He has been in this business since 2006. 

Their standard of living has improved since S.’s husband has this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand his business. S. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a trailer to attach to the motorbike to transport workers to and from the garment factories. This is her second loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy  a motorbike with a trailer attached

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Angela M. B. de 32  años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su hija de 10 años de edad.Es madre soltera.Trabaja  como obrera de campo desde hace 2 años en la empresa agricola la Venta. Quiere terminar algunos acabados de su vivienda. Es una  persona muy trabajadora y gracias a ello le brinda una buena  educación a su hija con mucho esfuerzo y pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. La Sra Angela M. B. agradece la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad sus sueños.





.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angela M. B. is 32 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 10 year-old daughter. She has been working as a field worker for 2 years with the agricultural enterprise "la Venta". It is her wish to finish building her house. She is a hard-working lady and therefore she is giving a good education to her daughter with a lot of effort, and she hopes to obtain a better life quality. It is her dream to finish building her house. Mrs. Angela M. B. is grateful for the support given by us to make her dreams come true. .

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishes for a house

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila, 58, is a corn farmer from Banga, South Cotabato.  She manages a 1-hectare corn field.  She supports her family of 9 children; the eldest is 36 years old.  She works hard in order to have a good harvest.

She has limited capital, that’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to access a loan.  She’s requesting 6,000 Php to support her business in buying seeds and farm materials.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry feed and raw materials

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle B T. is from the village of Tuyabang Alto. She is 43 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle B owns & operates a "sari-sari" store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Annabelle B joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Annabelle B’s 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family’s general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note:

 To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nasren Mai's Group

texts.en:
Nasren mai lives in a small city of Vehari, Pakistan, with her husband and four children. She is uneducated but is a very clever and business-minded woman. A few years ago, she started her cloth selling business to financially support her husband whose income was not enough for the whole family. She also offers sewing services to her customers. 



Her business did well from the beginning but she knew that money makes money. That is why she needs investment for her business to improve. For that reason she is applying for a loan.  She is hopeful that, from the increased earnings, she will be able to send her remaining two daughters (out of four children) to school. She hasn't been able to start their education yet due to lack of income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: His Grace Group

texts.en:
Aloysius C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "His Grace." He is 56 years old, married, and has six children whose ages range from four to 34 years old. He also cares for four siblings.

Aloysius holds an Associate of Arts degree. For 20 years, he has been selling charcoal on Snapper Hill, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 9,000 LRD portion of this 45,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of charcoal.

He describes himself as a caring father. His goal is to improve his business and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future. In the photo that accompanies this profile James is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold B. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 43 years old. Arnold is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arnold owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Arnold has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP whenever he sells his raised animal.

Arnold joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnold has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. Arnold is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Arnold from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio D. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. He is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Dionesio provides motorcycle or "habal-habal" transportation services to local community members. Dionesio has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Dionesio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Dionesio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Benny N. is a widow with no children. She takes care of additional family members.  Benny resides in and owns a four room house. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses are for school fees, medication, food and utility bills.  

Benny is tailor/ designer on Luwum Street in Kampala City, Uganda. She designs and makes all types of fashions for women. She sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.  At times she goes door to door selling her clothes. Benny works six days a week.  Her business challenges are the rainy season and defaulters. She wants to use this loan of 700000 UGX to buy more clothing materials, thread and zippers.  Benny aspires to buy a plot of land so that she can have her own business premises and also have a bridal shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing material, thread and zippers

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie D. is from the village of Labakid. She is 47 years old. Julie is married and has four children. To make a living, Julie plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. Julie has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Julie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. The previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Julie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Julie's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is a seamstress at Elmina. Aba has received junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver. Aba has been in this business for six years. She responsibly helps her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy cloth to display and to sew. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy cloth to display and to sew

loans.name: Tulio Rigoberto

texts.es: El Sr. Tulio S. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como Administrador en el Ministerio de Educación de dicho municipio donde tiene 12 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de invertir en gastos médicos de su familia
texts.en: Señor Tulio S. is from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and has been employed as an administrator at the Ministry of Education for 12 years.  This is his first loan with Ceprodel.  He plans to use the loan to cover his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Ednalyne

texts.en:
Ednalyne V. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Ednalyne is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ednalyne owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Ednalyne has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her raised pigs.

In 2008, Ednalyne joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ednalyne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. Ednalyne is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ednalyne from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Corazon De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. CORAZON DE ORO  inicia su ciclo Nº 10 en el Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Como grupo se ha renovado, cuenta con muchas socias nuevas, como es el caso de la Presidenta y la Secretaria de Actas, sin embargo, para el cargo de tesorera eligieron a la señora Francisca, quien cuenta con nueve ciclos de antigüedad, lo que les permitirá contar en la mesa directiva con una persona con experiencia.  Esta asociación está compuesta por ocho mujeres. 

La señora  Francisca es una mujer madura de 52 años de edad, casada. El negocio de la señora Francisca es el de realizar macramé a las mantas, ha desarrollado el mismo desde hace treinta años.  Esta labor es realizada en su domicilio, lo que le permite cumplir con las tareas de hogar.  Las ventas también son realizadas en su casa.  El crédito solicitado de $us 650.- será invertido en la compra de materia prima.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación son variados,  como: macramé de mantas, tienda de ropa, producción de mantas, elaboración de cuadernos, macramé de mantas, venta de condimentos y venta de mantas de vicuña.
texts.en:
The CORAZON DE ORO (Heart of Gold) communal bank starts its 10th cycle within the Germán Busch Focal Center.  It has been renewed and has many new members as is the case of the President and Recording Secretary.  However, for the post of Treasurer Francisca, who has been in 9 previous cycles, was elected which will place a person with experience on the governing board.  This communal bank has 8 members.

Francisca is a mature, 52 year old, married woman.  She has made macramé decorations on blankets for 30 years.  She works at home which allows her to do her household chores too.  Sales are also home based.  The $650 USD loan will be used to buy raw materials.

The other group members are in a variety of business activities.  Among them are: macramé on blankets, clothing store, blanket weaving, notebook making, macramé on blankets, spice sales and vicuña blanket sales.

loans.use: To buy macramé supplies.

loans.name: Rolita

texts.en:
Rolita P. is from the village of Brgy. Balete, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Rolita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rolita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rolita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Thacien

texts.en:
Thacien is 31 years old and is married with two children who are 1 and 4. Thacien runs a sorghum mill in Kanazi district in Rwanda. His business is open from 6 am until 6 pm every day.

Thacien has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more sorghum to mill and sell.  With this loan Thacien expects to earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to be financially stable and continue taking good care of his family and to buy another mill machine.

loans.use: To purchase more sorghum to mill.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya where she has been farming for six years. She sells her farm produce to the local market.

She recently completed her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to start a poultry farm. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. She faces a challenge with the high costs of farm inputs.  Diseases also affect her production. In the future, she plans to expand her poultry and dairy farm.

She comments that Juhudi's services are flexible and prompt. The grace period allows her to prepare and plan for repayment.
Monicah is 49 years old and married with three children, one of whom attends school.

loans.use: To start a poultry farm.

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 40 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 6 and 18. Regine sells different products such as: water, juice, beer, and so on. This is her tenth successful year in her business, which is open from 6 am until 10 pm every day. 

Regine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more products for her shop. This loan will help her to obtain more profits from her sales. Regine would like to use the profits to pay school fees for her children and save money for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the store.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es: Eladio, de 51 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Isabel (49)  y sus tres pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.La avanzada edad de Eladio, no ha sido un impedimento, para que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación haya podido sobresalir en la vida, él heredo hace muchos años, unas tierras de sus padres, las cuales trabajó y cuidó muy bien, gracias a esto su café, plátano y cacao que siembra se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de sus trabajos es que los administra él solo, y ya lleva 25 años trabajando en agricultura y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos  aumenten y se convierta en una de las más importantes de la zona.Este es el segundo préstamo de Eladio con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo.Eladio tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados en la compra de abono y fertilizantes, que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en: Eladio, 51 years old, is a very simple and happy man. He lives in his own house along with his wife Isabel (49) and his three small children, to whom he wants to bring a better quality of life. The advanced age of Eladio has not been an impediment. With a lot of effort and dedication he has been able to excel in life. Many years ago he inherited some land from his father on which he worked and took good care of. Thanks to this, the coffee, banana, and cocoa that he plants is selling very well in the market in the city of Pichanaki. What he most likes about his work is that he administrates it alone. He has been working in agriculture for 25 years and considers the most difficult thing to be fumigating his land. In time, he hopes that his crops increase and become one of the most important in the zone. This is the second loan for Eladio with MFP. He knows that he has to make his payments punctually if he wants to have access to another loan subsequently. He is a very participatory member of his communal bank. Eladio has planned to invest the thousand soles he is requesting in the purchase of organic and chemical fertilizers, which he needs to improve the productivity of his land.

loans.use: To buy organic and chemical fertilizers to improve his crops

loans.name: Freddy Leonel

texts.es: Freddy Leonel tiene 38 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de construcción desde hace más de 10 años. El inicio este medio de vida debido a la necesidad que se encontraba fue que decide establecer  su propio negocio, el siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a buscar los servicios que el ofrece, ya que siempre se esmera por que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de computadora ya que es necesario para obtener un mejor control de su actividad.
texts.en: Freddy Leonel is 38 years old.  For more than 10 years, his business has been providing building services.  He started out in this field through necessity.  He decided to set up his own business.  Freddy Leonel has always been a very responsible person.  Most of his customers come to him to request his services since he always takes care to ensure that his customers are satisfied.  He is requesting this loan to buy a computer since he needs one in order to have better control of his business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mwanyangiri Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en: M. Sezalia, 48 years old, started off in farming before she embarked on retailing as her main source of livelihood 6 years ago in Mwanyangiri-Mukono. The happily married mother of 2 says she mostly sells sugar, soft drinks, salt, soap, etc. Sezalia still does farming, though on a much lower scale. Her business generates 70,000 UGX weekly. Sezalia will use this loan to purchase more general merchandise commodities to resell. She belongs to the Mwanyangiri Women's group-Mukono.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Mrs. Samon C. and her husband, Mr. Korng Sun live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1975 and have 6 children: 5 sons and 1 daughter.
 
Samon sells finished silk fabric. She buys it from her fellow villagers and resells in other provinces far away from her house. Her husband is a carpenter. She asked for a Kiva loan once and she hopes to continue expanding her business so she is applying for another loan of $1,000 to purchase silk and cotton products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk and cotton products for resale

loans.name: Jacques

texts.en: Jacques is 48 years old and is married to a tailor. They have four children who are between the ages of 9 and 17 years old. Jacques sells bicycles and he has done this business for five years. He is requesting a loan in order to invest in his business and with the profits he plans to buy some animals for rearing.

loans.use: investing in his bicycle store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa has been working in restaurants and doing cleaning work for the past 15 years but this is the first time anyone has ever given her the opportunity and capital to start her own business.  Her friends and family tell her that she makes the best Ecuadorian food around.  This loan will give Rosa the opportunity to purchase cooking and cleaning equipment as well as decorations for her food cart.  It will help her to grow her food cart and attract new customers.  As her business expands, Rosa hopes to save enough money to one day open her own storefront restaurant.  Rosa has four children who she supports through her work; her husband drives a taxicab.

loans.use: To purchase cooking and cleaning products as well as decorations for her food cart

loans.name: Houssein

texts.ar: حسين يعمل في محل حلاقة رجالي له في عمله 8 سنوات متزوج وله 3 اولاد له مع المجموعة تاريخ جيد وقد ساهم القرض السابق بتحسين وضع محله وتطوير مصلحتهكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة يتميز بالعمل الجيد والنشاط يريد ان يؤمن مستقبل جيد له  ولعائلته يسعى الى زيادة مدخوله من خلال تحسين العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة كرسي للحلاقة وتسديد ما تبقى من ثمن سيارته يحب العمل ويسعى جاهدا على ملاحقة التطور فيه وتأمين افضل عيش لأولاده وعائلته وتحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي
texts.en: Houssein works in a barber shop for men. He has eight years of experience in this line of work. He is married with three children. He has a good history with al-Majmoua, and his last loan from al-Majmoua helped him to improve his barber shop in a way which very much benefited him. He received the full support of his family during his last loan. He stands out in his line of work by way of the quality of his service and the energy his puts into his work. He would like to secure a good future for himself and his family, and he is trying to increase his income by improving his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, Houssein would like to buy new equipment for his barber shop, including new salon chairs. In addition, he would like to settle the rest of the payments he owes on his car. He likes his work, and he puts a lot of effort into finding ways to develop his barber shop. He also puts a lot of effort into securing the best life possible for his children and family, as well as into improving his own financial situation and social status.

loans.use: to buy several new salon chairs for his barber shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 52 años, es una mujer simpática. Ella cuenta que hace 15 años se divorció de su esposo Humberto, con quien tuvo 7 hijos, de los cuales ahora solo vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca. Hace no menos de 14 años que se dedica a la producción de papa, arveja, y maíz. Los cuales se ubican en terrenos amplios en la zona alta de su localidad. Asimismo cuenta que siempre fue independiente, pues también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de papa y verduras. Los cuales compra a un menor precio a los agricultores de la ciudad de Tarma, donde abundan estos productos; para luego viajar cada 8 días a la ciudad de Chanchamayo (selva central peruana), vendiendo en el mercado modelo de la ciudad a un mayor precio, pues no crecen en esta zona del país. Su principal preocupación son los gastos de educación, vestimenta y alimentación de sus hijos, donde invierte la mayor parte de sus ganancias. Pero no se amilana y sigue trabajando con mucho esmero, ya que sus planes son llevar cantidades de hortalizas, para la capital “Lima”, donde podrá ampliar sus ventas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, ya que constantemente realizan charlas educativas que le estimulan a mejor su calidad de vida. María, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de verduras para su negocio, asimismo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir en sus cultivos de arvejas.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and is a friendly woman.  She’s been divorced from her husband, Humberto, for 15 years and has seven children, but only three of them still live with her.  Her home is located in the Villa Visca settlement.  She’s been raising potatoes, peas, and corn on land within her zone, for the past 14 years or so.  In this way she’s always been independent.  She also buys and sells potatoes and vegetables from farmers in Tarma, where there is plenty of product, and then travels to Chanchamayo every week (Central Peruvean Jungle) and sells them at the main marketplace.  These things will not grow in that part of the country.  Her main concerns are tuition, clothing, and food for her children.  Here is where she spends most of her income, but she is not discouraged and continues to work with great hope.  She plans to take large quantities of crops to the capital city, Lima, where she can expand her sales.

She is part of the “Villa Visca” communal bank and this will be her seventh loan through MFP, where she feels fulfilled because they often hold educational talks and this helps improve her quality of life.

She will use the money from this loan to buy vegetables for her business.  She will also buy various sacks of fertilizers to spread on her crop of peas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: María Doris

texts.es:
La sonrisa de María  Doris refleja el amor que le pone a su negocio de venta de comida, es éste el que la impulsa a levantarse todos los días a tempranas hora para emprender su labor que le permite contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues con lo que su esposo gana no alcanza para cubrir los gastos de la familia conformada por 4 hijos. 

María Doris es una soñadora que se visualiza en el futuro con su propia casa y allí mismo ubicar su negocio de forma más organizada y mucho más grande el cual le permita incrementar sus ingresos. Por ahora esta emprendedora continúa con su labor esperando que algún día su sueño sea una realidad. 

Actualmente, María Doris necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas como comprar otra mesa que le permita trabajar comodamente sus productos así como adquirir una nueva fritadora para agilizar sus procesos y hacerse a una sillas y unos parasoles para ofrecerle mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Doris' smile reflects the love that she puts into her business selling meals.  This is what motivates her to get up early every morning to start her work which allows her to contribute towards her household expenses.  The money her husband earns is not enough to cover their family expenses.  They have four children.

María Doris is a dreamer who sees herself, in the future, with her own home.  There she plans to locate her business in a more organized manner and she plans to make it much bigger.  This will allow her to increase her income.  For now, this entrepreneur continues in her work, hoping that some day her dream will become reality.

María Doris currently needs a loan to carry out some work in her premises.  She will buy another table which will allow her to work more comfortably and  a deep-fat fryer to speed up her work.  She will also buy some chairs and umbrellas to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a table, a deep-fat fryer, chairs and umbrellas

loans.name: Djatoyerela Group

texts.fr:
DJATOYERELA est un groupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs époux et enfants  à BOUGOUNI dans le quartier Dialanikoro (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe DIATOYERELA se sont connus à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un fonds de commerce pour satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  Elles utilisent les prêts pour faire le commerce de céréales, d’articles divers et  avec Djénéba pour faire le commerce d’habillements.  Elles sont à leurs cinquièmes prêts  et tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Djénéba compte acheter,  15 complets (pantalons et chemises) pour garçon, 10 douzaines de complets pour enfants et  15 complets pour filles. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako chez les grossistes et effectue sa vente en détail, à la maison et au marché, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17 500 FCFA  qu’elle compte réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Djatoyerela is a group of four women who are all married, and are on average 30 years old with two children. They live in nuclear families with their husbands and children in Bougoni in the Dialanikoro neighbourhood (third administrative region of the republic of Mali) 
The members of the Diatoyerela group met through family and neighborhood ties.
With the aim of finding a business  to satisfy their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme .They use the loans to conduct trade in cereals and various products and Djénéba sells clothing. This is their fifth loan, the four previous loans were repaid correctly.
With this new loan Djénéba intends to purchase 15 suits (trousers and shirts) for boys, 10 dozen suits for children and 15 suits for girls. She buys her stock at Bamako from wholesalers and sells her merchandise retail, from home or at the market, for cash or credit to a clientele of men and women.
With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 17 500 FCFA which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase clothing

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 43 años reside en el barrio San Antonio de la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Ahí constituyó su familia junto a Cristóbal, con quien convive desde hace 25 años. Ambos tuvieron 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos. Como madre responsable se dedica a diferentes actividades. La principal de ella es la agricultura, donde hace 22 años comenzó a sembrar diversos frutos como el café y plátano, y gracias al apoyo de sus hijos y esposo quienes cuidan de sus sembríos constantemente. Asimismo instaló una tienda de comestibles en su casa, donde además de productos de primera necesidad vende diferentes bebidas, ofreciendo un ambiente acogedor con sillas y mesas para sus clientes. Paralelo a ello, trabaja en la hacienda “Vivero Arona”; donde limpia y cosecha café, plátanos y cítricos, recibiendo así un dinero extra cada fin de semana. Con todos estos ingresos ella mantiene su hogar, la educación de sus hijos y ahorra un poco para su futuro, ya que sueña con convertir su casa en un recreo campestre. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del futuro” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera su colaboración para concretar sus aspiraciones. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Lucy, comprará con el crédito solicitado maderas y materiales necesarios para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, asimismo invertirá en la compra de bebidas para su tienda.
texts.en:
Lucy, 43, lives in the San Antonio neighborhood in Puente Paucartambo (central Peruvian jungle).  She has been married to Cristóbal for 25 years and they have four children, three of which still live at home.  As a responsible mother, she is involved in different activities, the main being agriculture, growing coffee and bananas for 22 years. Her children and husband help constantly with the planting activity.  She also set up a grocery store in her home and sells, in addition to basic needs items, different beverages in a cozy atmosphere with tables and chairs for customers.

She also works on the "Vivero Arona" ranch where she cleans and harvests coffee, bananas and citrus fruits, and receives an additional income on the weekends.  Her income is used to cover household expenses, her childrens' education and to save for the future because she wants to convert her house into a country recreational area.

She belongs to the communal bank "Luz del Futuro" and this is her eighth loan through MFP, whose support she counts on to be able to carry out her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time, as she did with previous loans.  What she likes best about the communal bank is the fact that all the members are responsible and supportive.  Lucy plans to use the loan to buy wood and materials to improve her house.  She'll also buy beverages for her store.

loans.use: To buy beverages for her store, and wood.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
