Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Semfrosa

texts.en: Semfrosa U. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Semfrosa is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Semfrosa operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling slippers and bags. Semfrosa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Semfrosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Semfrosa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Semfrosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang S., 53, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. Her husband appears in the photograph.

S. teaches at a local school in the town for an income of USD 2.30 per day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of about USD 4 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to use for commuting to work in the town.

In the future, S. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for one of her children to use for commuting

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is married with six children and all her children go to school. She owns a retail shop in Busega selling all types of merchandise. She also takes care of her late sister's children. She has been in this business for ten years. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and one-litre cans of cooking oil.

Safina sells to all categories of people but by retail only. She rents her business premises at UGX 30,000 per month. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges include thieves and transportation of merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city to her shop in Busega. Safina shops for merchandise once a week. She is aspiring to see her business grow large and start selling by wholesale only. She joined MCDT because they are trustworthy. Safina resides and owns a four-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and one-litre cans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is the wife of N. A.. They have three sons and live in a two room brick house in a city called Borewala in Pakistan.

N. and his eldest son sell blankets to various places in the community. They also sell in different cities such as Islamabad and Lahore, where people buy blankets in advance of the winter season. N. has been doing this business for over twenty years, but his son joined him in his business five years ago.  

Suraiya is also a very hard working lady. She stays at home and manages the household chores, but she also operates her own sewing business. Her clientele base is her neighbors. She receives orders from them and earns a good income from the business. 

Suraiya has taken three loans from ASASAH and successfully repaid them. She has maintained good credit behavior. Now she is applying for the fourth loan so she can expand the business of her husband. 

With the loan he will buy more blankets and increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase blankets for reselling.

loans.name: Rolieta

texts.en:
Rolieta B., from the city of Dapitan, is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rolieta is starting a business venture raising pigs for sale.

In 2007, Rolieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Awate

texts.en:
Awate J. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to sell.  

Awate is 36 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to sell

loans.name: Merashiela

texts.en:
Merashiela M. is from the city of Dipolog City. She is 28 years old. Myrna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merashiela owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing children's school bag manufacturing services to local community members. Mershiela has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately PHP6,000 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Merashiela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merashiela has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP8,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Merashiela is requesting a new loan of PHP8,000, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Merashiela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Marina es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 3 estudian, Marina tiene un restaurante en su casa en donD. además venD. bebidas, actividad con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos. Además Marina junto a sus hijos tienen una carpintería en su casa.
Marina solicita un crédito D. 2000 soles para la compra D. gallina, gaseosas y cerveza.
Los sueños D. Marina son ampliar su restaurante y ampliar un carro para pasear.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the "Las Golondrinas" ["The Swallows"] communal bank. Marina is married and has four children, of which three are in school. Marina has a restaurant in her house, where she also sells drinks. Her husband and children help her with the business. Together with her children, Marina also has a carpentry shop in their house. Marina is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy chickens, soft drinks, and beer. Marina's dream is to expand her restaurant and to add a cart for selling on foot.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens, soft drinks, and beer

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Domingo V. Peña es de 53 años de edad es casado más de 23 años con la señora Francisca Claros Hinojosa, tiene 2 hijos dependientes  que estudian en nivel secundario, se dedican  a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, tiene 5 cabezas de ganado vacuno de engorde y 3 lecheras lo cual usan en faenas agrícolas y lo demás como productoras de lecheras, mayormente cuida la esposa aparte de ayudar al esposo en la agricultura, el señor Domingo y su esposa se apersonaron a nuestras oficinas a solicitar un préstamo para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y avena (forraje) para su ganado vacuno, la familia viven en Colomi comunidad Alto Viru Viru hacia el norte. 

EL Señor Domingo V. Peña nos cuenta que más antes trabajaba como funcionario público pero el sueldo era bajo que no le alcanzaba para mantener a su familia, de tal modo se retiro y empezó a dedicarse a la producción agrícola y pecuaria sembrar en mas superficies como antes tener ingresos mayores para mantener a su familia y ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta que logren una vida profesional.
texts.en:
Domingo V. Peña is 53 years old. He has been married more than 23 years to Francisca Claros Hinojosa, and he has 2 dependent children who are currently in secondary school. His work is agricultural production; he grows potatoes, beans, and yams, and he has 5 head of cattle he is fattening up and 3 milk cows; he uses some of his cattle in agricultural tasks and the rest as milk producers. His wife takes care of them most of the time, in addition to helping her husband in the fields. Domingo and his wife came in person to request a loan to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure) and oats (forage) for their cattle. The family lives in Colomi, in the northern part of the community of Alto Viru Viru.

Domingo V. Peña tells us that some time ago, he used to work as a public employee, but the salary was low and was not sufficient to support his family. For this reason, he retired and began to work in farming and ranching, expanding the area he cultivates in order to earn more income to maintain his family and help his children with their studies, so that they can pursue professional careers.

loans.use: Buying organic fertilizer to improve his agricultural production

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth C. is from the village of Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business selling fish in the market. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2006, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. AAbout ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Kiyomiddin

texts.ru: Ибрагимов Киёмиддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Клиент недавно вернулся с России и имел 1000 долларов США сбережения. Приобрел торговую точку на рынке "Тиджорат" с намерениями открыть собственный бизнес. Сейчас он занимается торговлей спортивной одежды, обуви и других принадлежностей. Этим видом деятельности занимается 5 месяцев. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Kiyomiddin I. lives in the Yavan region. He is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. He has secondary education. He has recently returned from Russia and brought $1,000 US dollars in savings. He has acquired a vendor space on the Tidjorat market with the purpose of opening his own business. Right now he is selling sportswear, shoes and other goods. He has been in this business for five months. He is taking out the loan to increase sales.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao T., 44, is a widow with five children and lives in Takeo province. She sells clothes at the local market and is able to make about US$7 each day. Sao T. is asking for a loan of US$1200 to reinvest in her business by buying more clothes. (The old man who is sitting behind her is her neighbor.)

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Evanjelyn

texts.en:
Evanjelyn E. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 23 years old and single.  Evanjelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetic products from AVON & NATASHA in the local community. Evanjelyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evanjelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evanjelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Evanjelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan provided to Evanjelyn by HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret Y. is 45-year-old woman and a mother of four. Her children are aged 22 (twins), 16, and 12 years old. She has been in the grocery business for the past ten years in Eldoret, Kenya. She was introduced to KADET by a member of the group and this is her sixth loan with KADET. 

Margaret is applying for 80,000 Kenyan shillings, which she plans to use to buy onions, potatoes, mangoes, and to boost her stock. This will enable her to live a good and comfortable life. She plans to add more stock to her grocery business and to see her children obtain better education.

loans.use: To buy onions, potatoes, and mangoes

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline M. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Caroline has a retail shop business, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Caroline hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Caroline hopes to own a charcoal business. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her new games.

loans.use: To purchase sugar for resale

loans.name: Magali Rosmery

texts.es:
Magali tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente. Reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola y comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a más de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Chiclayo y la ofrece a sus clientes en calidad de pedido. Adicionalmente vende productos cosméticos por catálogo entre sus clientes: ella les toma el pedido y la empresa abastecedora se los envía cada fin de mes. Los ingresos que logra percibir de estas actividades los utiliza para sacar adelante a su menor hijo y ayudar a su familia a solventar sus gastos.

Magali desea adquirir ropa de la temporada de verano para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas percibiendo a la vez  mayores ganancias que le permitan seguir progresando y ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Magali is 29 years old, single and has one child dependent on her. She lives together with her family in the Mórrope district, a farming and commercial zone that belongs to the province Lambayeque and is found, at most, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She sells clothing for women, men and children. She acquires her quality merchandise in the city of Chiclayo and offers it to her clients upon their request. Additionally, she sells cosmetic products through a catalogue amongst her clients. She takes their order and the supply company sends the products at the end of the month. She uses the income she makes through these activities to move her youngest son forward and to help cover her family's expenses. 

Magali wishes to acquire summer clothing in order to be able to expand her business and raise her sales, increasing her profits in order to allow her to continue progressing and helping her family move forward. In order to achieve this goal, she has confidently put her trust in asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevo soles ($375 USD).

loans.use: To obtain summer clothing in order to be able to expand her business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y también se dedica al servicio de Wawa Wasi (es como una cuna jardín donde se cuida bebes y niños),la socia tiene pequeños terrenos de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y verduras y luego los vende en los diferentes ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Quiquijana, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Irma. She is 34 years old, single, and the mother of 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of produce and she also has a Wawa Wasi business (like a daycare where she takes care of babies and children). She has small plots of land where she cultivates corn, potatoes, and vegetables that she later sells at the various fairs that take place in the district of Quiquijana. She wants to expand her produce business. She requests a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her fields. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lemeria Ole

texts.en:
Lemeria Ole K. is 55 years old. He is married and the father of nine children who attend school. K. is a farmer who works on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy farm supplies and prepare the land for planting. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to buy more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land so that he can plant wheat on a large scale. Despite his age, K. is hardworking, and, with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and prepare land for planting

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Мирзоева Гулбахор жительница района Фархор. Ей 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Гулбахор занимается шитьем. Она берет заказы на дому и шьет национальные платья. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для покупки новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Gulbahor M. lives in the Farkhor Region. She is 46 years old. Married, with four children. Her husband temporarily works abroad. Gulbahor works as a seamstress. She takes orders and sews traditional national dresses at home. She has a lot of experience in this area. She is taking out a loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-seven-year-old married man living in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He buys and sells maize and has been in business for ten years.  The fluctuating price of maize is a challenge for him.  His dream is to own a store. Joseph needs this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Las Brillantes De La Q Group

texts.es:
La señora Natividad de 48 años tiene una Bodega donde vende abarrotes y útiles escolares, ella es presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “Las Brillantes de la Q” cuyo nombre refleja cómo se sienten en la sociedad: brillantes, que resaltan de lo común y hace mención a la zona donde viven, la Manzana “Q”.
Hace seis meses, Natividad decidió emprender en este negocio para poder estar cerca de su niña de 10 años quien aún sigue en el colegio. Antes de esto vendía jugo en un puesto del mercado que ahora está alquilando para asegurarse otra fuente de ingreso.
Natividad es divorciada, su esposo se fue de la casa cuando gestaba de su última bebe, aún así ella no se rindió y por amor a sus niños trabajó duro para asegurarles el sustento, comprarse artefactos y mejorar poco a poco su casa que carecía de puerta principal en el momento de la separación y que con mucho esfuerzo logró acondicionarlo.
Ahora comparte los gastos del hogar con uno de sus hijos mayores quien también apoya en el abastecimiento del negocio. El siguiente gran paso que desea hacer es agrandar la Bodega y convertirla en un Minimarket e instalarle rejas de fierro.
texts.en:
Sra. Natividad is 48 years old and has a store where she sells groceries and school supplies. She is president of the Communal Bank “Las Brillantes de La Q” (The Brilliant Ones of the Q), which reflects how they feel about themselves as a group – brilliant. Their name also reflects what they have in common which is the name of the area where they live, Section “Q”.

Six months ago, Natividad decided to start a business so that she could be near her ten year old daughter while she is in school. She previously sold juices from a stand at the market, but now she is renting it out while she secures another source of income.

Natividad is divorced. Her husband left home while she was pregnant with her last child. However, she did not give up and out of love for her children, she worked hard to support them, buy appliances, and make gradual improvements that her home was lacking at the time of her separation. With great effort, she was able to complete these upgrades.

Now she shares the household expenses with one of her grown children, who also helps with stocking her business. The next major step is to expand her grocery store, convert it into a mini-market, and install iron security bars.

loans.use: To install iron security bars at a storefront.

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en: Ngin S. L. has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has six single children; two of them are employed in different jobs to order to earn a profit. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Growing crops is a year on year activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Ngin S. L. is seeking a loan to buy two cows to use in her farming business. The cows can also be used for breeding purposes and Ngin can raise their offspring.

loans.use: to buy two cows to support her farming business

loans.name: Dominga Antonieta

texts.es:
Doña Dominga Antonieta C. G., tiene 40 años de edad, tiene un hijo que no esta estudiando, estudio sus estudios primarios, tiene un hijo que no esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio y a la tejeduria, en la tejeduria lleva 10 años de experiencia, a sido este su trabajo desde que inció.

Solicita un préstamo a ASDIR para compra de hilo que les servirá para elaborar mas tejido de todo tipo, ya que elabora servilletas, fajas, cortes, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio aun mas grande y con mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Dominga Antonieta C. G. is 40 years old. She has one son who is not in school, he completed primary school. Doña Dominga weaves and sells the pieces she makes. She has ten years of experience weaving, this has been her job since she started weaving. 

She is asking for a loan from ASDIR to buy the thread that she uses to make all kinds of fabrics, for example napkins, belts, shorts, etc. Her hopes for the future are to have a bigger business with a larger income.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Cristalito Group

texts.es: Griselda Del Rosario, Adela Del Socorro y Alba Luz conforman el grupo solidario Cristalito. Son personas muy responsables y disfrutan de sus negocios, ya que han demostrado salir adelante con las diferentes situaciones que se les han presentado. Adela se dedica a la venta de comida, la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a disfrutar de los deliciosos platillos que ofrece como son gallo pinto, queso frito, maduro, tajaditas, tacos, repochetas, enchiladas entre otros. este credito es parala compra de tortillas, cremas, tomates, cebolla, repollo, aceite, frijoles, arroz, entre otros. Es por eso que se han unido para que cada una pueda obtener financiamientos para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Griselda Del Rosario, Adela Del Socorro and Alba Luz make up the Cristalito communal bank.  They are very responsible people who enjoy their businesses because they’ve demonstrated that they can move ahead from different situations that have presented themselves.

Adela sells food.  Most of her customers come by to enjoy delicious dishes like gallo pinto (rice and beans), fried cheese, plantain, fried plantain, tacos, repochetas (corn quesadillas with slaw on top), and enchiladas, among others.  

She will use this loan to buy tortillas, cream, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, oil, beans and rice, among others.  This is why they’ve come together so that each one can obtain financing for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy tortillas, cream, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, oil, beans and rice, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACION”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 46 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia  es comerciante minorista. La socia trabaja vendiendo escabeche en el mercado de San Pedro, la socia vende este riquísimo plato frio hecho a base de pollo cocido con cebollas, zanahorias, arvejas, yuca y en trozos grandes macerados en vinagre y aceite de oliva; este plato se puede comer a toda hora, la socia requiere el crédito en esta ocasión para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de este riquísimo plato. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de su escabeche.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The memberm 46, is a member of the “Renovación” (Renewal) communal bank.  She lives in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and three children.  She is a retailer.  She works selling “escabeche” in the San Pedro market.  She sells this delicious cold dish made from chicken pieces cooked with onions, carrots, peas and manioc soaked in vinegar and olive oil.  This dish can be consumed at any time.  She needs the loan on this occasion to invest in ingredients to prepare this delicious dish.  She requests the loan to buy escabeche making ingredients.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the granted loan which will allow her to improve her quality of life; she also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make escabeche.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es una madre D. familia D. 54 años D. edad, ella vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, ellos tiene 3 hijos mayores D. edad que son independientes. Maura resiD. en el distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz su comunidad es urbana la cual se encuentra en vías D. crecimiento cuenta con luz y agua propia.

Maura se dedica a la venta D. comida en el mercado Los Patos desD. hace aproximadamente 08 años, en este tiempo a adquirido experiencia en dicho negocio, cuenta con puesto propio, es así que D. esta manera que posee una  clientela fija y fidelizada a sus negocio.

Maura está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda realizar mejoras en la infraestructura D. su domicilio y en su local D. ventas, D. esta manera ofrecer un mejor ambiente para sus clientes.

Maura es una mujer muy carismática, que se esfuerza día a día para sacara su familia a delante, cuenta con buenas referencias por parte D. las personas que la conocen , la describen como una persona responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Maura is a mother who is 54 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband. They have three grown children who are independent. Maura resides in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz. This urban community is in a period of growth and has its own electricity and water services.

Maura has been selling food at the Los Patos Market for approximately eight years. During this time, she has acquired experience in this business. She has her own stand, which allows her business to have a loyal and established customer base.

Maura is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3000 PEN so that she can make improvements to the infrastructure of her home and to her vending post so that she can proviD. a better environment for her customers.

Maura is a charismatic woman who strives each day to help her family get ahead. She has good references from the people she knows. They describe her as a responsible and hardworking person.

loans.use: to make improvements to the infrastructure of her home and to her food stand.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy is a twenty six year old single mother with one child. She owns a house in Kasese Uganda. She has had a retail shop business for three years. She started her business with 200,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is high rent and her vision is to have a wholesale business, plus to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy soda, salt, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.es: Elvin de 45 años, es un hombre honesto y dedicado a su familia, él está separado de Marcelia, con la que tuvo 5 hijos,  pero como buen padre su vida se centra en cuidarlos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, ya que todos son menores de edad. Él vive en su casa propia ubicada en la  comunidad nativa de Pumpuriani (selva central peruana). Desde muy niño se dedicó a la agricultura, cuando ya adquirió su familia, hace ya 22 años, comenzó a sembrar en sus propios terrenos agrícolas; comenzó con el plátano y el café, productos bandera en la selva peruana; pero sus años de experiencia y dedicación le enseñaron a sembrar “achiote”, cuyo procedimiento es muy complejo y muy pocas personas se dedican a su cultivo; lo que hace de Elvin uno de los pocos productores de la localidad; sus ventas le generan buena rentabilidad y por ende buenos ingresos; “los mismos comercializadores viene personalmente a comprar mis productos”, afirma. Además de tener más de una cosecha en el año, lo que le hace generar mayores ingresos económicos. Más adelante quiere comprar su propio terreno agrícola, ya que los que siembra son terrenos de la comunidad; con ello piensa consolidar su producción y poder pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Sabe que con la oportunidad que le brinda su asociación, podrá salir adelante, ya que sin ellos no podría “obtener algo más”, culmina con mucha alegría. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Hormiguitas de pumpuriani” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP,  donde esta contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Elvin, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico (abono natural), y en la contrata de peones para que le ayuden a abonar y limpiar la maleza de sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Elvin, 45, is an honest man who is dedicated to his family.  He is separated from Marcelia, with whom he had 5 children, but as a good father, his life revolves around caring for them and offering them a better quality of life since they are all still minors.  He lives in his own house located in the native community of Pumpuriana (central Peruvian jungle).  From the time he was very young he worked in agriculture and when he started his family, more than 22 years ago, he began to farm his own fields.  He started with plantains and coffee, foremost products of the Peruvian jungle.  But with his years of experience and dedication, he learned to grow “achiote” (annnato) which is a more difficult crop and very few people work with it.  That makes Elvin one of  the few producers in his area.  His sales are profitable and thus he gets a good income “the same buyers personally come to purchase his products” he says.  Besides, he has more than one crop per year and this generates more income.  In the future he wants to buy his own land since what he works on now are communal fields. With this he plans to consolidate his production and be able to pay university studies of his children.  

He knows that the opportunity offered him by the association will help him get ahead, because without them he knows can’t achieve more.  This will work out very happily for him.  He belongs to the Hormiguitas de Pumpuriani communal bank and this is his sixth loan with MFP, where he is happy to know that he will have the financial support that he needs.  He promises again to make all his payments on time as he did with previous loans.  He appreciates being part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and united.  Elvin will use the requested money  to buy bags of organic fertilizer (natural fertilizer) and he will hire some field hands to help him fertilize and clean out the weeds in his crops.

loans.use: To buy sakcs of organic fertilizer and to hire field hands

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 66, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She is married to Isaac and they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gabriel Wafula

texts.en:
Gabriel is 35 years old, single and has one child aged eleven months old. He describes himself as social and God-fearing.

For the past five years Gabriel has run a fruits and vegetables shop in Mombasa. He says that this business is profitable, and the only major challenge he has is financial constraints on his business.

Gabriel is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy mangoes, potatoes and kale to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in future open up other grocery stores.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, potatoes and kale to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua a divorced mother of four children, sells provisions and food items such as oil, rice, biscuits, soaps and sugar from a small kiosk in Abura.  Efua will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell, and plans to reinvest for further growth the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
It is in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines where Marilyn lives. She is 34 years of age and a mother of 4 school-aged dependents. The head of the family works as a driver, and Marilyn is supportive by operating a retail store at home. It has existed for over 7 years. She manages the business well and earns about PHP 5,000 a month.

By joining GDMPC earlier this year, Marilyn was able to borrow PHP 5,000 from said cooperative. The money will be used to obtain more grocery supplies to sell. A fully-packed store attracts many buyers, and she is hopeful of generating a good return from this investment. A part of these earnings is intended to sustain and expand the business as well as to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To obtain more grocery supplies to sell.

loans.name: Saúl Bladimir

texts.es:
Saúl, vive con sus padres y hermanos, todos trabajan en el hogar, por su parte Saúl se dedica a un taller de motocicletas, inicio desde muy joven, aprendió en el taller de un amigo, hoy en día lo tiene instalado en su casa, no tiene una hora específica para atender.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para motocicletas, esta compra le permitirá tener lo necesario para atender la clientela. El propósito de Saúl es ampliar el taller en un tiempo y apoyar a su familia en lo necesario.
texts.en:
Saúl lives with his parents and siblings. They all work at home and for his part, Saúl has a motorcycle workshop. He started when he was very young and learned from a friend. Now he has the workshop set up at his house. He does not have a fixed work schedule.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy spare motorcycle parts. This purchase will allow him to have the necessities for his customers. Saúl's aim is to expand his workshop in time and to support his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle shop

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургуль 28 лет, замужем и имеет двух детей 5 и 8 лет.  В 2006 Нургуль начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктовыми товарами, использовав стартовый капитал в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день магазин Нургуль приносит ежемесячную прибыль  в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Нургуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры»  за кредитом в сумме 72,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота.  Доходы от кредита Нургуль планирует направить на покупку бытовой техники для своей семьи.
texts.en: Nurgul is 28 years old, married and has two children aged 5 and 8. In 2006 Nurgul started her grocery store, using 60,000 som (KGS) as starting capital. Currently, Nurgul's store makes a profit of 5000 som (KGS) every month. In order to expand her business, Nurgul has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 72,000 som (KGS) to expand her store's inventory. Nurgul is planning to use increased profits from the store to purchase new appliances for her family.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla José es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra yuca y maíz, una vez que realiza su cosecha sus productos los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Lambayeque – Chiclayo y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su hogar.  También cuenta con mototaxi, la cual trabaja medio tiempo, permitiendole obtener otro ingreso económico para su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, con la finalidad de obtener mejoras económicas para su familia.  José es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que los suyos tengan comodidades y mejores oportunidades para seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old, single, and lives in his own home which has running water and electricity. His home is in the rural district of Olmos which belongs in the Lambayeque department. This district is known for agriculture and animal breeding. 

José works in agriculture, and he has his own farm land where he grows yucca and corn. Once he harvests his products he sells them in different markets in Lambayeque – Chiclayo, and he’s able to make enough to cover his household costs. He also has a moto-taxi in which he works part-time, enabling him to get another source of income for his family. 

He has asked for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer to improve his fields as well as his crop. He will also do some maintenance work on his moto-taxi with the goal of improving his family’s financial standing. José is a parent who is concerned about whether those because those in his care have what they need and have better opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his fields and crop and to do maintenance work on his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal tiene 56 años, es acompañado; tiene dos hijos de cinco y seis años, respectivamente. 

Vidal trabaja como agricultor (durante la epoca de lluvia) y jornalero (durante la epoca seca, 9 meses D. año). Él se dedica a la agricultura por tradición familiar, cultivando hasta 14,000 metros cuadrados. Vidal aprendió este oficio de sus padres. Normalmente él cultiva el maíz para asegurar el alimento de su familia. Es poca la cantidad que comercializa para poder pagar por vestuario y vivienda. Para sacar su cosecha, Vidal acarrea el  maíz en su espalda y recorre aproximadamente 0.8 km.

Vidal ha pedido un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar una motobomba y tuberias de PVC, y así instalar un sistema de riego de tipo artesanal. Con parte D. préstamo Vidal tambien quiere comprar semillas de hortalizas para formar un huerto casero. Con el sistema de riego y el huerto Vidal podrá producir durante la epoca seca, y no depender solamente D. trabajo como jornalero. Tambien el podrá proveer legumbres para su familia y mejorar su nutrición.

Vidal es un líder en su comunidad, actualmente esta formando una cooperativa de agricultores que el preside. El objetivo de la cooperativa es organizar a los agricultores, y juntos comprar insumos, comercializar sus cosechas, y gestionar asesoría técnica. La asesoría técnica la esta recibiendo de técnicos agropecuarios por parte de una ONG. En la zona donde vive Vidal, la cual es a la orilla de un río, ningún agricultor produce otros productos aparte D. maíz y maicillo. Vidal quiere demostrarles a los demas agricultores que se puede hacer más, y así motivarlos.

Con el sistema de riego por goteo Vidal espera tener ingresos constantes que le permita dar una mejor educación y vivienda a su familia.
texts.en:
Vidal is 56 years old and he is married common-law. He has two children, aged 5 and 6 respectively.

Vida works as an agriculturist (during the rainy season) and as a farm hand (during the dry season, which is 9 months out of the year). He is an agriculturist following a family tradition, cultivating up to 14000 square meters of land. Vidal learned this business from his parents. Normally he cultivates corn to secure the family's nutrition. The amount which he sells is small to cover nutrition and clothing expenses. To sell the harvest, Vidal transports the corn on his back, traveling approximately 800 meters.

Vidal has requested a loan from Fundacion Campo (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase a pump and PVC tubing to install an artesian style irrigation system. With a part of this loan Vidal also wants to purchase vegetable seeds to start a home garden. With the irrigation system and the plantation, Vidal will be able to product even during the dry season, no longer having to depend on his work as a farm hand. He will also be able to provide vegetables for his family and improve their nutrition.

Vidal is a leader in his community. He is currently presiding over a cooperative for agriculturists. The objective of the cooperative is to organize agriculturists, to purchase materials together, to sell their harvests, and to partake in technical assistance. The technical assistance is received by agricultural technicians provided by an NGO. In the region where Vidal lives, which is alongside a river, no agriculturist products other products apart from corn and millet. Vidal wants to show the other agriculturists that more can be done, and to motivate them this way. 

With the drip irrigation system, Vidal hopes to obtain a constant source of income which will permit him to provide his family with a better education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and tubing to install an irrigation system.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane is from the village of Hovouny in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three daughters (twenty-two, twenty-eight and thirty years old).  Gayane has a high school education and has been working as a farmer for the past fifteen years.  As times are difficult in Armenia, Gayane supports her daughter’s families with produce grown on the family farm.  She considers herself a hardworking person and is looking for a loan to purchase animal feed and seeds.  The autumn planting season is near and Gayane wants to grow her business.  The loan will help her increase the family income by ten percent.  Gayane was born in Hovouny and enjoys living there.  She dreams of renovating the family home.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and seeds

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy, de 18 años, es un hombre empeñoso. Vive junto a su mamá, Jenny, su papá Carlos y sus 3 hermanos en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Chamisería. Su principal sueño es culminar sus estudios de administración de empresas. Para ello se esfuerza día y noche, pues no cuenta con la solvencia económica. Pero eso no es un impedimento para él. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en un tienda de venta de ropa, muy reconocida en todo el país, ahí obtiene un sueldo mensual, con lo puede costear los pago a la universidad. Pero eso no es todo, ya que tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ganado ovino y vacuno; que enseba para luego vender a un mayor precio. Además en sus tiempos libres ayuda a su familia en la elaboración de faldas típicas, las cuales le generan un ingreso extra. Ahora su principal objetivo es culminar sus estudios y desarrollarse como todo un profesional. Él pertenece al banco comunal “santa clara de asís” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Percy de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 7 ovejas que cuestan un promedio de 200 soles cada una.
texts.en:
Percy, 18, is an enterprising young man.  He lives with his parents, Jenny and Carlos, and his 3 brothers and sisters in a rural area of Chamiseria.  He wants to earn a degree in business administration and he's working, day and night, to get enough money together to do it.  Having only a little money is not an obstacle for Percy.  He works from Mondays to Fridays at a nationally-known clothing store and makes enough to cover the university's fees.  But that's not all: he has a business of his own, raising and selling sheep and cattle, and earns extra income helping his family with their crafts business.  His goal now is to finish his studies and start a professional career.  He belongs to the Santa Clara de Asis community bank and this is his second MFP loan.  Your help will allow him to continue working toward his goal.  For his part, Percy promises to repay this loan just as he did the first one.  He says that he is happy with the community bank because its members are responsible and supportive.  
Percy will use this loan to buy 7 sheep, each of which cost an average of 200 soles each.

loans.use: to buy 7 sheep for his livestock business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan sigue participando en el banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Juan vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. 

Actualmente, Juan sigue dedicándose a la venta de especias y condimentos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Juan requiere el préstamo para comprar condimentos como por ejemplo comino, pimienta y otras cosas más.

Juan se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan continues to participate in the communal bank "Las Palmeras" in the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

Juan lives in Cusco, and this is where he is developing his economic activities.

Juan is continuing to work selling spices and condiments.  He has had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well.  Juan needs a loan to buy condiments such as, for example, cumin, pepper and other products.

Juan is grateful for the opportunity being provided through these means, and he pledges to make his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy spices such as cumin, pepper and other products

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is 38 years old, married, and has seven children who attend school.  He is a farmer, engaged in vegetable production and hog-raising to generates income for his family. Despite financial difficulty, he plans on continuing to send his children to school to give them the best education they need. 

Armando is requesting a loan for 23,000 PHP, which he will use to buy vitamins, feeds, and additional piglets to raise. He aims to strengthen his hog-raising business to make it a viable source of income. He believe that through patience and hard work, he will improve his business and his family's standard of living and give his children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feeds, and additional piglets to raise.

location.town: Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Janis Del Carmen

texts.es: Janis de 50 años vive con sus hijos en las edades de 24 a 28 años  en San Juan Nepomuceno, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, ubicado cerca a la ciudad de Cartagena;  allí tiene  un almacén que inició el 1 de marzo del año 2007, con un capital  producto de sus ahorros,  cuando trabajó en una empresa. Inicialmente compró sillas, ollas, vajillas, tanques plásticos, planchas sartenes, plateros y abanicos que vendió y le fue muy bien. Gradualmente con su gran esfuerzo y su disciplina, ha logrado sacarlo adelante y sostenerse, pero desea crecer más aun, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues requiere responder a su mercado ya conquistado, especialmente en esta temporada de fin de año,  que le  augura muchos éxitos,  pues dinero circulante, producto de primas y bonificaciones, que mueven los negocios; por eso ella comprará con su credikiva electrodomésticos sobre pedidos de sus clientes, con los cuales ganará descuentos y realizará una inversión efectiva. Con sus créditos recibidos por parte de la Fundación, ha logrado cambiar  y crecer en muchos aspectos y esto ella lo agradece. Su meta es continuar avanzando para lograr tener un negocio de mayor tamaño y continuar fortaleciendo el bienestar de su hogar..
texts.en:
Janis, 50, lives with her children whose ages range from 24 to 28 in San Juan Nepomuceno, a municipality in Bolívar Department, located near the city of Cartagena.  She has a warehouse there that she opened on March 1, 2007 with capital she had in savings she’d earned working in a firm.  

She initially bought chairs, pots, dinnerware, plastic tanks, irons, pans, serving trays and fans that she sold and did very well.  Gradually with much effort and discipline she has managed to move the business forward and support herself but she wants it to grow still more and this is why she’s turning to a Kiva loan, her second financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because she wants to respond to the market she’s already captured, especially this end of the year when much success is foreseen because of circulating cash product of bonuses and allowances given by businesses.  

She will use her Kiva loan to buy home appliances that her customers have on order with her; she will earn discounts and an effective profit.  With loans received from the Fundación she’s managed to change and grow in many aspects and this she is grateful for.  Her goal is to continue advancing to attain a much larger business and continue strengthening her home’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Nelly Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 meses de nacido. El marido trabaja en una fábrica.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos, comida rápida y bebidas como gaseosas, batidos de frutas, energizantes etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que vende en su casa. Lleva en este negocio  un año y empezó este negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar gaseosas, energizantes y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva un año en el Banco comunal y le gusta ya que gracias al crédito puso su negocio que le permite ganar algo.

Su sueño es tener un buen trabajo.

En la foto está la socia con su hijo.
texts.en:
The “Proyecto 2003” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jaramijo (Manta) Canton.  This place is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Most of the residents here are very hardworking and engaged in tasks related to the sea.

We met Nelly, 21, here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has a four-month-old son.  Her husband works in a factory.

She is a very good housewife who in order to help her husband cover household expenses prepares snacks, fast food and beverages like soft-drinks, blended fruit drinks, energy drinks, etc. to sell.  She works every day from 8am until 3pm and sometimes even later since she sells at home.  She’s been in this business for a year and started it with the first loan she got from the bank.

She will use this loan to buy soft-drinks, energy drinks and foodstuffs to prepare her food.  She’s been in the communal bank for a year and she likes it because thanks to the loan she’s able to earn a bit of profit from her business.  Her dream is to have a good job.

She appears in the photo with her son.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, energy drinks and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the expansion of her Pranda and elastic sales business. Pranda is a traditional product used to tie women's hair firmly. It is a very popular product and has high demand in the country. She sells her products to the market and to her community clients at a profit. She does this work to financially contribute to the family.
 
With the loan investment, Azra will buy thread and beads in larger quantity for making Prandas in larger quantity and she will buy elastics to sell. She is very experienced in her business and has a good number of business contacts. 

Her husband is an expert in furniture manufacturing and sells his furniture for a good price. Azra has given birth to four sons and a daughter. Except for her youngest son who is two years old, all the others are enrolled in local school and getting their education. 

Azra is confident about her business improvement after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy thread, beads and elastics

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Larry is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for his services.

Larry is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Larry hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for his services.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old and lives in Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ. She is married with 5 Adult-age children. 

Rebecca has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business.  She has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her business.

Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of her business.

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
Kosal is aged 34 years and married. She lives with her family in a rural village located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. She has one dependent daughter who is too young for schooling. To make a living, she has been weaving mats for about ten years while her husband is a paid worker. Together, they can earn about KHR10,000 per day and manage to save about KHR5,000 each day for the future needs. The main challenge for her family's business is the lack of working capital to support the business. 

This is the group loan for Kosal's group consisting of four members who live in the same area. Kosal has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and completely paid back the loan. The first loan helped her better support her life. To respond to her challenge, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She wants to use her portion to buy raw materials for her weaving business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Elmer Efrain

texts.es: ELMER EFRAIN: Es un señor de 32 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casado un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para construir poco a poco un anexo de madera que será utilizado como cuarto para su hijo. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción, madera cepillada, clavos, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Sueña con construir su vivienda de concreto.

loans.use: para construir poco a poco un anexo de madera

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is a person that since he was a boy, worked to help with the family expenses, he started his own business very young, because he had to finance his basic school studies because his family has limited resources. With 45 years old and 3 children, he works so hard every day, Luis wants that his small kids have a better opportunity to study.

Luis requires a loan of $475 USD to purchase raw material, because his job consists on buy - sale of seeds like frijol, corn, chickpea, sorghum, etc. He is going to repay the loan in a term of 6 to 12 months. Luis and their children need your help.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Luis es una persona que desde niño trabajaba para ayudar en los gastos de la familia, inicio su propio negocio muy joven, esto con el motivo de financiar sus estudios básicos ya que su familia es de recursos limitados. Con 45 años de edad y 3 hijos por los que todos los días trabaja muy duro, Luis desea que sus pequeños tengan una mejor oportunidad para estudiar.

Luis requiere de un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar materia prima, ya que su trabajo consiste en la compra - venta de semillas como fríjol, maíz, garbanzo, sorgo, etc. Se compromete a apagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Luis y sus hijos requieren de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Wilbad

texts.en: I am a single man. I am the head of a 6-person household. I am a petty trader, and I am the main bread-earner. I dropped out of school to take care of my siblings after the death of our parents from HIV/AIDS in 2005.

loans.use: I intend to expand and diversify my business to include fruit vending.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Phy N. is a 42-year-old widow and lives with her son in Phnom Pehn, Cambodia. Phy is a very hard-working mother who is struggling to feed her family. She earns  money by selling tradditional Khmer cakes such as Num bot, Num Ansorm, and Num Korm. Her husband passed away many years ago and since then, she has been responsible for all the expenses in the family. her son helps his mother by doing construction work, making about $5/day. Phy N. hopes the loan will allow her to purchase some construction tools and new cooking utensils for her business. 
In the future, she would like to open a grocery store and build a concrete house for her small family.

loans.use: To buy some utensils and construction tools for a business

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en: Zacharia M. K. came from a small village in Northern Sierra Leone.  He is thirty-six years old and married with four children.  He migrated to Makeni some years ago for business purposes.  Zacharia owns a stall in Makeni town market where he sells building materials.  Having struggled for years, he used his first loan for expanding his business and made a profit  for the family needs.  He intends to use the second larger loan for the same purpose. Zacharia said that his goal is to provide his children with their basic needs, especially education, medical care, and better housing.

loans.use: Expand his inventory of building supplies

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr:
This is a group loan to be shared by the seven members of the Ardica association, led by Mr. Alioune S.. In their loan application, the group describe their business as setting up a tourist shop, selling eco-label souvenirs from the isle of Carabane, which has strong tourism potential. For the group's entire description, please see the French original below: «Contexte : Le présent projet s’appuie sur une zone pilote:l’île de Carabane le village qui en porte le méme nom Le programme dans lequel il s’insére s’intitule SEM du Réseau Sénégalais des Ecovillages et a pour objet la lutte contre la pauvreté dans les villages membres

Rattaché à la région de ZIGUINCHOR Département d’OUSSOUYE arrondissement de KABROUSSE, Communauté rurale de DIEMBERING ,le village de Carabane où convergent tous les flux régionaux de voyageurs et de marchandises ayant choisi la voie maritime

Sous références socioculturelles s’inscrivent dans la culture Diola Katas,connu pour son fort attachement à la terre et l’importance de la valeur du travail,en vue d’assurer son autonomie la population à majorité Diola mène essentiellement des activités de rizicultures,pêche,tourisme,artisanat et petit commerce d’appoint en liaison avec le passage du bateau

Carabane,comme la plupart totalement des nappes phréatiques superficielles,seules sources d’approvisionnement en eau des populations Or,celles-ci subissent un phénomène croissant de salinisation,qui entraine une dégradation globale des conditions environnementales,et affecte du meme coup toutes ses activités

D’une superficie de 57 km² ,l’ile de Carabane se caractérise néanmoins par un potentiel spatial ainsi qu’un potentiel en ressources naturelles,lesquels,s’ils étaient appréhendés de subsistance

Et pour faire face à cette situation,nous contons avec le concours de SEM,mettre en œuvre une série d’activités génératrices de revenus que nous exposons ci-dessous :

Objectif : mettre en œuvre des activités génératrices de revenus

Notre projet veut mettre en place une boutique qui vend des articles imprimés avec le label de l’écovillage de Carabana,étant donné que l’île a une forte potentialité touristique qui permet au visiteur de se ravitailler sur place en cadeaux à emporter Notre ambition est de participer,avec les bénéfices acquis,à l’achat de fourniture didactique aux élèves de la maternelle,du primaire afin de soutenir les parents d’élèves et équiper le foyer des jeunes en matériel audiovisuel et de sonorisation ce qui nous permettra de créer des emplois,et aussi soutenir la jeunesse locale dans ses activités socoiculturelles et sportives

Activités : -Equipement de la boutique artisanale du village et l’équiper -achat de produits bruts -transformation des produits bruts ;(couture,teinture, impression) -Exposition et vente du matériel de la boutique »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Tourist Shop

loans.name: Alougba

texts.fr:
A 70-year old widow, Mrs. Alougba A. was born in Kbéta Koda. Very early she began selling cakes and juice that she produced herself mixed with cold water in order to meet the needs of her five children. She buys the basic ingredients for these items on credit which she reimburses after her sales. She is now seeking a $1000 loan to stock enough wheat flour and oil to meet the ever-growing demand of her customers on time. This will significantly increase her income for the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Veuve et âgée de 70 ans, madame Alougba A. est née à Kéta Koda. Elle s’est lancée très tôt dans la vente de gâteau, du jus qu’elle prépare elle-même ajouté à l’eau glacée pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses cinq enfants. Elle achète à crédit les matières premières dont elle a besoin pour la fabrication de ces produits qu’elle rembourse après la vente. Elle sollicite alors un prêt de $1000 pour pouvoir faire un stock suffisant de farine de blé et d'huile, et satisfaire à temps les demandes sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle. Ceci augmentera considérablement ses revenus pour un bien être de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour and oil

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru:
Askar, as many others, was making scanty earnings at his former job which were not even enough to support his family. He took out a loan started a business selling stationary. His income was now enough to support his elderly parents who were no longer able to support themselves. During the past five years his partnership with MicroInvest has been a success.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Атаев как и многие другие получал на прежней работе мизерную заработанную плату, на которую невозможно было содержать семью. Получил кредит , занялся бизнесом, продажа канцелярскими товарами. Стал обеспечивать свою семью, где уже родители были пенсионерами , которые не в состоянии были обеспечивать их. В течении пяти лет он с успехом сотрудничает с Микроинвест.

loans.use: Sale of stationary

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 35-year-old Victoria K.. She is single with two children, ages 7 and 10. In 1995 Victoria established a milling business where she mills maize flour, the main ingredient in the local staple ugali. Victoria now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase parts for her milling machine. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase parts for her milling machine.

loans.name: Ni Luh Darmi

texts.id:
Ni Luh Darmi is used to simple living. This mother of three children has learned to accept life's lessons. This attitude has helped her to raise her children and provide them with good education so they grow up responsibly. At this time, she is still responsible to school her smallest child, Komang Trisna Putra who is in 8th grade. The other children has been able to afford their living independently, even though only working as manual labor. Her love to the her family made Ni Luh Darmi tried to help her husband in supporting the family's financial needs. She decided to start fattening pigs, a business chosen by other women in her neighborhood, so she could also learn from their experiences. She does not make much profit, only about $22 to 33 for each pig slaughtered after three months fattening. However, it helped cover some household needs, from kitchen supplies, health care, and other needs. DINARI is going to help her by providing a loan for her to buy more pigs and more feeds.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Hidup dalam kesederhanaan sudah menjadi bagian dalam kehidupan Ni Luh Darmi. Ibu yang memiliki 3 (tiga) orang anak ini selalu belajar untuk menerima setiap hal yang dialaminya sebagai pelajarang yang berharga dalam hidupnya. Hal inilah yang membuatnya mampu membesarkan anak-anaknya dan memberikan mereka didikan yang baik sehingga mereka bisa bertumbuh menjadi anak yang patuh dan ulet. Saat ini tanggung jawabnya dalam memberikan pendidikan secara formal masih kepada anaknya yang paling kecil yaitu Komang Trisna Putra yang masih duduk di kelas dua Sekolah Menengah Pertama, sedangkan yang lainnya sudah mampu membiayai hidupnya masing-masing karena sudah bekerja walaupun hanya sebagai buruh kasar. Kecintaannya terhadap keluarga membuat hatinya tergerak untuk ikut serta mengupayakan kesejahteraan keluarganya dengan membantu suaminya untuk bisa memenuhi kebutuhan hidup yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Jalan yang ditempuhnya adalah dengan memlihara babi penggemukan seperti yang juga digeluti oleh banyak ibu-ibu yang lainnya sehingga Ni Luh Darmi bisa belajar dari setiap keberhasilan mereka. Keuntungan yang diperolehnya memang tidak terlalu besar yaitu sekitar Rp 200.000,- Rp 300.000,- per ekor dari memelihara babi untuk babi guling yang dipelihara hanya dua atau tiga bulan saja, tetapi itu cukup bermanfaat dalam menutupi segala kekurangan biaya rumah tangganya baik itu keperluan dapur, kesehatan perumahan ataupun hal lainnya. DINARI memberinya bantuan modal usaha dan itu dipakainya untuk menambah jumlah penggemukan yang dipeliharanya dan juga untuk memenuhi kebutuhan pakan ternaknya tersebut.

loans.use: Purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Iva Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
The successful training of the first loan group in Iva village sparked a lot of interest in other women in the community.  This group asked members of the first group to help get them acquainted with the SPBD staff who trained them.  Without wasting time, they had their training scheduled.  The women expressed their gratitude for being taught so many things about managing their family income and viewing the farm as a business.
Some of the members went beyond farming to start producing banana and taro chips.  They even opened a food stall to serve the typical Samoan fare of taro, bananas, and vegetables.  The members are now eagerly awaiting for their initial loan so that their business plans can be put into action.

loans.use: to purchase farming implements (bush knives, crowbar, sprayer, rakes), agricultural supplies (taro tubers, seedlings, seeds, fertilizer, pesticides), and pay for additional farm labor

loans.name: Iskhok

texts.ru:
Iskhok Nazurov lives in the town of Yavan. He is 53 years old, married and has five children. He has a college education and has graduated from a pedagogical university. He is a teacher by profession and works in a polytechnic college. In the rural areas most people are in the animal husbandry business. Iskhok also does that and breeds calves for meat sales. He wants to buy a few more calves and resell them after 2-3 months. He needs a loan for that and it will help him increase commodity circulation and also increase his family's income. He has been in this business for the past ten years. Besides money this business also brings joy to his family. He plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Назуров Исхок проживает в городе Яван. Женат и имеет 5 детей.Ему 53 года. У него высшее образование. Закончил педагогический университет. По специальности преподаватель. Работает в Политехническом училище. Но в сельской местности мало кто не занимается животноводством. Вот и Исхок тоже разводит бычков для продажи на мясо. Сейчас он хочет купить еще несколько молодых бычков и через 2- 3 месяца продать. Для этого он хочет получить кредит. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот и тем самым увеличить доход для своей семьи. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 10 лет. Эта работа кроме денег приносит ему и его семье радость . Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina started her business to help herself economically because her husband is retired due to illness and doesn’t work, which is why she needed additional income for her children’s education. She began approximately six years ago and, because she has always enjoyed cooking, she started making tamales and selling them to her neighbors. Now she has a more established, small stand outsiD. her home. It’s a new neighborhood and on the weekends she sell tacos and hamburgers and continues to make tamales, but only to order. She is requesting a loan for $500, which she plans to repay in six months, to buy the ingredients she needs to make tacos and hamburgers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

María Cristina inició el negocio para ayudarse económicamente porque su esposo esta pensionado por enfermedad y no labora, por lo que necesitaba mas ingreso por los estudios D. sus hijos. Inicio hace aproximadamente 6 años como siempre le ha gustado L. cocina comenzó haciendo tamales y vendiendo entre los mismos vecinos ahora ya puso un puestecito mas establecido en las afueras D. su casa como es una colonia nueva venD. los fines D. semana tacos hamburguesas y continua con los tamales pero ahora lo hace por pedidos.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para L. compra D. ingredientes para L. venta D. los tacos y hamburguesas

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama T. sells kenkey, a local dish of fermented maize. It is a favorite of the Cape Coast locals. Ama is a single mother of two. Demand for the kenkey is high. Ama plans to use the loan to expand her business, and so increase her profits.
