loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Kibrohon

texts.ru: Киброхон 62 года, воспитывает 5 детей. Занимается она куплей продажей сухофруктов на ентральном рынке города Исфара. Ее основная деятельность - покупка косточек от абрикосов, их раскалывание и продажа зернышек от них. Рынок сухофруктов разделяется на куплю продажу абрикосов, косточек от них и еще зернышек от косточек. Многие семьи в Исфаринском районе работают в этой сфере и этим зарабатывают себе на жизнь. Кроме Киброхон ей помогает ее старшая дочь. Рано утором они выезжают на окрестные рынки, покупают там косточки. привозят их к себе домой и потом в течении дня раскалывают их с помощью специального приспособления. После сортировки зернышек их раскладывают по мешкам и пролают на следующем базаре. Полученная прибыль идет на содержание семьи и частично идет на расширение бизнеса. Узнав о КИВА Киброхон решила обратиться

loans.use: для увеличения оборотного капитала

loans.name: Uyi

texts.en: Uyi O. is 52 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. Uyi sells provisions and drinks. She learned this business for 6 months and started her own business in 1999. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more provisions and drinks for re-sale. Uyi is a LAPO client. She expresses her gratitude to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Nuriyya

texts.en: Nuriyya (her husband is pictured) is married with 2 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. She settled in the Fizuli region in the Horadiz settlement, an area built specifically for IDPs. Nuriyya and her husband have been in this business for 5 years. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy fruits and vegetables to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ruthy

texts.es:
Ruthy es socia del Banco Comunal Imperio. Ruthy es madre soltera, tiene 32 años y 1 hija, Ruthy vende pescados y mariscos en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza los días lunes a viernes, los días sábados vende en el mercado Sr. de Arequipa, los días domingos viaja a la feria de la ciudad de Quinua, Además Ruthy reparte sus productos a las marisquerías y restaurantes de acuerdo a pedidos.

Ruthy necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mariscos y pescados. Ruthy sueña con mejorar su negocio, tener una cámara frigorífica y brindar la mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ruthy is a member of the Imperio Village Bank. She is 32 years old and is a single mother with one daughter. Ruthy sells fish and seafood in the city of Ayacucho’s fish market, which she does every Monday through Friday. On Saturdays, she sells her merchandise in the Sr. de Arequipa market. On Sundays, she travels to the fair in the city of Quinua. Additionally, Ruthy distributes her products to seafood and other restaurants according to orders.

Ruthy needs a loan of 2,100 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of fish and seafood. Ruthy dreams of improving her business, of having a refrigerator room and of providing the best education for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ruthy needs a loan of 2,100 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of fish and seafood.

loans.name: Mrs. Noeurng Taing's Villge Bank Group

texts.en:
This loan will be distributed among the members of a village bank. The group consists of nine people. They all live in the Peak Bang’aong Village in Takeo Province. The group members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Noeurng Taing is a village bank president. She owns land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. However, her land has become less fertile. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers which will help to make her crop more productive. Her husband Mr. Men Meth is a construction worker who earns a small income to help support his family.

Mrs. Noeurng Taing is 31 years old and the mother of three childR.. Two of her childR. are enrolled in the local school. The youngest child is only five years old and too young to work or study.

The picture shows all of the members of the group. Mr. Pol V. could not be present so his wife stands in the picture instead.

All of the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans. This means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. This allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the plantation

loans.name: Thany

texts.en: Mrs. Thany L. is 39 years old and a local farmer, who makes a living growing rice crops, which is a common business for Cambodia’s people. She is a widow with two children, both in secondary school. Thany hopes to have a cow to help her to plow the farmland, but she is lacking money to make that possible; hence, she decided to apply for a loan of 1,500,000 riel ($375) to purchase a cow. Thany lives in the area of Svayloung Commune in Pursat Province.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Houndjénouko

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Madame A. Houndjénouko est âgée de 20 ans et vit actuellement à Avéglidjigan dans la préfecture de VO. Son petit commerce d’alimentation générale et divers lui permet de participer à la gestion de son ménage.
Sa compétence en matière de gestion de fonds lui a permis de maintenir son étalage quoique de petite taille. Elle nécessite un fonds de base sur lequel elle aura à tourner. Cela lui permettra de pouvoir approvisionner son étalage en marchandise et améliorer son revenu.
texts.en:
Ms. Houndjénouko A. is married and a mother with one child. She is 20 years old and currently lives in Avéglidjigan in Vo Prefecture. Her small business in groceries and sundry items enables her to help manager her household. Her competence in managing funds has allowed her to maintain her display of goods, small though it is. She needs working capital that she will operate from. This will enable her to stock up on merchandise and to improve her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her display of basic goods

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty B. is an ambitious business lady in Fortportal. She began her clothing business 5 years ago. She mainly  purchases her stock from Kampala, but now dreams of importing the products from Dubai herself. The loan proceeds  are enabling Betty to purchase more shirts, suits, dresses and trousers to meet the demands of her customers. Betty is a single mother of  two. Her business has enabled her to sustain her family. She hopes to save more funds to purchase a piece of land to build a residence for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts, suits, dresses and trousers

loans.name: Sixta Alejandrina

texts.es:
Sixta es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Sixta es casada, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Sixta elabora pasteles, queques que prepara en su casa y luego lo hornea en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor a las tiendas, por pedidos y también de manera ambulatoria. 
Sixta necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, manteca, leche, azúcar.
Los sueños de Sixta son mejorar su casa, tener una pastelería en un local estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sixta is a member of the Amor Divino (“Divine Love”) cooperative bank. Sixta is married, 53 years old, and has three children. Sixta makes cakes that she prepares at her house and then bakes in a rented oven. She realizes her sales at wholesale to stores, on order, and also as a street vendor. Sixta needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles to invest into the purchase of flour, butter, milk, sugar. Sixta’s dreams include improving her home, having a bakery at a fixed location, and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, butter, milk, sugar.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is a hog raiser.  She is glad that her business is gradually improving.  Due to lack of capital, she is now asking for financial support of at least PHP15,000.00.  She plans to use the loan to buy additional piglets and a supply of feed.  She continuously prays to overcome the struggles that come to her life and patiently works very hard to achieve her goals and to support her youngest daughter while she pursues her bachelor’s degree, which is Valeriana's greatest gift to her. 

Valeriana is married to Eusebio B. and they have four children: Antonio - 26 years old, a soldier; Audie - 23 years old, a hospital attendant; Ariel - 20 years old, a college undergraduate; and the youngest, Anabelle, a college student.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Ouinsi

texts.fr:
Originaire de Takon, commune de sakété, D. Ouinsi est née le 24 Avril 1978 à Ahita Boubouta dans l'un des villages de Takon. Ouinsi est mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont un seul est scolarisé. Oiunsi est une transformatrice de noix de palme dont elle commercialise le produit fini, huile rouge. Pour renforcer son activité génératrice de revenu et constitué son propre capital ce qui lui permettra d'être indépendante financièrement, Ouinsi exprime un besoin de prêt.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Originally from Takon, area of sakété, D. Ouinsi was born on April 24, 1978 in Ahita Boubouta in one of the villages of Takon. Ouinsi is married and the mother of 2 children, of whom only 1 is in school. Oiunsi transforms palm nuts, of which she sells the finished products, red oil. To strengthen her revenue generating activity and build her own capital that will enable her to be financially independent, Ouinsi expresses the need for a loan. The meaning of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, the Fon, is « a path always exists for the poorest ». Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria where the GNP per capita is $1,500. ALIDé offers special 0% loans to very vulnerable people and is part of a group that will soon launch a microinsurance program for the beneficiaries of microcredit.

Translated from French by Isabelle Barres, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy palm nut

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús tiene 29 años, es soltero, vive con una señora, Carmen, quien lo apoya en todo, ya que él es huérfano de madre. Vive en una casa alquilada. Se dedica a comprar ganado vacuno, la carne de estos animales la vende en un puesto del mercado, que es atendido por su tío. Adicionalmente, Jesús tiene un motocarro con el que realiza transporte de pasajeros en la ciudad de Pucallpa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente bien con lo que hace, además le es rentable ya que tiene dos ingresos. Para el futuro, Jesús quiere tener una carnicería y establecerse laboral y económicamente. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, su banco comunal se llama “Nazareno”, donde le gusta trabajar porque todos sus integrantes trabajan coordinamente. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá 200 soles en la reparación de su motocarro; con lo restante comprará reses, en un monto de 1500 soles, cantidad que él mismo completará con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Jesus, a 29-year-old single man, lives with a woman named Carmen, who supports him with everything as he does not have a mother. He lives in a rented home. He buys cows for a living, then sells their meat in a market stand that is run by his uncle. Additionally, Jesus owns a motorcycle taxi with which he transports passengers in the city of Pucallpa. What he likes about his job is that he feels good doing what he does. Furthermore, his businesses are lucrative because he has two sources of income. In the future, Jesus would like to have his own butcher’s shop and establish himself both commercially and financially. This is the first time that he seeks a loan from MFP. His microfinance institute, in which he likes to work because all members collaborate with each other, is called “Nazareno.” He will invest 200.00 PEN of the loan money in repairing his motorcycle taxi. With the rest of the money, he will purchase cattle for the amount of 1,500.00 PEN, paying for the remaining balance with his own savings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi repair and purchase cattle

loans.name: Kwami

texts.fr: Né le 18/03/1973 à Tsévié dans la Préfecture de Zio, Mr K. Kwami est soudeur de formation. Il est spécialisé dans la fabrication de portes en tole. Il sollicite un financement pour ouvrir un atelier de soudure. Le bénéfice tiré de cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et de veiller à l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Born on March 18, 1973 in Tsévié in the Zio Prefecture, Mr. Kwami K. is a licenced welder. He is specialized in making corrugated iron doors. He is requesting a loan to open a welding workshop. The profit from this business will allow him to improve his living conditions and assure the education of his child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: opening a welding workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce and sell traditional soaps

loans.name: Salma Abdul Ghaffar Group

texts.en:
Salma baji is the wife of A. G. who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.

Her husband runs a garment-selling business for which he has a good number of customers. He sells specifically ladies’ garments which he buys from the famous markets of Lahore (named Ichra and Anarkali) and sells to different communities. He has three years of experience in this business.

Salma baji also runs a clothes-sewing business for the purpose of paying the utilities and the children’s school fees. She is applying for a loan to buy garments to expand her husband’s garment-selling business.

Salma baji is the group leader of six other women from her locality:

Haleema baji and Saira hayat baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Kosar parveen baji and Haleema baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

Asia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

Shahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her husband's business

loans.name: Rukhsat

texts.en: Rukhsat is the 51 year old married mother of three children. Her husband is an entrepreneur and Rukhsat started her business ten years ago in order to support her family. All year she sells fruit that she buys from local farmers. With the loan of $475 from Kiva, she plans to increase the range of her goods and to buy more fruit to sell. Rukhsat strives to give her children a better life than they have, including supporting them through a good education. Rukhsat is a well spoken, friendly business woman who is worthy of the support of Kiva lenders. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of her goods and to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys  es socia del Bancomunal Madres del Futuro.
Gladys es  madre soltera tiene 41 años  dos hijos de 27 y 26 años que trabajan, son independientes.
Gladys ayudaba a cocer a su mama y después de dos años se puso a estudiar  corte y confección, puso su taller de costura  en su casa, ella cose ropa para colegios y ropa  a medida, con sus ahorros se ha comprado una combi de segunda, su hijo la maneja, también vende productos de belleza por catalogo.   
Desde que Gladys esta en Finca aprendió a organizar su negocio, a ser puntual y responsable con los prestamos.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 3400 soles, para arreglar su carro va pasar revisión técnica,  y la compra de productos de belleza. 
El sueño de Gladys es crecer en el negocio y comprar otra combi a gas.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank Group “Madres del Futuro” (Mothers of the Future). She is a 41 year old single mother of two children (ages 27 and 26) who work and are independent.

Gladys helped her mother as a cook and after two years studied tailoring, eventually opening a shop in her home. She makes school uniforms. Using her savings she purchased a secondhand minibus, which her son drives. She also sells beauty products by catalog.

Since joining FINCA, Gladys has learned how to organize her business. She is punctual and responsible with her loans. Gladys needs a loan of 3400 soles to fix her car so that it will pass inspection. She will also buy more beauty products. She dreams of growing her business and purchasing another gas-powered minibus.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her vehicle so that it will pass inspection

loans.name: Idugboe

texts.en: I. is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells food.  She is asking for a loan of NGN 40,000 in order to purchase more food to sell. She thanks all her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food

loans.name: Bulubandi North Waida Elizabeth Group

texts.en:
W. Elizabeth is fifty years old and married with eight children, of whom two are still in school, and she is taking care of two dependants who are also going to school. She deals with rice and she has been in her business for one year.

She wants to lift her business from where it is to another level. She is using the loan to purchase more bags of rice for sale. She is an encouraging and hardworking business woman whose dream is to construct a house and have a good life.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice for sale.

loans.name: Jesús Santa

texts.es: Doña Jesús Santa Chalán Y., cuanta con 50  años de edad es Viuda actualmente vive con sus dos  hijos ella  se dedica a Arsenia  elaboración de sudaderos lleva 11 años dedicándose a esta actividad productiva conjuntamente con sus hijos en su pequeño taller que se encuentra en el lugar conocido como Paraje ChiC. del cantón Paqui, municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala actualmente la demanda de su cliente a crecido por lo que ella necesita comprar más materia prima  así poder cubrir la demanda por lo que se acerco alas oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para la compra de más productos, cumpliendo asi con su trabajo para el sostenimiento de su familia.

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris le métier de coiffure ; son mari est directeur d’une école privée. Le couple a un enfant à sa charge. C’est en 2007 que son mari l’a aidé à ouvrir son atelier de coiffure dans le quartier d’Adakpamé à Lomé. Elle a pu fidéliser bon nombre de clientes grâce au travail bien fait qu’elle fournit. Il arrive même que certaines clientes parcourent de longues distances pour venir soigner leurs cheveux chez elle. Elle a besoin d’acheter certains produits cosmétiques et produits de soins en ce moment, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Ce prêt lui permettra également d’apporter certaines modifications de structure dans son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned hairdressing as a trade.  Her husband is the director of a private school.  This couple has one child to support.  In 2007, her husband helped her to open a hair salon in the Adakpamé district in Lomé.  She was able to earn the loyalty of a good number of customers, thanks to the good work she does.  It so happens that some customers come from afar to have their hair done by her.  She needs to buy certain cosmetic products and hair care products at this time.  To do so, she's requesting a WAGES loan.  This loan will also enable her to reorganize her hair salon.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair care products

loans.name: Able God 1 Group

texts.en:
Jaylee N. is the leader of a group of borrowers called Able God 1. He is 47 years old and is married with six children aged 5-25 years old, with educational levels of 9th grade through high school graduate.

Because Jaylee is illiterate, getting into business was an easier means for him and his family to survive. He has run his charcoal-selling business for four years, selling to the residents of Chicken Soup Factory, Gardnerville, in northern Monrovia, Liberia.

Having a good relationship with his customers has been the medium of attracting customers. However, the rainy season is the difficulty Jaylee faces because, when it rains, his charcoal gets wet and that is bad for business.

Jaylee needs this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal wholesale to expand his business. He dreams of establishing a bigger business that will enable him build a house and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is 30 years old and is the single mother of four children aged 3 to 14 years, all of whom go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with four people. She also takes care of additional family members.

Jalia sells secondhand clothes in the Natete markets in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for two years and is servicing her fourth loan. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises but pays daily market dues and pays for a trading license. Jalia sells to all categories of people both in retail and wholesale and, on average, she receives twenty customers a day.

Jalia buys her clothing from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season as she works in an open place.

Jalia wants to use this loan to buy more secondhand clothes. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow stronger and to going directly to importers.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Kungu

texts.en:
Kungu is 47 years old, married and has three daughters. For the last five years, he has made a living as a tailor in Nairobi. When not working as a tailor, he earns extra money by transporting goods by handcart. He has applied for this loan to buy additional materials from which to make clothing.

Kungu is very focused and hardworking, and has been able to improve his business since joining Faulu. His goal for the future is to continue to improve his standard of living and become a well-established entrepreneur.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his business as a tailor.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice G. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Alice owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Alice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.  About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Rice farming is Lolita’s source of income. At 41, she is married and has 6 children. She has children who are in college now, and Lolita works hard to sustain her kids’ education. To gain access to financial services, she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., an MFI in the Philippines. She also wants to improve her business skills. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP. She will use this loan to purchase farm supplies and also buy gasoline for her tractor. She is hopeful that this loan will help her farm grow.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells foodstuffs and fruits to make a living. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members. She is 57 years old, and married with five children. Her husband works as a security guard in a private firm in Benin City, Edo state. She is a LAPO client. LAPO ("Lift Above Poverty Organization") is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes that her business will grow bigger in order to support her family. She needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more fruits and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sunset Group

texts.en:
Comfort is 29 years old, widowed, and the mother of four children, all of whom are currently in school. She enjoys selling goods to make a living, and has been selling foodstuffs such as tubers of yam, plantain, cassava, vegetable oil, etc. for five years now. Comfort treks to farming communities to buy her stock of foodstuffs from local farmers. This saves her from intermediaries who buy from the farmers and resell at a higher price. She wants to use her loan to buy in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers over the Christmas festivities. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school, and part to expand her business to the desired level. She would be grateful for your assistance.
Comfort is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Sunset’. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. The group would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy yam, plantain, cassava, vegetable oil, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en: Lê Nguyễn Thị (10105050007) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà Nội. She is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Hội (3). Lê is married and has one school-aged child. She operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. In 2005, Lê joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,142,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lê is now requesting a new loan of 5,014,000 VND which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her 6th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Phạm Thị T. (10105050010) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 2. M. Thị D. (10105050013) is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop. 3. Bùi Thị N. (10105050011) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Lê Thị Hồng M. (10105050009) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. Nguyễn Thị B. (10105050012) is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Lê Nguyễn Thị (10105050007) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội. Lê là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Hội (3). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương. Lê thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Lê kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND. Vào 2005, Lê đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Lê đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,142,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Phạm Thị T. (10105050010) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. M. Thị D. (10105050013) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng thịt. 3. Bùi Thị N. (10105050011) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Lê Thị Hồng M. (10105050009) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. Nguyễn Thị B. (10105050012) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Elena's Group

texts.en:
Elena O. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 46 years old. Elena is the leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elena is married and has 5 school-aged children. Elena owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income comes from manufacturing & selling bamboo products like "amakan" and sticks for barbecues to local businesses and community members. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Samei

texts.en:
Mrs. Samei K. is a villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is 31 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are attending the public school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

Mrs. Samei K. and her husband, Mr. Arn Tuos, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice and grow vegetables which has allowed them to support their family.

Mrs. Samei K. wants to take a loan of 1,500,000 Riel from AMK to buy a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Angela Adriana

texts.es: Ángela Adriana tiene 62 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado con Fundación pues por la responsabilidad del pago de sus cuotas ha mantenido su record. Esta emprendedora Señora tiene más 4 años de tener este negocio, por lo que ha luchado con muchas dificultades en su vida para salir adelante una de ellas fue tener un tramo propio en el mercado en donde ofrece sus productos, porque no tenía el capital suficiente para esto, con la ayuda de los financiamiento logro obtenerlo. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima queso, mantequilla, maíz entre otras cosas. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Angela Adriana is 62 years old. This is not the first loan that she requested from Fundación and she has maintained a good credit record through the responsible payments of her installments. This enterprising woman has had her business for more than 4 years. In order to get ahead, she has conquered many difficulties in her life. One of those was the obtaining of her own space at the market where she offers her products, she did not have enough money to get one but was able to do so by getting the loans. She is currently asking for this loan to purchase raw materials such as cheese, butter, corn meal and others. Her wish is to improve the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marcedes

texts.en:
Marcedes B. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Marcedes is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marcedes owns & operates a business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Marcedes has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marcedes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from GDMPC. Marcedes is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marcedes from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her business

loans.name: Wilmor Javier

texts.es: Wilmor Javier tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería y ofrecer el servicio de billar. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y salir adelante. El tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que siempre le ha gustado ser un hombre responsable. Al inicio no tenía mucho conocimiento de este negocio, pero con el tiempo fue mejorando, además a sus clientes siempre les ha ofrecido un excelente servicio y les gusta conversar con Wilmor. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima necesaria. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Wilmor Javier, 28, has a grocery store and pool tables. He has been in this line of work for over 5 years. He has always enjoyed working and getting ahead in life. He has two children under his care and he has always liked being a responsible man. At the beginning, he didn’t know this business very well but he improved with time; besides, he always offers good customer service and they like chatting with Wilmor. He is asking for funding to buy needed stock items. His wish is to improve his dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Houch

texts.en:
Mr. Houch I., 24, and his wife, Mrs. Mom Eng, 25, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2007 and have a young daughter. 

Houch has been a blacksmith for three years. His wife is a construction worker. He is asking for his first loan of $150 to fill up the land under his house.

loans.use: To fill up the land under his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing beans

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en: Rodora D.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 33 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. Rodora has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Rodora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rodora is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Tourk

texts.en:
Tourt S., 60, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for the most populated city in the country. She is a tailor and earns an income of USD 2 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more fabrics for tailoring. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for tailoring

loans.name: Kamuyu Group

texts.en:
Fatu K. (pictured left) is the leader of this group called “Kamuyu”. She was born in 1965 in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and the couple has four children – one in primary school and three in secondary school.

With the help of her palm-oil business, Fatu has been able to significantly contribute towards her family’s wellbeing. She has been selling palm-oil (the country’s most favorite cooking oil) for five years now.

Fatu and her group members have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT, a Kiva partner, for the first time. With the help of this loan, each of these borrowers will be able to expand her business, make more sales and make better profit.

Fatu will use her share of the loan to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio S. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 27 years old. Eugenio is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Eugenio owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport business. Eugenio is just starting this business.

In 2009, Eugenio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugenio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. Eugenio is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eugenio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Monica Atieno

texts.en:
Monica is a 45-year-old widow living in Sondu, an upcoming town next to Kisumu City along Lake Victoria. Monica’s husband died and she was left with the responsibility of taking care of four children; two are in high school while the other two are in primary school. 

Monica sells secondhand clothes (locally known as mitumba) at her clothes stall within Sondu. She has been in this business for the last eight years and is experiencing growth due to the high demand for this clothing in the area. This she confirms through her monthly income of KES 10,000 ($125). This is the fourth loan that Monica is getting from Kadet Ltd and she intends to buy more stock for sale and from the profits she anticipates to generate, Monica plans to open a wholesale shop.

Monica is determined to support her children in school and to see that they have a better standard of living. This determination makes her work hard and pay her loans successfully so that she can be considered for subsequent loans.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan moved to the US from Ecuador five years ago. He knew he wanted to start a franchise business and found that the cleaning business was the most affordable. In 2007, he started his own cleaning business and has been running it with his wife.

With ACCION USA’s help, Juan was able to receive his first loan in 2009 to purchase cleaning equipment. Now, Juan is refinancing his loan in order to bring his business to a new level. He is looking to purchase equipment, sign new client contracts, and launch a multimedia marketing campaign and website.

Juan is optimistic that these strategies will help him gain more clients. He is looking to expand his business beyond his local community. The loan will also help him sign larger contracts, which will generate higher revenues for Juan’s business.

Being self-employed and generating income for his family have been Juan’s greatest successes. He has great pride in providing for his wife and two young daughters. Juan enjoys managing his own business and loves the flexibility of his work. 


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and launch a multi-media marketing campaign

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 31 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana coura,  région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce, de condiments alimentaires, de boissons non alcoolisées, de céréales, de tissus et de tubercules.
Ces femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre précédents.  
ADA D. qui est un membre du groupe Laïdou compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, six sacs de 100Kg de céréales.
Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises généralement dans les villages environnants et au marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente sur place et au marché de Fana aux forains venant de Ségou, Sikasso et de Bamako, au comptant, en gros et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les affaires.
texts.en:
The women who belong to the Laïdou group are all married, average 31 years of age with three children each and live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana (in the Fana coura district) in the prefecture of the same name, which lies in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through relatives and neighbors and are active in the sale of condiments, non-alcoholic drinks, cereals, fabrics and tubers. The women in the Laïdou group are on their fifth group loan, having repaid the four previous loans in full. Ada D., a member of the Laïdou group, is planning on using her loan to buy six 100kg sacks of cereals. She gets her supplies generally in the surrounding villages and at the market in Fana. She sells her goods locally and at the market at Fana to fairground people coming from Ségou, Sikasso and Bamako, for cash, wholesale and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 75,000FCFA, which will be used for everyday family expenses; the balance will be reinvested in the business. .

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO (en langue national sénégalaise) signifie entente entre les membre en français. Il est crée depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de WANGO qui l'abrite. Il regroupe 07 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et toutes vendeuses au marché du quartier.

Madame Seynabou M., assise à l'extrême gauche sur la photo, élevant la main droite, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée d'une cinquantaine d'année. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. 

Elle fait du commerce depuis son entrée dans le Banc Villageois. 

Avec son financement de 100.000 francs cfa elle va acheter des tissus en wax et basin qu'elle va revendre à crédit et/ou au comptant dans son quartier et au marché. 

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux, tels que les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et une participation à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group DEGGO (in Senegal’s national language) signifies harmony between members in French. It was created after the inauguration of the WANGO Banc Villageois where it is based. It consists of 7 women who live in the same neighborhood and are merchants at the neighborhood market. Mrs. Seynabou M., seated at the extreme left in the photo raising her right hand, is the leader of the group. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. She has been in business since joining the Banc Villageois. With financing of 100,000 CFA, she is going to buy wax and basin (damask) fabric that she will sell in her neighborhood and at the market for cash or on credit. Her goal is to provide for her family’s needs, such as her children’s school fees and contributions to daily expenses.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wax and damask fabrics

loans.name: Aydalina Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Aydalina del Carmen B. G. ella es trabajadora activa de la Alcaldía municipal San Rafael del Sur   ella  se desempeña  como conserje, tiene  dos año de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para cambio de techo de unos de los cuartos de su casa, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Aydalina del Carmen B. G. is an active worker at the San Rafael del Sur town hall where she has been employed for the past two years as a councilor. She is currently married and has two school-age children.

She has had two loans through CEPRODEL and has used each one to purchase construction materials for housing improvements. She is requesting this loan to change the roof of some of the rooms of house. The CEPRODEL loans have benefited her greatly because she has improved her and her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To pay for cement, stone, gravel, and iron

loans.name: Suyarbek

texts.ru: Шамуратов Суярбек проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 41 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Суярбек высшего образования не имеет. Занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. В этом году он хочет, посеет пшеницу.
texts.en: Suyarbek S. lives in the Shahrituz Region. 41 years of age. Married, with three children. His wife works at a cooperative farm. Suyarbek does not have a college degree. He is a farmer. He has a big land plot next to his house and grows vegetables. He has a lot of experience in this area. He is taking out a loan to purchase seed and mineral fertilizers. This year he would like to plant wheat.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Teresiah Waithira

texts.en:
Teresiah has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  She is 37 years old, a single mother of one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend  and this will be her fourth loan.  She repaid for all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the cash to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings which she will plant after harvesting the maize in her farm.

Teresiah is very hard-working.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings to plant

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en:
Altansuvd B. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and infant baby in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband is handicapped and receives a monthly disability pension of 41,400 MNT. At first, she started helping her mother to make a variety of souvenirs and crafts using beads and pearls.

Since 2008, she has been operating her crafts business by herself in her home. Her husband also helps with her business. For the future, Altansuvd says, "My main business goal is to expand my business and establish a new production factory." She is a very hard working and talkative person and is requesting a 640,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of beads and pearls in order to make a variety of handicraft products.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of beads and pearls.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle P. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Annabelle is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle provides repair and repainting services for various vehicles like multi-purpose cabs, jeepneys and cars to local community members. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the second loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab O. is a middle-aged woman who is a widow. Her 2 children live separately: her son is working in Russia, her daughter is married and has her own family.

Zainab increases her regular income by breeding cattle.  Currently, she has a cow with a heifer.  Several years ago her son helped her to start this business by putting up some amount of money.

In order to increase her cattle stock and enlarge the family budget, Zainab wants to purchase more cattle for keeping and fattening. For this purpose she needs to get a loan. Her future plans include building a bath-house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Thise Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He started to work in the motorcycle repair field in 2007 and in parallel he began to work as a home painter in 2008 because he is the only income provider for the family in cooperation with his father and wants to increase the  family’s profit. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase various supplies to complete his work and be able to increase his efficiency and his sales.

loans.use: To purchase various supplies

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde, de 31 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nilson (30)  y sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente Matilde ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a su café y plátanos los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es en ese lugar  donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, ya lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo tiene planeado adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.Es el  segundo préstamo de Matilde con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, y en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida.Matilde tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados, en la compra de cantidad de  abono y fertilizantes, que necesita  para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Matilde is 31 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Nilson (30) and her three small children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through hard work, Matilde has managed to make progress with her crops.  Every morning she gets up very early to irrigate and care for her coffee and bananas which she will later sell in the city of Pichanaki since this is where she receives the best prices for her products.  What she most likes about her work is being able to enjoy the freedom of working in her fields.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be working her land.  Over time, she plans to get her land ready to plant a lot more coffee.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

This is Matilde's second loan with MFP and she knows that this loan will help her in making progress and developing her business.  For this reason, she is prepared to make all her repayments on time.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank and, for this reason, she is a very well-liked member.  Matilde plans to invest the 500 Peruvian soles she has requested in buying a quantity of manure and fertilizers that she needs to improve the quality of her land.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to improve her crops

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar vive en la casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la localidad de Pucarani. El señor se dedica a la crianza de ganado ubicada en el mismo domicilio. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene tres hijos.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera para mejorar sus ingresos por concepto de venta de leche a la Planta Industrializadora de leche PIL.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y será canalizado a través de Kiva..
texts.en:
Edgar lives in his own house, located in the vicinity of Pucarani. He is dedicated to raising cows at the place of his residence. This is the principal source of income for the maintenance of Edgar and his 3 children.

The loan will be used to buy a milk cow to improve his income. Edgar sells milk to the Industrial Milk Plant, PIL. This is his first loan with Impro and it is being channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: TO BUY A MILK COW TO IMPROVE HIS INCOME FROM MILK SALES

loans.name: Ita

texts.en:
Ita K. is 34 years old. He is married to Nalamae K. and is the father of three children. He operates a Kiosk in a rental premise, which he has been doing for the last seven years.
  
He learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group within his locality who is registered with KADET. This will be his first loan and he plans to buy more stock of goods for the shop, e.g., rice, wheat flour, tea leaves, cooking fat, etc. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest and educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a prominent businessman.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods for the shop, such as rice, wheat flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Kyandago Development Group A, Kihihi

texts.en: N. Loy of Kyandago Development Group A is a 37-year-old determined, hardworking, and happily married mother of 5 children. She is a multi-business lady with a business of selling timber and wood from Bwindi, as well as being involved in agriculture and more specifically poultry. With the timber business, she has worked with her husband for 6 years, and she is grateful that the business has been moving smoothly because of the good market, especially from carpenters. She is able to make 280,000/= as monthly profits. Loy needs a loan to be able to buy more trees for her timber business.

loans.use: to buy more trees for selling timber.

loans.name: Twunganirane Dusabirana Group

texts.fr: Janvier Niyibizi est notre client depuis 2011, il est marié,il a 4 enfants entre 7 et 1 an, le lieu et pays de naissance est Bugesera – Rwanda, il est membre du groupe solidaire appelé Twunganirane Dusabirana. Il fait le commerce de détaille de récolte (haricot, sorgho, chèvres,…), et son prêt c’est pour acheter ses articles. Il veut augmenter son capital pour améliorer ses activités de son commerce. Son ambition et vision c’est d’élever ses enfants jusqu'à un niveau élevé. Et faire du bien pour sa famille.
texts.en: Janvier Niyibizi has been our client since 2011. He is married and has four children, ages 1 to 7. His place of birth is Bugesera, in Rwanda. He is a member of the solidarity group called Twunganirane Dusabirana.  His retail business involves farm products (beans, sorghum, goats...), and his loan is for buying his supplies. Janvier wants to increase his capital to improve his commerce. His ambition and vision is to raise his children well and to do some good for his family.

loans.use: Buying supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To replace the old tires of an auto-rickshaw with new tires

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Madame AISSATOU B. est une femme de 47 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 08 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WASSADOU-DÉPÔT depuis le 07 août 2009. Elle a 4 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans contrainte.

Elle est vendeuse de fruits, précisément des bananes. Elle pratique cette activité avant même qu'elle en soit membre du Banc Villageois.

Avec son crédit elle ira toutes les semaines s'approvisionner en bananes à bord champ et revendre au marché du village.

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins et aussi participer à la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissatou B. is a 47-year old widow and the mother of eight. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Wassadou-Dépôt since August 2009. She has obtained loans four times in the past and always repaid them without difficulty.

She sells fruits, more precisely bananas. She had been in this line of business even before joining Banc VIlleagois. With this loan she is going to stock up on bananas every week, buying them from the farmers and reselling at the village market. Her goal is to grow her business in order to be able to support herself and also help pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits (bananas) for resale

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
'Mujeres en Victoria 1 & 2' is a group comprised of ten women. Each member comes from an extremely poor area in Santo Domingo. Each member sees this as a chance to change their future and provide their families with a better life. 

Immacula is one of these members. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are already grown. Only the youngeS. is still living with her and her husband. With these loans Immacula hopes to inveS. in her Comedor - a little restaurant - where she sells lunch to her neighbors and people working around the community. 

This is Immacula´s third loan with Esperanza International. She has taken a step toward improving her business by investing every loan to expand her business, which has been operating ten years already, in order to serve her clients. She started taking loans from Esperanza almoS. two years ago, after the program went to her community and a group of five women decided to start this group. Her moS. difficult challenges are to have her business improve and to have a good house and a vehicle for work and family.

Thank you for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, soda, and juices.

loans.name: G.s. Buenaventura Group

texts.es: Ayda Ruth, Evelia y Antonio conforman el grupo solidario Buenaventura. Evelia se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella tiene mucha experiencia con sus clientes, ya que ellos siempre están buscando variedad en sus productos pues son vecinos que les gusta mucho la atención que brinda Evelia. Ha demostrado ser una persona que disfruta de su actividad y que se encuentra al tanto de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Este financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, detergentes, sopas, pastas, refrescos, pan, enlatados, galletas y grano básicos.
texts.en: Ayda Ruth, Evelia and Antonio make up the Buenaventura solidarity group.  Evelia owns a grocery store.  She has had her business for more than 10 years.   She has two dependent children in her care.  Evelia has a lot of experience with her customers who are always looking for variety in her products.  They are neighbors who really like the service that Evelia provides.  She has shown herself to be a person who enjoys her business and who is aware of what her customers are requesting.  She will use this loan to buy candies, detergents, soups, pasta, soft drinks, bread, canned goods, cookies and basic grains.

loans.use: to buy candies, detergents, soups, pasta, soft drinks, bread, canned goods, cookies and basic grains

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABALY est composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter le niveau de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire de la restauration et le commerce d’arachide grillée avec Marama 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Marama qui est la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, 4 sacs de 100 kg de graines d’arachides. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à BOUGOUNI et auprès paysans des villages environnants pour ensuite faire sa vente, après la grillade,  en détail, au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000 FCFA  qui sera intégralement réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group SABALY is composed of four women, all married, who average 30 years of age, and two children each. The women live in nuclear conjugal families, with their children and husband. And they reside in the Torakabougou district of the city of BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of commerce, kinship, and community. 

Concerned about further satisfying their customers and increasing the level of their businesses, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to do commerce in food service and in roasted peanuts, as is the case with Marama. They are on their second group loan. The previous loan was repaid properly.

With this new loan, Marama, who is the group's president, intends to buy four 100-kg sacks of peanuts. She gets her supplies locally in BOUGOUNI from peasant farmers in the surrounding villages. And then she sells the peanuts retail after having roasted them. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men at the main market of BOUGOUNI. With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will all be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy roasted peanuts

loans.name: Virginia Victoria

texts.es: Virginia tiene su negocio que es la venta de tortillas, leche, leña y frijoles. es una persona my responsable por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita créditos. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, con mucho sacrificio ha logrado tener esta actividad. En el municipio donde ella vive se llama guasaule, la mayoría de sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y familiares, pues Virginia siempre ha sido una persona carismática y bondadosa, tiene 4 hijos delo cuales tiene que hacerse cargo. Solicita este crédito para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, y comprar frijoles.
texts.en: Virginia has a business selling tortillas, milk, firewood and beans.  She is a very responsible person so this isn’t her first loan request.  Her business is located in her home.  She has attained this activity with much sacrifice.  The municipality she lives in is called Guasaule and most of her customers are friends, neighbors and relatives because Virginia has always been a charismatic, kind person.  She has four children in her care.  She is asking for the loan to buy corn, lime powder, firewood and beans.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, firewood and beans.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has operated his tailor shop in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is 43 years old, married and has three school-going children. 

Daniel was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more textiles and items he uses, i.e threads and buttons in bulk. 

In the future, Daniel hopes to become a leading tailor in Naivasha and to get big contracts for making clothes for organizations and different groups of people.

loans.use: to buy more textiles and items he uses, i.e threads and buttons.

loans.name: Nillian

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Nillian works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing and personal products business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income raising pigs. Nillian is seeking to borrow 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more clothing and products to sell for her ready-to-wear clothing and personal products business.

Nillian has been sustaining her business activities through 4 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing and products to sell

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children.
Since 2006 Bahaa has run a barber shop where he offers shaving and massage services. He has long experience and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. He is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate and change the decor in his shop and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate and change the decor in his shop and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Ephroca

texts.en:
She is a 27-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with two children ages one and five years old. The eldest is in school. Her husband is a driver.

For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal and this business has enabled her to feed her family.

She needs a loan to purchase more charcoal that she will sell for a profit.

With future profits, she plans to save so she can purchase a motorcycle for her husband’s business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: One Word-Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “One Word II” group. They are small businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadija. Kadija is 27 years old.  She was born in Lunsar town but is currently residing in Makeni together with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is a mine worker and 2 of her children are attending primary school (the other is not yet of school-going age). For 3 years now, Kadija has been baking and selling breads. With this loan, she will buy 5 bags of flour and 1 bag of sugar to bake a larger quantity of breads for sale.

loans.use: buy flour and sugar to bake bread for sale

loans.name: Mardelia

texts.en:
Mardelia is a 59-year-old-widow. She has four children: Mahmud, 38; Fatmawati, 36; Sawaludin, 32; and Martini, 31. Three of them are married and live separate from Mardelia.  

In order to cover her daily needs Mardelia is running a room rental business. She has been running this business for years.
