She and her husband built two small rooms, each constructed with palm branch walls and a zinc roof. After several years she built four new rooms to be rented, constructed with brick walls. After the death of her husband, Mardelia initiated a kiosk business to generate more income. 

Mardelia wants to renovate the two rooms that were constructed with palm branch walls and zinc roofs, as they are not feasible for rent anymore. Therefore she is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She is expecting to get the loan soon so she can buy building materials, which are zinc, cement and sand to renovate her rental rooms.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate two rental rooms.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira de 53 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Edelmira desde hace muchos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (aves, ovejas y cerdos), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Margarita es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia para que logren su objetivo propuesto.
texts.en:
53-year-old Edelmira lives with her family in her own home.  The only service her house receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural part of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Edelmira has been raising and selling farmyard animals (birds, sheep and pigs) for many years.  Her pens are located behind her home and they are appropriate for the animals.  She feeds her animals balanced feed, pasture and natural grains so that they reach an optimal level of development and she is able to sell them in the different markets in her area, making good profits with which to cover her household expenses.

Edelmira has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their respective feed.  She will use the profits that she makes from selling her animals to repay her loan and enjoy a better quality of life.  Edelmira is a person who, through her hard work and determination, has known how to get her family ahead in life so that they are able to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy animals and their respective feed

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Angela has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Angela is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Angela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, aprendió el oficio de la agricultura por su padre, lleva 17 años de estar dedicado al cultivo, a través de las cosechas ha alimentado a la familia, pudiendo vender una parte de la cosecha para generar ingresos.
Actualmente el solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, semilla, herbicidas para el cultivo de maíz, maicillo y ajonjolí, el préstamo será una gran ayuda para solventar la compra de insumos agrícolas.
El objetivo de Jaime es mejorar los cultivos, apoyar a su familia y velar por sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Jaime is a farmer and lives with his wife and three children.  He learned the agriculture trade from his father and has been growing crops for 17 years.  He is able to feed his family with part of the produce he harvests and sells the rest to generate an income.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicides to plant corn, millet and sesame.  The loan will be of great help in purchasing the farm supplies he needs.

Jaime's goal is to improve his crops and support his family by making sure they have everything they need.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Rene Omar

texts.es:
En Subtiava un barrio muy pintoresco y conocido en la ciudad de León, habita el  señor René , un comerciante , dueño de molinos, tiene 54 años de edad,  casado, tiene 3 hijos de 23,22 y 17 años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos es ingeniero en telemática los otros dos aun están estudiando. Este negocio ha sido traspasado de generación en generación, sus padres y abuelos eran quienes se hacia cargo de este negocio. Pero el tiene aproximadamente 23 años de tenerlo por cuenta propia. 
El solicita el préstamo para acondicionar y hacerle reparaciones a su local, mantenimiento a su molinos  donde tiene su molino, e invertir en compra de granos básicos .Esto le ayudara a dar una mejor presentación a su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Uno de sus planes futuros es expandirse, poner otros molinos en lugares diferentes de la ciudad de León, su meta próxima es ayudar a sus dos hijos menores a finalizar sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
René lives in Subtiava, a very picturesque and well-known neighborhood in the city of León.  He is a business man who owns mills.  He is 54 years old, married, and has three children who are 23, 22, and 17 years old.  His oldest son is a telematics engineer; the other two are still in school.  This business has been passed down from generation to generation; his parents and grandparents were the ones who were in charge of this business.  However, he has run it on his own for approximately 23 years.

He is asking for the loan to equip and repair his business, to maintain his mills on site and to invest in the purchase of staple grains.  This will help him give his business a better appearance and provide better service to his customers.  One of his future plans is to expand by setting up more mills in different areas of the city of León.  His next goal is to help his two youngest children finish their professional studies.

loans.use: to equip and repair his business, to maintain his mills on site and to invest in the purchase of staple grains

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal is from the village of Teleti. He is 67 years old and lives with his wife, Tsisana. Jemal and Tsisana are both retired and get a monthly pension (in total $120 USD per month). They have children who already have their own families and live separately. Jemal and Tsisana assist financially their children. 

They earn a living through agriculture. They have three milk cows and produce various dairy products, which are sold locally. The average monthly income of the family, including pensions, is 500 laris (approximately $300 USD).

Jemal requested credit for purchasing an additional milk cow. They will be able to produce and sell more dairy products and increase the income received from the dairy farm by 30 – 35 percent. Jemal plans to use the earned profit in finalizing the construction process of their own house.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, es comerciante de medicinas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos que estudian, son pequeños, él está dedicado al negocio de la venta de medicinas desde hace más de 10 años, se traslada en una motocicleta a ofrecer la mercadería por los lugares aledaños.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicamentos, para surtir el negocio, la inversión será en la compra de sueros, vitaminas, analgésicos, antibióticos.
Esta oportunidad con el préstamo, le dará a José una mejoría en el negocio, aprovechando para tenerlo surtido y satisfacer la demanda a los clientes. La aspiración de José es crecer en el negocio, tener un puesto de venta fijo, bien surtido y además mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José's business is selling medicines.  He lives with his wife and two children who are in school.  José has been selling medicines for more than 10 years.  He gets around on a motorbike and offers his merchandise to people in neighboring towns.

José is currently requesting a loan to buy medicines and stock his business.  He will invest his loan in buying saline solutions, vitamins, painkillers and antibiotics.

This loan will help José to improve his business.  He will better stock it and be able to meet his customer demand.  José's aspirations are to grow his business, to have a fixed sales location and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy saline solutions, vitamins, painkillers and antibiotics

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El señor Rogelio es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor, desde hace 3 años cuenta con su negocio de venta de blocks, que el elabora con sus manos y maquinas especiales que lo ayudan. Para hacer este tipo de material se necesita arena, cascajo, cemento y agua que el mismo bate para colocarlo en la maquina moldeadora y lo deja secar al sol para que este resistente. Rogelio compra los mejores materiales para que su producto este fuerte y en buenas condiciones.  En este momento necesita comprar material para seguir generando mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Mr Rogelio is a very hard-working and enterprising man. He has sold bricks for three years. He makes them by hand and also uses special machines. In order to make them, he needs sand, gravel, cement and water. He mixes it himself in preparation for putting it into the molding machine, and lets it dry in the sun so that it gets strong. Rogelio buys the best materials so that his product will be strong and of good quality. He now needs to buy materials in order to keep making a good income.

loans.use: to buy basic materials to make bricks.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 51 years old and single. She is from Sinusa, Ozamis City. Dinah has been in this particular business for 10 years, and she earns 3000 PHP a month.

Dinah joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dinah is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase Guso (seaweed). This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase Guso (seaweed).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw maaterials with which to weave fabric.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica esta solicitando esta crédito con nosotros porque se dedica a la venta de ropa y le esta haciendo falta comprar algunas pacas de ropa ya que únicamente tiene ropa de verano y desea en invertir en comprar de frio ya que es la que se vende mas ahorita lo que son bufandas, sudadera pants, chamaras  y al surtirse tundras mas clientes y podrá tener un ingreso mejor.
Por las mañanas hace la limpieza de una casa ya que al estar separada tiene que solventar los gatos de la casa por si sola, tiene 2 hojas una ya se caso y la otra aun vive en la casa y pronto se recibirá de la universidad quien es su mayor orgullo.
texts.en:
Verónica is requesting a loan because she sells clothes for a living and lacks sufficient inventory.  She currently has only summer clothing and wants to invest in cold-weather clothing, since scarves, sweat pants, and jackets are selling most right now.  If she stocks up, she will have more clients and may earn more income.

She works as a house cleaner in the morning to meet her household expenses, for which she is solely responsible since her separation.  She has two daughters, one of whom is married and the other who will soon be graduating from the university.  This is Verónica's greatest source of pride.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Arshaan's Group

texts.en:
Arshaan is married and 56 years of age. She is illiterate and spends her time staying at home and carrying out her household responsibilities. She lives with her two brothers and three children. Her elder brother is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to passengers and school children. He is a very experienced driver and drives his auto rickshaw very safely. Her eldest son is also a rickshaw driver while the others are studying. 

Arshaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her son who wants to repair his rickshaw. By doing this, he will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and will increase his income. Arshaan is very confident that her son will be able to achieve good success in his business after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Arshaan.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and sells home products in the Philippines.

Maria requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy home products to sell to customers.

Maria has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to build a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 27 years old and lives in Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Joan has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Joan has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Joan hopes to have a fishing boat to earn money. Joan is an honest, hardworking mother and has a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Asteria is in her early 30s and is married with four children, three of whom go to school while one is still small. She has been a tailor since 1994. She also sells second-hand shoes and fabrics. She works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 
This will be her her eleventh loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling second-hand shoes and fabrics, buy a TV set and a radio, pay school fees and meet household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is requesting this loan to buy more second-hand shoes for resale. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.
Asteria will share this loan with her loan group "Ustawi", which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers with his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more bicycles. His business goal is to own a motorcycle within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more bicycles

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen A. a 49 years old woman, full of life to carry out her business activities all days through. As a result, she maintains her 100% repayment of LAPO loan. Helen is in need of the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy Chickens and Turkeys in large quantity

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Lomé, Mrs. Marie A. is a mother of two (02) children. With an unemployed husband and without other means, she sells iced water at the market to be able to provide for the family. In order to build her business, she is asking for a fourth credit of $800 to buy a larger freezer. The purchase of this large freezer will enable her to have enough fresh water to satisfy all the customers in time because they often complain about the lack of fresh water. Once this is accomplished, the standard of living of the family will undoubtedly improve.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1972 à Lomé, Madame A. Marie est mère de deux (02) enfants. Avec un mari chômeur et sans moyens, elle vend de l’eau glacée au marché pour subvenir au besoin de la famille. En vue de développer son commerce, elle sollicite un quatrième crédit de $800 pour s’acheter un congélateur plus grand. L’acquisition de ce grand congélateur lui permettra d'avoir assez d'eau fraîche pour satisfaire tous les clients à temps car ces derniers se plaignent souvent du manque d’eau fraîche. Ceci réalisé, le niveau de vie de la famille sera amélioré à coup sûr.

loans.use: To buy a larger freezer for selling iced water

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk S., a 40-year-old mother of two children, lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works in a farm with her husband growing and cultivating variety of crops and feeding domestic animals such as pigs, ducks, and chickens. This couple usually makes about $3 per day in revenue. One of her children works at a nearby garment factory, and another is a construction worker. They nomally contribute all their wages to the household every month. S. hopes the loan will help her purchase more seeds for her plantation and to repair her house from leaking during the rainy season.  In the future, Savoeu hopes to buy more animals to raise and to make additional income from her plantation.

loans.use: To buy seeds and to repair her house

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs Pich S. is 34 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She is a grocer and earns 4 dollars a day. Her husband is a farmer and earns 3 dollars a day. They have one child. 
Mrs Pich S. would like to buy a cow and a horse to expand their farm.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and a horse to expand their farm

loans.name: Docas

texts.en: Mrs. Docas E. is 51 years old, married, and a mother of six.  She sells beads and decorating materials.  She also provides decorating services at special occasions such as weddings and marriage ceremonies.  She started her business in 1997.  She has the intention of increasing the size of her business with a loan of US $625.  She is the secretary of her union (LAPO).

loans.use: To buy more beads and decorating materials

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Thanks to God I have my home. Still, the area is very small. I would like to build another room so that we can be more comfortable now that my parents, three siblings and I share the space. I ask for a loan of $1,200 to build another rooms and expand my home.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Gracias a dios tengo mi casa pero el espacio es muy reducido, así es que me gustaría hacer un cuarto más para estas más comodos ya que vivimos mis papas, mis 3 hermanos y yo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para constuir un cuarto y ampliar más mi vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of an additional room

loans.name: Hagah

texts.en:
Hagah B. sells yams. She is married and has four children. Her husband is also a trader. Hagah is a hardworking woman. She travels to the northern part of Ghana to bring yams to sell. She also supplies schools with large quantities of yams. She is well known at Tantri, where she sells her yams.

One major challenge that Hagah faces is that she is not able to bring the yams in large quantities because of lack of capital. She always receives orders from her customers for the supply of yams. She is therefore asking for a loan of US $1,000 so that she can bring the yams in large quantities from the northern region to supply to her customers.

loans.use: To bring the yams in large quantities from the northern region and supply to her customers.

loans.name: Lumanai

texts.en:
Lumanai is from the village of Manunu. She is one of our oldest members and one of those most reliable and trustworthy. She is running a Cattle Farm as well as her plantation. She is forty years of age and married with five kids. Her husband does not work and therefore there is no regular income for her and the family besides what she earns.

Lumanai is looking at improving her businesses through this loan and also some part of it will be used for house improvement and paying school fees for her children. She is a hard-working and active woman and she is hopes in future to get a higher loan amount for more improvement so her family will prosper.

loans.use: buy wire, chemicals, and tools for the plantation

loans.name: Kitega F(V) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Resty N.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to increase her stock. Resty is 35 years old and she is single. She has 5 children who range in age from 5 to 18. Each week, Resty makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profits from her business. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to expand her grocery business.

Resty is joined in her small group by Hadija N., Betty S., Jenniffer Nasaka, and Aisha N.. Hadija N. is currently in the business of running a boutique and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy more cosmetics and clothes to sell. Betty S. is currently in the business of dairy farming. She is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to buy more poultry feed. Jenniffer Nasaka currently runs a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 100,000 to buy more salon equipment. Aisha N. is currently in the business of running a canteen. Aisha is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to increase her stock.

loans.use: To invest in the businesses

loans.name: Khob

texts.en: Mrs. Khob S. is a widow and works with her children making small mills (made of wood or hard stone). She sells them door-to-door or sometimes to the market in her village. She normally earns around $3 a day. She has seven children, three of whom are married and live away from home. She aims to get a loan from Kiva to purchase more stones to make mills. (Mrs. Khob S. is pictured with her daughter.)

loans.use: To purchase more stones to make mills

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru:
Hanifa N. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 60 years old, a widow with seven children. She has an incomplete secondary education and is in the animal husbandry business. She buys calves on the market at a lower price, feeds them and resells on the market later. Hanifa's husband has passed away and she has to take care of the whole family by herself. Animal husbandry is the main source of income for her family. She plans to use the loan to buy another calf. She will pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нурова Ханифа жительница города Вахдат. Возраст клиенки 60 лет. Вдова, имеет 7 детей. Образование неполное среднее. Клиентка занимается животноводством.Она покупает бычков по низкой цене , откармливает их и перепродает на рынке . У Ханифы умер муж и поэтому такую большую семью приходится содержать ей .Животноводство является основным источником дохода ее семьи.На кредит клиентка планирует купить очередного бычка для откормки. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Sandra Erika

texts.es:
My house is not secure and it does not have barrier equipment. At this point in time, I would like to place protections on the windows and doors. I request a loan of $600 in order to put in place protections in my house to gain a little more security for my family.

This story was translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer. Mi casa no esta nada segura le esta haciendo falta barias cosa pero por el momento solo me gustaría ponerle las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas. Solicito un préstamo de $600.00 dlls para la colocación de las protecciones en mi casa a así estar un poco más segura mi familia.

loans.use: To make protection barriers to her house.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N. has a retail shop in Katosi that has been in business since 1992. She is a widow with four children and she cares for three orphaned children, including paying their school fees, clothing, medical care and shelter. She has been our client for ten years as a member of Kewerimidde women’s group; she has had a 100% loan repayment rate. Her dream is to transform her shop into a wholesale venue but because she is still paying too much in school fees, it’s not a thing for tomorrow. Still, she has hope through hard work and determination. She would like a loan to help her buy more goods for her shop (sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, maize flour) and to complete the construction of additional commercial rooms for rent, which are just next to her shop.

loans.use: Sarah Nakato needs to buy more sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice, maize flour for the shop plus cement, sand and iron sheets for her incomplete commercial house.

loans.name: Mónica Tarcila

texts.es:
Monica is a woman who puts all her energy into her work and the wellbeing of her family. For this reason she took the brave and tough decision to earn income by making bricks. Monica has been doing this hard work for 4 years. Over this time she has seen her business grow significantly. Monica doesn’t want to stop and needs to continue purchasing raw materials for making bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Mónica es una mujer que pone toda su energía en el trabajo y por el bienestar de su familia. Para ello tomó la firme y valiente decisión de generar ingresos mediante la fabricación de ladrillos. Ella lleva ya 4 años con esta ardua labor y con el paso de los años ha visto crecer significativamente su negocio. Mónica no quiere detenerse y necesita seguir adquiriendo la materia prima para sus ladrillos.

loans.use: Increased capital for purchasing raw materials

loans.name: Johnbull

texts.en: Johnbull O. is 44 years old and married with 4 children. He is lives in Benin City. He specializes in the installation and repair of streetlights. He learned this business for 7 years.He started his own business in 2000. Johnbull needs the loan amount of US$ 525 to buy more electrical materials to enhance his business. Johnbull is a LAPO client and he expresses his gratitude to all who make the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more electrical materials for his business

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is the mother of 2 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region in the Bala Bahmanli village. She was born in 1987. She has run a cattle breeding business for 5 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy two calves to improve her cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 43 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada y progenitora de tres hijas de 22 años (casada) 18 y 16 años de edad (solteras). Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Es una de las socias antiguas del Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría”- Yunguyo. Al inicio obtuvo un crédito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles, con el que compró 02 quintales de ají. Doña Claudia manifiesta que a los 07 años de edad quedó huérfana de padre, por falta de medios económicos a los 12 años de edad hasta los 18 años de edad trabajaba como empleada del hogar en la ciudad de Lima, ahorró su dinero y se vino a realizar negocio de cebolla y tomate que compraba en Puno y vendía en Yunguyo. A los 20 años de edad se casó, desde entonces empezaron el negocio de la venta de ají, que compran en el Departamento de Tacna (Sama, Ite, Locumba). Vende en la ciudad de Desaguadero los viernes.

Con este crédito de S/.3,000 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagao en 04 cuotas, comprará 03 sacos de ají, cada saco está valorizado en S/.800 Nuevos Soles (ají de primera), que será comercializado en Desaguadero.

Su sueño es tener una casa en la ciudad de Tacna y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 43-year-old married mother of 3 daugthers ages 22 (married), 18, and 16 (both single). She completed elementary school and lives in Acari, in the district and province of Yunguyo Ð Puno.

She is one of the senior members of the “Fe y Alegría" (Faith and Happiness) microfinance institute in Yunguyo. In the beginning, she obtained a 300.00 PEN loan with which she purchased about 200 lbs of Peruvian hot peppers. Ms. Claudia tells us that her father passed away when she was 7 years old, so due to the lack of financial resources, she had to work as a housekeeper in the city of Lima from age 12 through age 18. She saved up her money and established a business buying onions and tomatoes in Puno, then selling them in Yunguyo. At 20 years of age, she got married. Ever since then, she and her husband started a Peruvian hot pepper business. They buy the peppers in the department of Tacna (Sama, Ite and Locumba) and sell them in the city of Desaguadero on Fridays.

With this loan of 3,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase 3 sacks of top-quality Peruvian hot peppers, valued at 800.00 PEN, which will be sold in Desaguadero.

She dreams of owning a house in the city of Tacna, and would like for her children to receive an education and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase three sacks of Peruvian hot peppers

loans.name: Hafiza's Group

texts.en:
Hafiza baji is the wife of M. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the last 20 years. She completed her education until 8th standard. She couldn’t study further due to the poor conditions of her household, and her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son is in 4th standard. Her elder daughter reads in kindergarten. The others are not of an age for going to school.

Hafiza baji’s husband has a shoe selling business. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. Hafiza baji is a housewife and also sews clothes for her neighbors, charging fees. She takes $3 to $4 per dress. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now, she is applying for a loan to buy more shoes for her husband’s shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shaila baji wants a loan to buy iron to resell. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Safia baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rubina baji wants a loan to buy leather to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to resell

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen H., 26, is married, has a child, and lives in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She is a housewife, taking care of the household and looking after her child. In addition, Pen H. grows rice crops, but only enough for the family's own needs. Pen H.'s husband (on the right side of the photo) earns income working as a construction worker and blacksmith. On average, he makes around US$4 per day. He has been engaged in the profession since 2000, having learned it from his father. 
In a typical month, Pen H.'s family spends US$45 on food. To help generate more money to support the family, Pen H. is now applying for a loan of US$400 to be able to purchase a cow that would be used for plowing the farmland as well as for transporting the rice crops during the harvest season. Previously, Pen H. had to hire a hand tractor to plow the land. She believes that the loan will allow her to save money and earn more profit.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Sossou Mawugnan

texts.fr:
Né en 1956 à Hédomé, Monsieur B. Sossou Mawugnan réside aujourd’hui dans le même village. Instituteur, il est marié et père de dix (10) enfants. C’est avec son salaire qu’il se débrouille pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 
Conscient de l’insuffisance de ses revenus financiers, il veut les diversifier à travers des activités génératrices de revenus. Ainsi, il a en projet l’achat de taxi moto pour compenser la conjoncture financière. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit afin d’acheter une moto qu’il mettra en circulation.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Hédomé, Mr. Sossou Mawugnan B. resides in the same village. An elementary school teacher, he is married and the father of ten. With his salary, he gets by, providing for his family. Conscious of his insufficient income, he wants to diversify it through income-generating work. For this, he has plans for the purchase of a moto-taxi to make up for the financial situation. And so, he is requesting a loan to buy a motor-bike that he will put into service.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor-bike

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad M. is a 28-year-old farmer who keeps cattle and sells them for meat production. He lives with his parents in the small village of Saatli, Azerbaijan. Elshad works very hard every day of his life to provide a better life for his family. He wakes up early in the morning, cleans the shed, and pastures the calves. Currently, Elshad has three calves and he would like to purchase two more calves to increase his profit, especially since he is going to be married this year. Development of his business is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Herlinda es casada, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Herlinda vende pescados en el mercado Covadonga, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, los demás días trabaja como madre cuidadora de un programa de niños.
Herlinda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Los sueños de Herlinda son ampliar su negocio, surtir su negocio y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a member of the Amor Divino community bank. Herlinda is married; she is 41 years old and has four children. Herlinda sells fish in the Covadonga market on Saturdays and Sundays. The rest of the week she babysits. Herlinda needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy fish. She dreams of expanding her business, increasing her stock and selling wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Abdumumin

texts.en:
U. Abdumumin first applied to the MicroInvest loan programme in 2007.  He describes himself as a very serious client that trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and intends to work hard so that he can start a small business. 

Abdumumin has worked in the livestock business for 12 years; he started by helping his father in the same business.  He has one milk cow, one calf and four rams.  Abdumumin wants to buy a pedigree bull to increase his livestock.  Abdumumin applies to Kiva with a request for a business development loan of 300 STJ for six months to purchase a pedigree bull.  He thanks Kiva for its support!

loans.use: purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Anbèkoun ("we Can All Get Along") Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du  groupe Anbèkoun (composé d’une veuve et de quatre 4 femmes mariées) vivent dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 43 ans et 6 enfants dans le quartier Rails Ko de   Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens  de mariage, de voisinage et font essentiellement comme activité le commerce de produits alimentaires et la restauration.
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt solidaire, ce groupe est à son deuxième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  3 sacs de sucre, 3 sacs de gingembre, 1sac de feuilles d’oseille de Guinée, 1carton d’essence (arômes), 1 panier de citron, 1 panier de tamarin (les jus  de gingembre et de dableni sont obtenus à partir d’un mélange judicieux de ces différents produits précités), 2 cartons de pommes de terre et 250 kg de mil. 
Elles se ravitaillent pour l’ensemble de ces produits à la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou. La pomme de terre est revendue sont diverses formes mais généralement sous forme de fritures et de ragoût. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants à domicile, en ambulant, dans les gargotes et au marché. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 21.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux charges de la famille. Elles ambitionnent faire du stockage et la commercialisation  des céréales.
texts.en:
The members of the group Anbèkoun are composed of a widow and four married women who average 43 years of age and 6 children each. They live in monogamous families in the Rails Ko district of Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of marriage and community, and they do commerce essentially in foodstuff and catering.

After having correctly repaid the first solidarity loan, this group is on it’s second loan, which will be used to buy 3 sacks of sugar, 3 sacks of ginger, 1 sack of hibiscus leaves, 1 box of flavorings, 1 basket of lemons, 1 basket of tamarind… the juices made from ginger and dableni (hibiscus flowers) are obtained from a careful mixing of these aforementioned items… 2 boxes of potatoes, and 250 kg of millet. Supplies of all of these goods are gotten at the weekly fair in Diamarabougou. The potatoes are sold in different ways but generally fried or stewed. Sales are made out of the house, door-to-door, in eateries, and at the marketplace, cash or credit accepted from customers composed of men, women, and children.

The women hope to realize an average monthly profit of 21,000 francs CFA that will be use to make the loan interest payments and to help cover family expenses. Their ambition is to stock up on grains and to market them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, millet, and ingredients needed for making local beverage

loans.name: Karin

texts.es:
Karin es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Karin es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Karin tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en donde vende golosinas, bebidas, su casa esta ubicado cerca de un terminal de buses, además Karin trabaja como secretaria en la empresa de transporte.
Karin necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas, gaseosas.
Los sueños de Karin son techar su casa y surtir con mas productos sus negocios.
texts.en:
Karin is a member of the Azucenas Community Bank. She is a 32-year-old mother of two and lives with her partner. Karin has a small store in her home where she sells snacks and beverages. Her home is located near a bus station. Karin also works as a secretary for a transportation company. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles, which she plans to use to invest in the purchase of snacks and soft drinks. Karin's dreams are to put a roof on her home and to stock her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо - женщина 39 лет. Она вдова. Воспитает 3-х детей. Занимается продажей мужской одежды на рынке "Афганбазар"  города Худжанда. Она арендует магазин. Зебинисо привозит товар из города Бишкека Киргизской Республики. Она раз в месяц ездит за товаром. Зебинисо кредитуется в нашей организации 2 года. В начале кредитования она закупала товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Сейчас она расширила бизнес. Зебинисо планирует дальше расширять бизнес и потихоньку перейти и на женскую одежду.
texts.en:
Zebiniso is a 39 year old woman. She is a widow, she raises three children. She sells men's clothing on the market Afganbazar of the town of Khujand. She rents out a store. Zebiniso brings the merchandise from Bishkek of the Republic of Kyrgyztan. She travels for the merchandise once a month. Zebiniso has been taking out loans in our organization for two years. At the beginning of her credit history she was buying the goods from a wholesale market of the town of Istaravshan. She has now expanded her business. Zebiniso plans to further expand her business and slowly start selling women's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Since 2008, Alice D. has worked as a trader selling silver plates, bowls and saucepans in Cape Coast. She is married with four children and has received an education through senior high school. Her husband is now retired. She is responsible for paying for her children’s school fees and also her family’s utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase goods at  wholesale prices which she will then resell. She hopes to use the profits to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase kitchenware at wholesale prices for retail

loans.name: Janat Nakabugo‘S Group

texts.en:
Janat is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 40-year-old single mother of four children aged between 11 and 17 years. All of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a one-roomed house where she is staying with six people. She takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Janat resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells bananas in Kalerwe market in one of Kampala’s suburbs and has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She sells to an average of ten people a day and sells to all categories of people. She buys bananas from her place of work and so doesn’t incur any transportation costs.

Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for the business premises, school fees and feeding the family. Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her.

Janat has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her fourteenth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas to sell. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and of owning a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Rupiyamo

texts.ru: Рупиямо Саидова живет в городе Душанбе. Возраст 40 лет. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Рупиямо имеет торговую точку на рынке, где более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном торгует детской одеждой. Клиентка хочет получить кредит, чтобы увеличить товараоборот.
texts.en:
Rupiyamo S. lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 40 years old, divorced and has 2 children. Rupiyamo has a retail stand at the market, where she has been selling for over 10 years. She primarily sells children’s clothing. Our client wants to obtain this loan in order to increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elvira tiene 64 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, en el departamento de la Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria completa, tiene 3 hijos (casados).
Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, anteriormente cuando inició en Manuela Ramos tenía su tienda donde vendía mercería, negocio que fracasó debido al incumplimiento de pago por parte de sus clientes, meses después Rosa enfermó lo cual implicó que la operaran.
Luego inicia con la venta de productos lácteos, negocio que actualmente administra, la empresaria señala que cuenta con clientes estables.
Sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Trujillo (en las ferias de lácteos).
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Virgen de Fátima, lo invirtió en la compra de productos lácteos como queso y manjar blanco. 
Con este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de manjar blanco, cuajadas (queso procesado) y quesillos.
Rosa tiene como sueño instalar nuevamente su tienda con productos de mercería y ampliar su negocio de la venta de productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira is 64. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She has a high school education. She has three married children. Rosa sells dairy products. Previously, when she started with Manuela Ramos, she had a store where she sold notions. The business failed because of her customers’ failure to pay. Months later Rosa became ill and had to have an operation. She then started selling dairy products. She currently runs the business, and she has a stable customer base. She gets her products in the city of Trujillo (in the dairy fairs). With her first loan for 300 PEN, which she received from her Virgen de Fátima Community bank, she bought dairy products like cheese and “manjar blanco” (sweet almond-flavored milk pudding thickened with gelatin or cornstarch). With this loan for 300 PEN, she will buy manjar blanco, “cuajadas” (processed cheese), and cheese. Rosa’s dream is to again set up her store with notions’ products and to expand her business of selling dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy processed cheese, manjar blanco (a type of pudding), and cheese

loans.name: Бисокина

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Бисокина проживает и торгует на рынке Костакоза.Её ассортимент составляют хозяйственные товары для дома.Она имеет двоих детей, которые помогают ей на базаре, при отсутствии матери.для закупа с оптового рынка Истаравшана  Бисокина хочет получить кредит в "Арванде".На снимке Бисокина в день выдачи.

loans.use: на расширение продажи хозтоваров

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is married with two teenage daughters. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Pavlograd. Her net income is about 3,500 UAH per month.

Natalia has been in this business for one year. She had a low salary at her previous work place and decided to quit her job and start working for herself. Even though it is more difficult, her efforts have been paid back with results. Natalia's business goal is to add men's clothing and improve her business conditions.

Natalia would like to borrow 10,150 UAH to increase the assortment of clothing available. She hopes to increase sales and invest income back into developing her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Zonia Ninza

texts.es:
Zonia es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Zonia es soltera, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Zonia vende salchipollos de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días por las noches con el apoyo de sus hijas. Además Zonia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Zonia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de platos, harina y cremas.
Los sueños de Zonia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un local propio.

loans.use: Para la compra de platos, harina y cremas.

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 40-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a car repairer for twenty years and also sells used spare parts.

Mhammad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts for his work and to pay for his children school tuition. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time.

Mhammad’s previous loans helped him improve his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors, as well as traders. He decided on doing his business because he learned it since he was young and when he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties.  In the future, he plans on improving his store.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his work and to pay for his children school tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de machine

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is from the village of Santiago in Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Nena is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nena sells seafood, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Nena is just starting this business.

In 2009, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to buy items to sell. This will be Nena's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more seafood to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 32-year-old dressmaker. She is married, with two school-age children: a son and a daughter. She operates Roden Fashion, offering tailoring and design. She has run her business for three years and employs one person. She is requesting Kes 20,000 to increase her inventory. Rose describes herself as hardworking and committed and would like to have a big fashion firm in the future. Since joining Faulu, she says that she has learned the fundamentals of business. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of fabric

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
32-year-old Ronald is a diligent farmer. He plants rice on his farm. He does his best when it comes to farming because it gives him and his wife food to eat and clothes to wear, and it supplies their other needs. Ronald has only been married for about four months now. He doesn’t have any children yet but looks forward to having one.

Ronald joined CEVI in 2008. He likes its program, especially the low interest rate of 2%. Now he is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP. He will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies his farm needs.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: 48-year-old Gloria M. is a married woman who lives in Agusan Del Sur. She invested in rice farming and now owns her own rice field. She is preparing her land for planting. Financially short, she joined Kiva partner CEVI in May 2009 to gain access to its financial services. She is now requesting a loan of Php 8,000, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and other farming necessities. This is Gloria’s second loan from CEVI. Her first loan was also used to finance her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab P. is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy bread, meat and cooking oil to sell. Zeinab is 28 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy bread, meat and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Navdagul

texts.ru: Садуллоева Навдагул проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Навдагул имеет торговую точку на рынке, где более 3 лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном торгует одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Navdagul S. lives in Kulyab. She is 39, married, and has 5 children. Navdagul sells clothing at a local market. She requested this loan to increase the volume of goods sold and to use the extra income to repair her house.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Đặng Thị's Group
loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Hà Thị Hoàng was born in 1964 (id: 010107050001). At present, she is living in Văn Thượng village with her husband and two children. Hà has been selling fast food to customers in the local community to make a living for about 10 years; she has an average income of $203 a month. Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA activities and has always been very punctual with her loan repayments. At this time, there’s a need for her to take out a loan of 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to invest more in her business. Hà is hoping to earn more money in order to buy household appliances.

 Moving forward to her group, it includes: 
 Dinh Thị Hoàng is 38 years old (id: 010107050003). She would like to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to sell flowers. 
 Mai Thị Hoàng is 38 years old (id: 010107050006). She also wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to offer tailoring services. 
 T.ềm Thị Nguyễn is 38 years old (id: 010107050005). She would like to take out a loan of 5.014.000 VND (or $270) to invest in selling clothes. 
 Hòa Thị Nguyễn is 53 years old (id: 010107050025). She wants to borrow the same amount, 5.014.000 VND (or $270), to raise pigs and sell vegetables.

loans.use: to invest more in her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne  42 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Bouwere dans la sous-préfecture de Konobougou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, des articles de boutique, du poisson séché, des tubercules, des fruits et légumes, des céréales et des habillements.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  3 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé  pour constituer un stock de condiments alimentaires, de poissons séchés et acheter  quelques sacs de céréales, de chargements de charrettes en fruits et   quelques complets d’habits pour enfants. 
Elles s’approvisionnent  à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et à Konobougou auprès des producteurs et grossistes. Elles  effectuent leurs ventes, à Bouwere (à domicile), au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7.500FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Benkadi" group are on average 42 years old with 2 children and live in traditional extended households in Bouwere, in the Konobougou sub-prefecture (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know each other through familial relations and run businesses buying and selling various items such as food condiments, dry goods, dried fish, tubers, fruits and vegetables, cereals, and clothing. After having properly repaid their 3 previous loans, the women of the Benkadi group are on their fourth solidarity (group) loan, which will be used to set up stocks of food condiments and dried fish, and to buy several bags of cereals, cartloads of fruits, and several sets of children's clothing. They obtain their supplies in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and in Konobougou from producers and wholesalers. They make their sales in Bouwere (at home), at the Konobougou city market, and at the neighbouring area market-days, in cash, at retail, and on credit, to a clientele composed of women and men. They plan to realize an average monthly profit of 7,500 FCFA each, which will be used to pay for expenses related to health, food, and school fees, with the remainder being reinvested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Juana Yamilette

texts.es: Juana Yamilette tiene 35 años, su actividad económica es compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, ella tiene 2 niños menores de edad a su cargo, por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona muy capaz al administrar muy bien su negocio. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ropa interior, cosméticos, pantalones y camisetas por lo que tiene que viajar hasta Managua para comprar más favorable. Su deseo es seguir creciendo con su negocio que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Juana Yamilette is 35 years old. She buys and sells clothes. She has been in this business for over six years. She has worked with the Fundación León 2000 for a long time. She has two minor children. She has demonstrated herself to be a person who is very capable of running her business very well. She is currently requesting a loan for working capital to buy underwear, cosmetics, pants, and t-shirts. She needs to travel to Managua, where shopping is more favorable for her. Her wish is to keep growing in her business, which is her only means of earning a living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia M. is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Prosperidad, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store and a restaurant/eatery. Aurelia’s husband Dio who is 60 years old helps his wife in running the business. They have 3 children who are between 25 to 40 years old, two of whom have their own families; one is still single but is already gainfully employed.

Aurelia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by running her general store and restaurant/eatery business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 22,400 from her business activities.

Aurelia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 20,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and restaurant, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 13th loan, the amount of Php 20,000, which she intends to use to sustain the operations of her general store.  Aurelia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie D. is requesting a loan to increase her business capital and to support her plans to develop her vegetable and fruit farming business in partnership with her husband. Through the proceeds of this business, she hopes to purchase an agricultural lot which they can use for their farming business. They will then be able to have more profits because they won’t have to pay for the land rental which they currently do. Her business proceeds would be the main source for achieving her dreams to support the education of her three children who are now in a secondary school through to college.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of vegetables and fruits for planting and to pay the machine rentals for land preparation

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette S., 41, married to Precilo S., a construction worker, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Blessed with three children, she makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. For some time she has been managing her own barbecue stall while also selling charcoal to her neighbors.

Jeanette has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, regularly attending their weekly fellowship meetings and paying her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. Jeanette is consistent in paying her dues because she has used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.

To ensure her continued business success, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to buy the raw ingredients needed to continue production of her barbecue and charcoal businesses. Jeanette dreams that her enterprises will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy the raw ingredients needed to continue production of her barbecue and her charcoal businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia D., 44, ensures that her family members are able to fulfill their daily needs. She is married to Enrique D., a taxi driver, and  they are blessed with three children. Lydia helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. To do so, she manages her own clothing sales business.

Lydia has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she was able to borrow several times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her clothing business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business so that she can buy more clothing to sell.

Lydia dreams that her business will continue to grow and have more patrons.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
A. Immaculate is twenty-five years old. She is a married woman blessed with one baby boy of two month. 

She owns a retail shop which she has been operating for over two years. It deals mainly in essential domestic goods. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as wheat, cooking oil, and sugar to sell. She is a hard-working business woman whose dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as wheat, cooking oil, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Calvary Women Group

texts.en:
Theresa L., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Calvary Women. She is 33 years old, married and has one child who is nine years old. She also cares for one sibling. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For eight years, she has been selling fish and charcoal in ELWA Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 32,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 111,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more fish and charcoal. She describes herself as a serious business person.

Her plan is to improve her business and continue to support her family so that they can have a better future.

In the photo, Weewee C.'s photo is inset at the lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy fish and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda F. is from the town of Malibangcao Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Erlinda is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Erlinda owns and  operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling firewood in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Mila's Group

texts.en:
Mila C. is from the village of Bandera. She is 56 years old. Mila is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is C. Group.

Mila is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Mila works in a family member's business planting & harvesting rice to sell. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Doussou

texts.fr:
Madame Doussou D. a plus de 54 ans et réside avec son époux et leurs six  enfants à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de dix ans  aux activités de petit commerce notamment  à l’achat et à la vente  des bazins en teintés et  de l’encense déjà fabriqué. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Vu le positionnement de sa boutique située au bord d’une des routes principales de la ville de Sikasso, son activité marche bien.  Régulièrement, elle envoie ses bazins teintés et l'encense  embouteillé à Abidjan (république de Côte d’Ivoire) sur commande.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quatre ans et avec laquelle elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 8 pièces de bazins teintés et 20 grosses bouteilles d’ensence déjà préparé. Elle achète ses bazins et ensences auprès des teinturières et fabriquantes d’ensence de la ville de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doussou D. is over 54 years old. She lives with her husband and their six children in Kaboïla II, downtown of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). When social circumstances prevented her from staying in school, she engaged in small business activities over ten years ago. She buys and sells dyed bazins and pre-made incense. Thanks to the quality of her merchandise, she is in high demand, especially by her clientele composed primarily of women. With her shop located by a main road in Sikasso, her business is doing well. She regularly ships out dyed bazins and bottled incense to Abidjan (Republic of Côte d'Ivoire) on order. To better serve her steadily increasing customer base, she joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution four years ago and is now seeking her second individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy eight pieces of dyed bazin and twenty large bottles of pre-made incense. She buys her bazins and incense from dyers and incense makers in the city of Sikasso. She expects this loan to yield a monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which she will use to bolster her working capital, help cover the family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dyed bazins and incense

loans.name: Próspero

texts.es:
Prospero C. O. es un  señor de 66 años de edad, ella vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada San Cristóbal Norte. Es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, y el café. 
Don Prospero tiene toda su vida de dedicarse a la agricultura de todo tipo de  hortalizas y a la producción de carne tanto de res como de cerdo. El asegura que con su experiencia ha logrado tener siempre los mejore productos, pero ahora el necesita un préstamo ¢599,000 (quinientos noventa y nueve  mil colones)  Para la compra de 2 cerdas para aumentar la producción de carne de cerdo y así mejorar sus ingresos. 
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Ha recibido 5 microcréditos y los ha cancelado responsablemente.
texts.en:
Prospero Coredero O., 66, lives with his wife and 2 children in a community named San Cristobal Norte. It is in a fairly mountainous area where people engage in things like business, agriculture, and coffee. Mr. O. has dedicated his entire life to growing all types of vegetables and producing meat, generally from cows and pigs. He believes that with his experience he has always been able to have the best products, but now he needs a loan of 599,000 colones to buy 2 pigs in order to increase meat production and improve his income. He is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte [San Cristobal Norte Communal Credit Company] (SACRIN), one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. He has received 5 microloans previously and has paid them all off responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional pigs.

loans.name: Juana Dominga

texts.es: La Sra. Juana Dominga G. R. ella es trabajadora activa de la Alcaldía municipal San Rafael del Sur   ella  se desempeña  como conserje, tiene  un año de trabajar para esta institución,  tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para cambio de techo la cocina  de su casa, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Dominga G. R. has been employed as a Caretaker for the City of San Rafael del Sur for a year.  She has a school aged son.

She has had two loans with CEPRODEL that have been used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements.  This loan is to reroof the kitchen.

Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for her in that they have allowed for an improvement in her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting and wood beams.

loans.name: Lalbek

texts.ru: Шодавронов Лалбек проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена работает в больнице врачом. Сам Лалбек имеет средне - специальное образование, фармацевт. По профессии работает уже 30 лет. У него собственная аптека. Кредит берет для приобретения лекарств и новых препаратов.
texts.en: Lalbek S. lives in Vahdat.  He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. His wife works in a hospital as a doctor.  Lalbek has a vocational education as a pharmacist. He has been working in his trade for thirty years.  He owns a drugstore.  He is taking out a loan to buy medicines and compounds.

loans.use: Buying medicines and compounds

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de 4 femmes toutes mariées dans des familles polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Somonodougouni dans la commune rurale de Konodimini dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage dans le village. 
Les membres du groupe font essentiellement le petit commerce de poissons frais et fumés. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mahawa Niaré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 corbeilles de  poissons frais au bord du fleuve Niger dans le village. 
Pour avoir du poisson fumé, elle lave proprement ses poissons frais, les étale sur les matériels conçus pour la circonstance au dessous duquel elle active le feu dans un coin de la cour de la maison pendant deux ou trois jours au moins. Le poisson ainsi fumé est vendu à domicile et à la foire de Konodimini au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Mahawa Niaré envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants et les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The Danaya group consists of 4 women, all married and living in polygamous families. They average 45 years of age and three children. They live in the village of Somonodougouni in the rural community of Konodimini in Segou region (the fourth administrative district of Mal) and know each other through family and marriage ties. The group members mainly sell fish, fresh and smoked.

In order to increase their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and are now on the first solidarity loan.
Mrs. Mahawa Niaré plans to use her loan to purchase seven baskets of fresh village at the Niger river in their village. In order to have smoked fish, she properly washes her fish, places it on top of appropriate materials designed for it and smokes them over fire in a corner of her yeard, for at least two or three days. The smoked fish is sold out of her home and at the Konodmini market, for cash and on credit, to a diverse customer base.

Mrs. Mahawa Niaré plans to achieve an average monthly benefit of 25,000 West African Francs, which will be used towards healthcare expenses for her children and some everyday household needs.

loans.use: Purchasing fresh fish

loans.name: Shaariibuu

texts.en:
