Shaariibuu T. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and four children, all between six and 21, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Shaariibuu and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. His two oldest children attend university while his younger two sons are in a local school. His wife works in a bakery shop and Shaariibuu operates a car repair and service as well as a livestock fodder trading businesses. 

Shaariibuu has been operating his car repair service in his yard since 1987 and has built a stable and successful operation. To supplement his earnings, he operates a livestock forage trading business throughout the countryside. Shaariibuu and his wife work hard to provide for their children and improve the quality of their lives through education. 

Shaariibuu is a modest and hardworking man. He is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to increase his working capital for his businesses. In the future, he hopes to have his own car repair center and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Gbènato Rébecca

texts.fr: Née en 1957, B. Gbènato Rébecca est une veuve ayant à sa charge trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Rébecca vit ensemble avec ses enfants à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Rébecca n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Rébecca mène comme activité depuis vingt deux ans, la vente de divers produits (conserves, sucre, lait, savons, les produits cosmétiques, etc.) dans son quartier. Rébecca s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant obtenu quatre crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante de sa clientèle, Rébecca souhaite augmenter son stock de produits et se faire plus de profits ; raison pour laquelle Rébecca sollicite un autre prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born in 1957, Gbènato Rébecca B. is a widow with three children in her care, all of whom are in school. Rébecca lives together with her children in Ekpè, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, Benin. Rébecca never attended school. To provide for herself and her children, Rébecca has run a business selling various items (canned goods, sugar, milk, soap, cosmetics, etc.) for 22 years in her area. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She is a longstanding client of ALIDE, having obtained four loans, all of which were repaid properly. Faced with the increasing demands from her customers, Rébecca hopes to increase her stock of goods and obtain greater profits; for this reason, she is seeking another loan from ALIDE.

loans.use: To buy various items (sugar, soap, canned goods, cosmetics, etc.)

loans.name: Yarkul

texts.en:
The business of agriculture and livestock is a job that requires great sacrifice, demanding great efforts which should be carried out in the field, exposed to the sun for many hours and moving animals over long distances. Aware of this situation, Yarkul has been devoted to the agricultural business for more than 5 years. Yarkul has a humble family composed of his wife and 7 children, for whom he provides food and support for their studies. The reason for his requesting a loan is to invest in his agriculture business through seeds and fertilizers.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and 3 siblings. He cooperates with his father to maintain a good income to support the family. Despite his young age, he opened a cleaning company in 2005 and got experience in this occupation since then. He works depending on customers’ requests, offering cleaning services to homes and companies. In addition, he produces cleaning products and detergents. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase raw materials to improve his work and better serve  his clients.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Maurent Ilosva

texts.es: La señorita Maurent dedicada a la venta de ropa y bisutería frente a un colegio, esta venta lo realiza de lunes a viernes durante todo el día esta actividad le permite alimentarse y ayudar a su familia pues solo cuenta con su madre y tres hermanos menores a ella y a los que tiene  que apoyar moral y económicamente, la señorita requiere el crédito para incrementar su capital comprando mercadería como ropa y trabas y así tener ingresos mas considerables. Y opto nuevamente al crédito ya que su anterior crédito con kiva le fue muy bien, es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Maurent sells clothes and costume jewelry opposite a school.  She makes her sales all day, from Monday to Friday.  This business allows her to feed herself and help her family: her mother and her three younger siblings who she has to support both morally and financially.

This young lady requires a loan to increase her capital, buying merchandise such as clothes and hair accessories so that she can make more income.  She has chosen to take a new loan because her last Kiva loan was very helpful.  She is a very responsible and hard-working young woman and she is grateful to the institution for the help she has been offered.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Egidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Egidia; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos y venta de animales, la socia se dedica a los dos pequeños negocios, la socia vende los productos secos y animales en el mercado de Quiquijana, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos secos y venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y productos secos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Egidia. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling dried goods and livestock sales. She manages both businesses. She sells dried goods and her livestock at the market in Quiquijana. She works from 6am to 5pm. She wishes to expand her business selling dried goods and livestock sales. She requests a loan to purchase livestock and dried goods. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and dried goods.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de de riz  à travers MARIAM K.. 
MARIAM K.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 sacs de 100 kg de riz. Elle s’approvisionne à Ségou et Niono. Le riz est revendu au  marché de  HAMDALLAYE  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the SABOUGNOUMA group are all married women, averaging 37 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a neighborhood in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their sixth loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. This group of women sells rice, through MARIAM K..

MARIAM K. intends to use her loan to buy ten sacks of 100 kg of rice. She gets her supplies in Ségou and Niono. She resells the rice for cash, at the HAMDALLAYE market, and at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 80'000 (ca US$ 160), to be used to pay for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es: Arístides, de 56 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado esposo Heraclio de 57 años y de su hija mayor, de los seis que tiene, pues el resto son mayores y tienen sus propias familias. Esta trabajadora mujer siempre se las ingenió para generarse sus propios ingresos, ni los años ni el tiempo le han quitado las ganas que tiene de salir adelante. En la actualidad brinda menús (comida diaria) en el paradero de la línea de transportes donde trabaja su esposo. En el lugar atiende a diario a todos los trabajadores y le brinda su comida; además ofrece gaseosas y chupetes de hielo, y le va muy bien solo que le hace falta constante capital para invertirlo. Aunque empieza a cocinar muy temprano se esfuerza por atender a tiempo a sus comensales y a partir del mediodía empieza a servirles con la ayuda de una de sus hijas. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de diversos comestibles en su restaurante, pues algunos comensales a veces le piden algo y ella no les puede ofrecer, de esta manera quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Arístides tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que le hacen falta para continuar con su negocio; además quiere empezar a implementar su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Arístides is 56 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Heraclio who is 57, and her eldest daughter.  She has six children but the rest of them are adults and have their own families.  This hard-working woman has always been able to generate her own income and neither her age nor lack of time have been able to stand in her way as far as getting ahead is concerned.

She has a food stall set up at the bus-stop of the transport line where her husband works.  She sells food, softdrinks and popsicles to all the workers on a daily basis.  Business is going well but she needs more capital to cover costs.  She gets up very early in the morning to cook the food that she later serves to her customers at noon with the help of one of her daughters.

In the future she would like to set up a grocery store in her stall because sometimes customers ask for certain products that she doensn't have.  She sees this as a way of increasing her income.

This is her fifth loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time since she would not want to disappoint the lenders who are making it possible for her to continue working and seeking a better lifestyle.  Arístides plans to use the loan to purchase food stall ingredients and grocery store products.

loans.use: To purchase food stall ingredients and grocery store products

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is married to M. I., who has a business selling groceries. His shop is located in the market and he sells daily-use items such as salt, sugar, spices and cooking oil. He is a very good person and treat his clients respectfully.

Zarina is a housewife and stays at home to do household work. She is a very supportive lady and always ready to help her family in difficult times. She has three daughters and two sons, all of whom are studying at a local school, except for the youngest. She is a resident of Mian Channu, a small city in the Punjab province of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah in order to expand her husband’s grocery business. With the loan, he will stock more groceries to his shop in order to increase his sales and income. He has been operating this business for the past six years and Zarina is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one. She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. She has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting during previous loan years.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Fayrouz

texts.en:
Fayrouz is a 54-year-old divorced woman, the mother of one child. Fayrouz lives and works in Dahieh with her child.  She started working 10 years ago when she found herself alone, and she works hard to provide a living for her small family.
 
Fayrouz has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycle, and she is a member in good standing. Most of her customers describe her good manners and hard work. Her previous loans helped in proving herself and supporting her business. This time her request is to improve her business by buying a new modern advanced tailoring machine.  This machine is necessary to do the requested work in a short time and also to provide perfect quality.  Fayrouz would also like to buy a collection of textiles that helps her customers finish the design they need in a very short time.

Fayrouz hopes to move her business outside her house to a nearby shop, so she can provide her child with the privacy that every person needs and requests.

loans.use: To buy a modern advanced tailoring machine

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saúl López López es soltero y vive en la Ribera de Miguel Hidalgo Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México.
    El  solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  mercancía para surtir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes con la que lleva un año y seis meses, nos comenta que la  va bien ya que le esta dejando buenos ingresos para su familia.
     Su meta más grande es que con este pequeño negocio y el préstamo que le ha estado otorgando logre  incrementar sus ingresos para poder solventar algunos gastos generados en su familia, que son sus padres.
texts.en:
Saúl López López is single living in Ribera de Miguel Hidalgo, a municipality in Copainala in the Mexican State of Chiapas.

He asked for the loan to buy merchandise to stock his small grocery store that he’s had for a year and six months.  He comments that he does well because it produces good family income.

His greatest goal is that with the business and the loan he’s being granted he will manage to increase his income to be able to meet some expenses generated in his family which consists of his parents.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta  con los servicios de agua y luz; ubicada en el  zona rural del caserío de Punto 9 (Sialupe Baca) a unos 30 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta  zona se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la comercialización de animales y agricultura.

Desde hace varios años Delicia se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de aves deaves de corral (pavos, gallinas y patos), ganado vacuno (vacas) y porcino (chanchos), sus  corrales lo tiene en la parte externa de su casa para mayor seguridad y comodidad.  Sus animales los alimenta con dieta balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su desarrollo ideal los ofrece en los distintos mercados de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, lo cual le permite a José aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Por lo mismo Delicia a solicitado un préstamo  de 1800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para seguir comprando animales (en especial aves de corral) para criarlas y venderlas al por mayor y menor ya que se venden más rápido en los  mercados, mientras que el ganado vacuno y caprino su venta es más lenta, también lo va utilizar para comprar alimentos balanceados  y seguir incrementado sus ingresos brindando un producto sano y de calidad.

Delicia es conocida por los comerciantes de la zona y de los distintos mercados por ser una  mujer muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de  mejorar en la vida y de sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Delicia is a 50 year-old mother who lives in her own home with her husband and children.  She has water and electricity.  Her home is located in the rural area of the small village of Punto 9 (Sialupe Baca), 30 minutes from Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for the fact that its residents work in farming and animal sales.

For several years, Delicia has been buying, raising and selling poultry (turkeys, hens and ducks), cattle (cows) and pigs.  Her pens are located outside her home for better security and comfort.  She feeds her animals a balanced diet and natural pasture.  Once they have reached an ideal level of development, she sells them in the different markets in Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  This allows Delicia to increase her profits and cover her daily household needs.

Delicia has requested a loan for 1,800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can continue buying animals (especially poultry) to raise and sell both wholesale and retail.  The birds sell most quickly in the markets whilst the cattle and pigs sell more slowly.  She will also use her loan to buy balanced feed and continue increasing her income, providing a healthy, good-quality product.

Delicia is known by traders in the area and by those in the different markets as being a very hard-working woman who has a great desire to improve herself and get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more poultry

loans.name: Happiness Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “HAPPINESS” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standards of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata. Aminata is 32 years old. She was born in a place call Blama. Currently, she is residing in Kenema, together with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. Aminata sells a variety of items locally called “Hausa market” – hair dye, "solfor", “tirro” (used to paint the eyes), “donny” (locally made body cream), etc. She has been a businesswoman for 20 years now. With her share of the loan, Aminata is going to buy Hausa-market-items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy Hausa-market-items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mohamed.  He is single and has 1 child who is 11 years old.  He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him because he is his younger brother.  

In 2004, Mohamed established his used clothing business. He began this business because he wanted to earn more income to support his family.  He gained business experience from his uncle. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about Le 990,000 every month from this business. 

Mohammed would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy additional used clothing for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to educate his daughter to university level.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy more used clothing to resell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She does small scale farming and sells all of her products in the local market.  She is 33 years old, married to Isaac, and they have four school going children.  

Hanna was introduced to KADET LTD, by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She repaid for all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow and start selling the milk on the side to support her crop income.

In the future, Hannah hopes to buy more cattle and to increase her dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en: Bebina is 47 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries  to sell in her store. Bebina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Bebina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sri store

loans.name: Misirkhan

texts.en:
Misirkhan is a 47 year old man who lives in the small village of Sabirabad city where he works as a farmer.  He is married and has three children. 

His main business is farming and cattle breeding, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family.  Misirkhan owns a large piece of land where he pastures his animals.  His monthly income is about 120 AZN.  He is very hard-working and he is asking for a loan of 500 AZN to buy more cattle.  The loan will greatly improve Misirkhan’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: purchase one cattle

loans.name: Lilliam Maria

texts.es: Lilliam Maria se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene la experiencia de tratar con sus clientes a diario. ella comenzó cuando se separo de su esposo y tuvo que trabajar para mantener a su hija de 11 años, a pesar que al inicio no fue fácil ha logrado superar los tropiezos que ha tenido ha mantenido su actividad. Este financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, bolsos, ropa en general, toalla, sabanas, cremas y perfumes.
texts.en:
Lilliam Maria sells general merchandise.  She has over five years of experience of dealing with her customers every day.

She started when she separated from her husband.  She had to work to support her 11 year old daughter.  In spite of the fact that in the beginning it was not easy, she has managed to overcome the obstacles she had.  She has sustained her business activity.

This loan is to buy shoes, bags, general clothing, towels, sheets, creams, and perfumes.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags, general clothing, towels, sheets, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has five children. Her husband is a carpenter. She helps him in the general upkeep of the home.

Ama sells different types of soap. She uses a metal bell to draw the attention of customers to herself.

Ama plans to use her loan of 530 GHS to purchase more soap to expand her business. With any new profits, Ama wants to build a shop for herself.

loans.use: to purchase more soap to sell.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is 57, she sells dowry products as glasses, vases, tableware and other items. Her brother helps her and her monthly profit is about $200. These kinds of goods are very popular among young ladies and all levels of women in Azerbaijan. 

Alina is single, but her family supports her. She has 11 years of experience in this field and she would like expand her business and purchase more goods. She applied for a loan of 1,300 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN) in order to increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase and diversify into more goods and increase profits

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, vende papas fritas, Hot Dog y bebidas refrescantes, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 16 años, el negocio es estable y posee muchos clientes ya que está ubicada en un lugar donde mucha gente que viaja llega hasta ahí para tomar el autobús. 
Ella quiere comprar mercadería para aumentar su venta como comprar sacos de papas, salchichas, pan, aceite y aderezos, con este préstamo está en la disposición de producir más y ver la posibilidad de tener mejores ganancias. Ella Quiere alcanzar el sueño de tener casa propia, por este motivo se esfuerza para lograrlo en un futuro.
texts.en:
María sells potato chips, hot dogs and soft drinks. She lives with her husband and son who is 16 years old. Her business is stable and has a lot of customers as it is located in a place where many people who travel go to get the bus.

She wants to buy merchandise to increase her sales, items such as sacks of potatoes, sausages, bread, oil and seasonings. With this loan she is in a better position to produce more and see the possibility of better earnings. She wants to achieve her dream of owning a home and for this reason she works hard to achieve this in the future.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, sausages, bread, oil and seasonings.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children. 
Nancy has a retail shop that sells vegetables, spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock for her shop.
Nancy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of vegetables, food seasoning & spices to sell

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Victor Antonio es soltero, cursó el primer año de educación básica, tiene 24 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de Zapato para todas la edades, inició este trabajo por iniciativa propia y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para la compra de materiales: pieles, hilos, pegamento, solventes, y entre otro materiales, para mejorar su productividad, ya que espera en el futuro tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
The youngster Victor Antonio is single, finished the first year of basic education, 24 years old, and dedicates himself to making shoes for people of all ages.  He started this work under his own initiative and, up to this moment, has 5 years of experience.

He requests a loan to use for buying materials: leathers, threads, glues, solvents and other supplies to improve his productivity, as he hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: buy materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Karambenor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 07 JUIN 2001. Il  est  constitué de neuf femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Aminata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 73 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a la charge quatre enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente d'huile de palme et de jus de citron. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  son petit commerce d'huile de palme et de jus de citron

Les profits lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et d’améliorer les conditions de vie des enfants qui lui sont confiés ( nourriture etc.…).
texts.en:
This community bank was created on the 7th of June 2001.  The group is made up of nine women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their main business activity is buying and selling goods.

Aminata, who is on the right of the photo raising her hand, is the group's leader.  She is 73 years old and a widow.  She has four children in her care who have been entrusted to her by their parents.

Aminata's business is selling palm oil and lemon juice.  She has good experience in this field which she has been working in for several years.

This loan will allow Aminata to strengthen her capital and better develop her small business selling palm oil and lemon juice.

The profits that Aminata makes will allow her to cover her personal needs and improve the living conditions of the children that she is responsible for (food, etc.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil and lemon juice

loans.name: Dilia Rosney

texts.es:
Dilia es una madre cabeza de hogar, tiene 2 hijos que ha sacado adelante mediante su propio negocio,  vende mecato, gaseosa, licor y cigarrillos, en una pequeña caseta ubicada en el sector comercial del barrio la Tabla, en el occidente antioqueño.

Hace 3 años atrás compro su caseta, pero por problemas de violencia en el sector, en los últimos meses se han reducido sus ventas y ha ocasionado que su surtido baje, por eso actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar más variedad de productos con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y por consiguiente sus ingresos, con el deseo de ahorrar para conseguir un local mejor ubicado que le permita mayores ingresos y por consiguiente mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dilia is a mother head of household; she has two children that she’s supporting through her own business.  She sells snacks, soft-drinks, liquor and cigarettes in a small booth located in the commercial sector of La Tabla neighborhood in west Antioquia.

She purchased her booth three years ago but due to the problem of violence in the sector sales have dropped the last few months and her stock has been reduced.  Because of this she’s asking for a loan to buy a larger variety of products in order to improve sales and thus her income hoping to save up in order to get a better situated locale that will lead to higher income and better quality of life for her children

loans.use: to buy assorted and varied merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Manrique

texts.es:
Manrique tiene 42 años de edad y  vive su familia en una comunidad del distrito de Hatillo, que es urbano y residencial, sin embargo es objeto de una creciente actividad comercial, concentrada principalmente en los centros comerciales. Se ha ubicado gran cantidad de mueblerías, tortillerías, panaderías, librerías, talleres mecánicos y automotrices, gasolineras, dentisterías, farmacias, consultorios médicos, bares, restaurantes, tiendas e imprentas.

Manrique dio inicio a su negocio, para ayudarse en los gastos diarios y sacar adelante a su familia. Ha visto el apoyo de su esposa y está seguro de que su lista de clientes crecerá y podrá dar abasto con todas sus necesidades.

Es por eso que Manrique está solicitando un crédito de 200,000.00 (doscientos mil colones), para asi comprar madera que este en pie, luego venderla procesada y lista para construir.

Manrique es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de EDESA en Costa Rica. Es su segundo préstamo con la Empresa y da muchas gracias por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Manrique is 42 years old and lives with his family in a community in the Hatillo district.  This is an urban residential area, however it is experiencing a growing amount of commercial activity. This is mainly concentrated in the commercial centers, where there are a large number of furniture stores, tortilla makers, bakeries, bookstores, mechanics and car workshops, gas stations, dentists, pharmacies, medical offices, bars, restaurants, shops and printers.

Manrique says that he started his business to help with daily expenses and to move his family ahead in life.  His wife helps him, and he is confident that his client list will grow and that he will be able to cover all his needs.

This is why Manrique is requesting a loan of 200,000 (two hundred thousand) colones, so that he can purchase raw lumber that he will sell once it's processed and ready to use in construction.

Manrique is a member of the Communal Bank of Hatillos, which is one of EDESA's 150 communal banks in Costa Rica.  This is his second loan with Empresa, and he is very thankful for all the support that has been provided to him.

loans.use: to sell processed lumber for construction.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is 44, and married. She resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sopheap and her husband are farmers. When available from the rice field, her husband collects palm juice to sell. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. Sopheap is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand the family farming business. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to expand the family farming business.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget, 54, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Nget is a tailor and her husband raises pigs to sell. Nget is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa vive en la zona de bajo Pampahasi.  Tiene tres hijos todos ellos en edad escolar, esta separada de su esposo, pero a pesar de esto ella tiene dos trabajos para poder criar a sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas a crédito y a la costura en el taller de su cuñada patricia. La señora teresa es una persona alegre y muy trabajadora ya que muy temprano en la mañana sale al taller de su cuñada y trabaja hasta las seis de la tarde y luego sale a realizar la cobranza de las joyas que reparte a crédito. Ella trabaja desde hace tres años con préstamos de emprender y siempre demostró puntualidad al realizar el pago de sus cuotas. Ella anhela poder ampliar su negocio de la venta de joyas y así poder llegar a comprar una casa para ella y sus tres hijos, con el dinero del crédito comprara joyas por mayor para poder entregar pedidos a su clientes ya que le hicieron varios pedidos, por estas fiestas de fin de año, se siente feliz por la oportunidad que la institución le brinda.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa lives in the Bajo Pampahasi area. She has three children all of whom are school-aged. She is separated from her husband, in spite of which she has two jobs in order to be able to care for her children. She devotes herself to selling jewelry on credit and to sewing in the workshop of her sister-in-law Patricia. Ms. Teresa is a cheerful person and very hard-working since she goes out very early in the morning to her sister-in-law's workshop and works until six in the afternoon. Then she goes out to collect on the jewelry she disperses on credit. 

She has been taking out entrepreneurship loans for three years and has always been punctual about making payments. She wishes to expand her jewelry sales business and thus be in a position to buy a home for her and her three children. With the money from the loan she will buy jewelry wholesale in order to be supply her customers' orders, since they have placed various orders for the end-of-year festivities. She is happy for the opportunity provided to her by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget is 39 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and two daughters in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is a garment worker and her husband is a construction worker.  Both of her daughters are garment workers as well.  Nget is asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work.  The new motorbike will enable her to easily go to work on time.  In the future, she plans to run a poultry farm, build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma, 59, is a widow from Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Delma has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 3,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Delma is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Delma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Azucena has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school and office uniforms. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Azucena has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Azucena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 37 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Al Russeifeh Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements,she would like to provide for her family a good environment to live in.

Abeer is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her husband

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Judith Maritza

texts.es:
Judith Maritza tiene 36 años de edad, es padre y madre para su único hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal es la elaboración, compra y venta de artesanía de tipo tejidos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca, lana sintética y otras más. 

Se encuentra contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Judith Maritza is thirty-six years old, and acts as the mother and father of her only son.  She was born in the city of Cusco and she still lives in that same city.  Her principal economic activity is making, buying, and selling woven crafts.  She has been in this business for several years and it is gong well thanks to the commitment she has to her work.

In this opportunity, she requires a loan in order to buy alpaca wool, synthetic wool, and other items. 

She is happy for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.  She is thankful for the help offered to her.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool, synthetic wool, and other items.

loans.name: Serre Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SERRE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la  même maison. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adjouavi 3 (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 54 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Adjouavi 3 est mariée a un chauffeur du nom de Damien. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et cinq à leur charge. Adjouavi 3 vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Adjouavi 3 prépare de la nourriture qu'elle vend dans sa région. Adjouavi 3 s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Adjouavi 3 ensemble avec les membres du groupe SERRE sollicite un crédit auprès de  ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz et du maïs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Mrs. Gladys E. is a 39 years old woman who specializes on sales of food items to people in her environment. She desires her five (5) years old business to expand tremendously. She is greatly in need of $400 to expand her business

loans.use: To buy foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice would like to buy dairy feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more livestock needed to expand his butcher business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his spare parts business

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en: A. Zebo is one of the active clients of MicroInvest. She engaged in business for over 9 years. She is very honest   and responsible person. She always repays her loans in time. She is married and has 3 children. Her business is to trade of biscuits, cakes and candies. She has many clients and her business is going well. For September she received big order from two wedding and she needs in extra capital for making purchase. She must purchase 12 boxes of candies, 8 boxes of biscuits and 20 kg of cakes.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Sra. Justina C., 47, is the single mother of two daughters living in Mariano Roque Alonso, Paraguay. One of her daughters works and the other is still in school.

Justina works as a clothing designer and embroiderer. She learned this profession from her mother when she was very young. However, when business ceased to be prosperous, Justina decided to work in a small restaurant serving drinks and lunch for one of the schools in her neighborhood. Unfortunately this work did not earn her much more than her previous work in sewing. The space being rented for the Cantina was very expensive. For this reason Justina decided to quit the cantina and start a more affordable business in her neighborhood. At that time there was a great demand for a place of this kind, as few other existed. Thus, Justina came to open her copetin, a small shop that sells basic groceries as well as serves some food. Her primary clients are mechanics in the various auto-repair shops near her store.

When she began her business, Justina didn’t have the necessary equipment. She only had enough to buy them little by little. With the loan she has obtained from the Foundation, Justina will be able to purchase a freezer and refrigerator. With these items she will be able to improve the quality of service she offers. Justina is an active hard working person and the money she earns through her copetin supports her family.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer and refrigerator

loans.name: Jitaidi Group

texts.en: The photograph, from left to right, features Eva P., Sophia M. and Juma K., who call themselves JITAIDI, meaning "strive high". They each own a different business, but, nevertheless, work in a partnership. Their businesses are located in the Buguruni area of Dar Es Salaam. Juma runs a shop selling used clothing and shoes, while Sophia runs a restaurant, and Eva sells charcoal. Each of them is in need of US$350 to help them boost their business in expectation of the approaching Christmas, since business earnings typically rise around this season.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam!  This is 43 year-old Joy T..  She is single with one child, aged 10.  In 2000, Joy established a tailoring business and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional material and equipment.  She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional material, accessories and equipment for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mimin

texts.en: Mimin, 35, is married to A. and has 2 children. Every day at her house she makes nutmeg candy in various shapes and colors and also she spreads sugar on it, then she sells the candy, earning about $3 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $125 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of her little candy business

loans.name: Veronica's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 30 years old and has a two-year-old child. Veronica owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 9:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

Veronica now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Edita, who has a business selling clothes (a "batique").

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara D. is the mother of two children living in Offinsu, Ghana. To support her family, she cooks rice and sells it in front her home. Sara is requesting a loan of $575 U.S. dollars to purchase more rice and a refrigerator, so she can begin selling water as well. With the increased profit, Sara plans on saving it to help pay for her children's education. 

Sara is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (translation: God’s hands is in it).  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice and a refrigerator for a food stall

loans.name: Vinarvin

texts.es:
Mr. Vinarvin is 35 years old and lives in the Ameritas neighborhood. He is married and has two children. His wife assists in covering the expenses by doing domestic work in other homes. Vinarvin has been working in an institution that handles government expenditures for four years.

With the requested loan Vinarvin and his wife would like to repair the roof of the porch of their home and prepare for the winter rains.

Vinarvin began his working life selling milk products, but when one of the owners offered him a different job he jumped on it. His living standards have been raised significantly, and in the future he hopes to provide even more for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Vinarvin tiene 35 años de edad, y habita en el barrio las Ameritas no -2, es casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa trabaja como domestica y así ayuda en los gastos. El Sr. M. es trabajador de una institución donde desempeña el cargo de Gastos Fiscales en donde tiene ya cuatro años de estar laborando. Con el préstamo quiere reparar el techo del porche de su casa y estar preparado para el invierno. El comenzó vendiendo productos lácteos y uno de los dueños le ofreció un trabajo diferente. Su nivel de vida ha mejorado a futuro espera a un lograr mas beneficios para su familia.

loans.use: Repairs to his home.

loans.name: Thelma Ivania

texts.es:
Thelma Ivania is requesting a loan to invest in a home improvement project, which is to finish building a kitchen.

She has worked at the Rubén Darío Institute for the past 10 years. Ms. M. is a single mother of two daughters for whom she struggles to give the best she can. The oldest is 14 years old and in the 4th year of secondary school and the youngest is 12 years old and studies sixth grade. In her free time and in the afternoons, Thelma sells cosmetics. She carries out her work with great responsibility and is a woman who wants to advance professionally. She has struggled for her family so that her daughters are not wanting for anything. Her dream is to have work stability and that her daughters study.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra.Thelma Ivania está solicitando su refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es terminar de construir la cocina de su casa.

Labora para el Instituto Rubén Darío desde hace 10 años; es importante mencionar que la Sra. M. es madre soltera de dos hijas por las cuales lucha para brindarles lo mejor de si, la mayor de 14 años estudia 4to año de educación secundaria y la menor de 12 años estudia su sexto grado; en las horas libres y por las tardes se dedica a vender cosmeticos, doña Thelma desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad , es una mujer que desea superarse en lo profesional, ha luchado por su familia para que a sus hijas no les falte nada, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y que su hijas estudien.

loans.use: Finish building a kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta makes wool blankets by hand through spinning and weaving. She has a husband who has a job in selling sand for cement manufacturing (which is considered poorly paid work in the construction sector). The address of the client in this Irpavi II (La Paz), but she is not the owner and thus serves as caretaker.

This is her fifth loan in Impro and her third in Kiva. Her rating is Customer I (Excellent). The loan will be used for working capital to purchase sheep leather, thread and wool.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Modesta elabora mantas D. vicuña, todo esto lo hace D. forma manual, es decir que tiene que hilar y luego tejer. Tiene un esposo que se dedica a arenero (un trabajo mal pagado en el ramo D. la construcción). El domicilio D. la clienta esta en Irpavi II (La Paz) pero ella no es la propietaria por lo que hace D. cuidadora.

Este es su quinto préstamo en Impro y el tercero en Kiva, su calificación es D. cliente I (excelente). El préstamo será destinado para capital D. trabajo (cuero D. oveja, hilos y lana).

loans.use: For purchasing sheep leather, thread, and wool

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 37-year-old married man and father of three children. He lives in a village close to Saida in the southern part of Lebanon. He owns a grocery, house supply, and toy store in the same neighborhood where he lives.

Hassan has been a microcredit client of A. Majmoua for the past two years. He used the previous loans to expand his business by diversifying his store inventory. Hassan now needs a loan of $1200 to complete the payment of a pick-up truck. Once he gets this truck, he will be able to increase his income by selling fruits and vegetables from home to home. Indeed, his current income from the grocery shop is not sufficient to ensure a good livelihood for his family.

loans.use: Complete the payment of a pick-up truck

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret T. is 36 years old and married with two kids. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. She needs the loan to enable her to re-stock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc to scale up sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to raise enough income to sponsor her kids' education. She belongs to the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Her photograph was taken when her group was having a meeting. She would be thankful for that support.

loans.use: Margaret would like to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. for her small grocery shop.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de tres hijos (dos varones de 08 y 04 años de edad y una mujer de 06 años de edad), estudió segundo de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Puno s/n, distrito de Mazocruz, provincia del Collao, Puno.

Hace 03 años la invitaron a una reunión de amigas en el Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz, lugar donde ella se informó sobre los créditos y decidió integrar el Banco Comunal. Con su primer crédito de S/.300 Nuevos Soles aumentó su capital y compró prendas de vestir para niños y bebes para comercializarlo en la ciudad de Mazocruz.

Doña Elsa formó su hogar a los 19 años de edad, empezando así a vender verduras, frutas, comida, de esa manera fue acumulando capital. Cambió de negocio desde el año pasado, dedicándose a la compra y venta de carne de alpaca, llama y de ovino, también compra y vende lana de ovino, fibra de alpaca, llama y paralelamente tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. 

Con el crédito de S/.2,300 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 04 cuotas, comprará carne, lana de ovino, fibra de alpaca y de llama para ser comercializados a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos estudien y que no se queden atrás, Elsa no pude estudiar porque sus padres se separaron cuando apenas tenía 09 años de edad junto con su hermano menor. Su padre los apoyó hasta donde pudo, gracias a Dios ahora su hermano trabaja en el extranjero”.
texts.en:
Elsa is 27 years old, married and the mother of 3 children (two boys, ages 8 and 4 and a girl, age 6). She studied through the second year of high school and she lives in Jr. Puno s/n, district of Mazocruz, province of Collao, Puno Three years ago she was invited to a meeting of the community bank "Generation 2000" in Mazocruz, where she learned about loans and decided to join the community group. With her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles she increased her capital and bought clothing for children and babies in order to market it in the city of Mazocruz. Elsa started her home when she was 19 years old, beginning with selling fruit, vegetables, food, and in this way she accumulated capital. She changed her business last year and now she buys and sells the meat of alpaca, llama, and sheep, and also buys and sells sheep's wool, alpaca and llama fiber and additionally she has a small grocery store. With the loan of 2,300 Nuevos Soles, which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy meat, sheep's wool, fiber of alpaca and llama to sell to the wholesalers of the city of Tacna. Her greatest dream is that her children will study and not fall behind. Elsa couldn't continue her studies because her parents separated when she was just 9 years old along with her younger brother. Her father supported them when he could, and thanks to God now her younger brother works outside the country.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, sheep's wool, fiber of alpaca and llama, etc.

loans.name: Chul

texts.en: Mrs. Phal C. is 29 years old and makes a living selling groceries in her village. She is married to Mr. Phal Cheng and has two children, both of whom live at home in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. To increase their income and better support their young family, Phal and her husband need a loan to buy a store where they will sell pork. They will also use the loan to buy pigs to sell. The loans will help them improve their business and their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a store to sell pork and pigs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hire of a farm worker to help harvest output and plow farmland

loans.name: Yanirys Oneyda

texts.es: La Joven  Yanirys Oneyda S. S., tiene la edad de 20 años habita en el barrio monimbo ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya, junto a sus padres, ella es soltera, no tiene hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio e incrementar su inventarios; ella desde hace dos años trabaja como vendedora de zapatos para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar a sus padres. Sus sueños de esta joven es llegar a establecer su negocio para poder darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia, con esta solicitud es para invertir en zapatos variados, y otros productos que pueda ofertar a sus  clientes En futuro es Poder cumplir sus metas proyectadas y lograr lo que siempre ha deseado.
texts.en:
The young woman Yanirys Oneyda S. S. is 20 years old and lives in the Monimbo neighborhood located in the city of Masaya with her parents. She is single, does not have any children and her future plans are to improve the condition of her business and increase her inventory. For the last two years she has worked selling shoes to be able to help her parents with the household expenses. The dream of this young woman is to be able to establish her business to be able to give her family a better quality of life. This request is to invest in a variety of shoes and other products that she was offer to her clients. In the future she wants to achieve the goals set and accomplish what she has always wished.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes for children and adults

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Khoái  51 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Khi mới tham gia vào Quỹ chị Khoái chỉ vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi nhưng đến năm 1998 chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư kinh doanh các mặt hàng thực phẩm khô.  Đến nay sau 13 năm tham gia Quỹkinh tế gia đình chị đã ngày càng phát triển. Năm 2007 chị đã đầu tư mở thêm một của hàng làm nhôm kính để tạo công ăn việc làm cho con trai. Thu nhập của gia đình chị hiện nay đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Khoái mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng thực phẩm khô để phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Khoái, 51 years old, has participated in the TYM Fund since 1995. When she first joined, she only borrowed money to invest in raising animals, but in 1998 she boldly took a loan to invest in a new business selling dry goods. During her 13 years of membership in the Fund, the financial situation of her family has steadily improved. In 2007, she opened another shop on the same model in order to provide a livelihood for her son. Currently, the total family income is 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Khoái hopes to borrow 15,000,000 (875 USD) to buy dry goods and other foodstuffs that will meet the needs of local residents during the lunar new year holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dry goods

loans.name: Lesbia Azucena

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Lesbia V. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de venta de comida el cual comercializa muy amablemente en su localidad donde atiende todos los días siendo visitada por sus clientes. 

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para la preparación de los alimentos. Es importante destacar que por medio de este crédito se beneficia grandemente y apoya a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Sandino in the city of Managua, Lesbia Villaneuva dedicates herself arduously to her restuarant business that she runs very graciously from her locale where she attends every day to be patronized by her clients.

The reason why she has come to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) is to acquire a loan that will allow her to purchase ingredients to prepare her foods. It is important emphasize that by means of this loan she will see great benefit in that she supports her family who need her support so much.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Muruf

texts.en: Muruf A. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. He sells automotive batteries. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN  (about $550 USD) to purchase more batteries to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more batteries to sell

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.ru: Караев Рахмат житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 49 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается выпечкой лепешек. Имеет пекарню, которая находится на рынке "Дехкон". Там  же и реализует свою продукцию. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить муку. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahmat Q. lives in Tursun-Zoda. He is 49 years old, is married and has four children. He bakes flatbread. Rahmat owns a bakery that is located at the “Dehkon” market. He also sells his products there. He plans to take out a loan in order to purchase flour. He will be able to pay back his loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Marbely

texts.es: Marbely F. tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de pan, actividad que realiza desde su casa, ella tiene la ayuda de una empleada para la fabricacion de su producto, este lo distribuye en diferentes negocios, con los ingresos que genera le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene 3 hijos, esta actividad la aprendio de su madre y le ha servido para toda la vida, ya que este oficio le ha permitido satisfacer sus nesesidades a apoyar a su esposo, ella nos comento que sueña con tener una fabrica que le permita producir mas pan y emplear a muchas personas ya que aqui en esta zona el empleo es muy poco y asi ella puede abrir oportunidades para mucha gente, el sueño de ella es que su producto se pueda vender en todo honduras.
texts.en:
For more than ten years, Marbely F. has been making and selling bread from her home. She learned how to do this from her mother and she has done it all her life. She has one employee who helps her produce her products which are distributed to various businesses. She has three children. This trade has enabled her to satisfy her desire to help out her husband and with the income from this she is able to help him with the household expenses. She told us she dreams of having a bakery where she could produce a lot of bread and employ many people. In this area there is not much employment and this would allow her to create opportunities for many people. She dreams of being able to sell her products throughout Honduras.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, lard, flour, eggs, margarine, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru: Асрор Кахоров 1980 года рождения . женат имеет 2 детей. Кахор закончил всего лишь 10 классов в школе. закончив школу он учился у дяди  мясника. Откормив скот он продавал мясо по рыночной цене.  Сейчас он  продолжает  своё дело. Покупает корову или быка через пару месяцев продает мяса.  Также его приглашают резать коров. Дома содержит скот  около шести лет. На кредит от КИВА и построил расширил свой коровник.
texts.en:
Asror K. was born in 1980, he is married and has 2 children. Asror finished just 10 grades in school. Having finished school he studied with this uncle, a butcher. After fattening livestock he sold meat at market prices. Right now he continues his business. He purchases a cow or a bull and after a few months sells the meat. He is also invited to butcher cows. He has been keeping livestock at home for around six years. He used his KIVA loan to build/expand his cow shed.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening livestock

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Independientes.
Roxana es casada tiene 41 años, tres hijos de 24, 15 y 10 años, los menores están estudiando en la escuela estatal  
 Estudio cosmetología, y trabajo en una peluquería, decidió  estudiar repostería, y se especializo en buffet, al tiempo tuvo que dejar la peluquería por que el buffet le demandaba más tiempo y le rendía más económicamente, actualmente solo se dedica al servicio de buffet.
Roxana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de menajes de cocina y telas para  hacer manteles.
Desde que está en Finca  aprendió la responsabilidad y ahorrar para llegar a cumplir su sueño. 
El sueño de Roxana es tener su local de buffet, donde atienda al público, y comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the bank "Bancocomunal Mujeres Independientes". Roxana is married, 41 years old, and has three children aged 24, 15, and 10. The youngest children study in public school. She studied cosmetology and worked in a salon. She decided to study pastrymaking, specializing in buffets. The time came when she had to leave the salon because the buffet was demanding more time and was producing better financially. Now she only dedicates herself to servicing the buffet. Roxana needs a loan of 2,000 soles for the purchase of kitchenware and fabric to make tablecloths. Since she has been with Kiva partner Finca, she learned to be responsible and to save to achieve her dream. Roxana's dream is to have her own local buffet, where she services the public, and also to buy herself a car.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roxana needs a loan of 2,000 soles to purchase kitchenware and fabric to make tablecloths.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 24 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Thaer has been making and selling sculpture for eight years. Thaer requested a loan of 600 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase materials for his sculptures. This is the first time that Thaer has requested a loan. 
Thaer is speciA. in his work because of his creativity. His clients are engineers and graphic designers. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash. Jihad decided on doing his business because he took after his father’s business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by making himself known even outside his region.

loans.use: Thaer will use the loan to purchase materials for his sculptures.

loans.name: Sapa Group

texts.en:
Here are Hawanatu T., Abibatu S., Adama K., and Fatmata F.. They are businesswomen in Waterloo small-town, about twenty miles from Freetown city. They named their group Sapa. This is the first loan Sapa group members are receiving from SMT, a Partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to help them develop their businesses. 

Hawanatu T. (left) is the leader of the Sapa group. Hawanatu is twenty-six years of age, single with one child who is still in nursery school. She was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. She now lives in Waterloo as a result of the ten-year-long civil war.  Hawanatu has been a businesswoman for three years now. She sells lace, cotton, and uniform materials. She will invest this loan into her business so that it will grow. Hawanatu’s ambition is to become an international businesswoman, she told me.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 1 sont toutes des femmes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Massoukou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone.
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir réaliser leurs activités hivernales. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir 9 hectares.
Après la récolte  la production sera vendue dans les marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes généralement au comptant. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 17.500FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 1 souhaitent la continuation de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et ambitionnent avoir des montants plus élevés.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are all married women, who average 50 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Massoukou, one of the village of the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They exclusively grow peanuts, which is still the main crop in the area.

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 9 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold, usually for cash, at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 17'500 (ca US$ 35) per campaign. The women of the Benkadi 1 group wish to pursue their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and ambition to obtain higher loans.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 9 hectares

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 32 years old and she is single. She is a nurse by profession and she also has a store where she sells medicine.  She hopes for a loan of NGN 60,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Ipogolo D Group

texts.en:
Edina is a member of the Ipogolo d borrower group,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 20 and 18 years.

Edina Started her own clothing business 6 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 90,000 Tsh.

This is Edina`s first loan from BRAC.she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Edina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Leonida is also a member of the same borrower group,she also requested loan amount 250,000 Tsh in order to expand her own food business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Aurea es casada, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Aurea viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende verduras y panes, y de las ferias compra cereales, animales, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho de manera ambulatoria.
Aurea necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
El sueño de Aurea es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aurea is a member of the Arco Iris Community Bank. Aurea, 45, is married and has seven children. Aurea travels to different regional fairs to sell vegetables and bread. At the fairs she buys grains and animals. She then sells them in an ambulatory manner at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Aurea needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy grains. Aurea’s dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains

loans.name: Abi

texts.fr: Mme Abi est mère de 02 enfants, et est mariée. Elle a appris le métier de couture ; en 2002, elle a ouvert sa boutique de couture dans le quartier d’Ablogamé à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la vie du foyer. Elle a appris la haute couture, activité qu’elle exerce dans la perfection, ce qui lui permet de fidéliser sa clientèle. Elle dispose aussi des apprentis couturières qui l’aident dans sa tâche. Actuellement elle est débordée dans sa tâche, c’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre Janôme, afin de pouvoir répondre à temps aux commandes de ses clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abi is the mother of 2 children and she is married. She learned to be a seamstress and in 2002 she opened up a sewing workshop in the Ablogamé neighborhood in Lomé. This business allows her to contribute to supporting her family. She learned 'haute couture', which she is very good at, and that keeps her clients coming back. She also has apprentice seamstresses who help her. Presently, she is overwhelmed with work so she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a new sewing machine (Janôme brand) so that she can get customers' orders ready on time.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his mill

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 44 years old and happily married with five children. She sells groceries and plastics in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a year.

Joy is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more groceries and plastics to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and plastics to sell

loans.name: Catherine Nafula

texts.en:
Catherine M. operates a cereal business. She buys cereals from different farmers and sells them at a profit. Catherine is 32 years old, married and has been blessed with seven children. Her business is located at Kona in Eldoret. She was introduced to KADET by a neighbour who was a client. She has applied for a loan which she intends to use to buy more maize stock. Her dreams for the future are to improve her business and further educate her children.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en: Ngin S. has been in the farming business for years. She plants a rice crop to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Her husband is a local building worker who travels everywhere around his commune to work in construction. They have been married for years and are the parents of three children, all of whom are students. The rice harvest season approaches; Ngin S. is looking for capital to buy rice in bulk to resell for profit.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to resell for profit

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 39 years old and married with five children aged between 10 and 20 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a three room house where she is staying with eight people. Jane takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She has a stall selling all food stuffs like bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes in Mengo mackay. She pays dues of 1000/= per day. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala  She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 40 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children and rent for her business premise. Her major business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season which hinders her to reach her customers. She has been in this business for eighteen years and with MCDT for eight years servicing her seventeenth loan, working with the same group mates. Jane joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes. She is aspiring of seeing her business grower bigger and start going directly to farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava and irish potatoes

loans.name: Look To We Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Look To We' group. These women are petty business people in the small town of Waterloo, located near Freetown, the capital city. They have been in business for many years now but due to the lack of sufficient working capital, their businesses have not been performing in an encouraging manner. This has therefore led them to SMT/'Shine on Sierra Leone' to apply for a loan of SLL 600,000 each. With this loan at hand, they can expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality.

The group’s leader is Isatu A. K. on the left of the photo. The 41-year-old sells peppers, green leaves (used in cooking), green seeds, okra (used in sauce) and other market food. Isatu A. K. who was born in Makeni city is now residing and doing her business in Waterloo. She has been a businesswoman for more than ten years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy four bags of peppers and twenty dozen green seeds. She sells the seeds to farmers for planting. With the help of this loan, this mother of four, together with her pepper-selling husband, can render great support to their children and in running the home.

loans.use: Buy four bags of peppers and twenty dozen green seeds

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola has two businesses: she sells both clothes and eggs. She has been running these business since 1995 and they are her primary source of income.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 in order to purchase more clothes and eggs to sell. With the combined businesses, she is able to provide for her family's basic needs to afford other necessities. With the loan, she plans to expand her businesses, which are now thriving. With this kind of business, she hopes to increase on her earnings in the long run and to be better able to provide for her children's education. She sends her thanks to all her lenders.

Bola lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and is married with three children, all of whom are doing well in school.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and eggs for sale

loans.name: Retoño Group
