texts.es: El banco  comunal "Retoño" esta representado por la señora Jenoveba y conformada por 14 miembros que van cursando juntos un tercer ciclo demostrando unidad y solidaridad con sus compañeros, son un grupo alegre y muy cumplido por lo que se les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo y desarrollando un capital D. trabajo suficiente para mejorar su calidad D. vida. Una gran Mayoría D. los socios se dedica al ámbito comercial como la venta D. refrescos, venta D. comida, venta D. ropa para niños y jóvenes y venta D. perfumes (Avon, Esika y Ebel), otros se dedican a prestar servicios como el transporte, peluquería, odontología, costura y mecánica dental. Todos se dedican muy conscientemente a sus negocios y saben lo importante que es  tratar bien a los clientes ya que esa es la diferencia con sus competidores. El des tino del financiamiento es para la inversión en sus fuentes D. trabajo como la compra D. insumos, materiales D. trabajo y herramientas mas modernas para prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Entre las expectativas D. los clientes esta la educación D. sus hijos que es primordial para cada uno D. los socios así como el deseo D. la superación personal con cursos y negocios mas fructíferos que brinden una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias.
texts.en:
The community bank "Retoño" is represented by Mrs. Jenoveba and is maD. up of 14 members who are completed a third cycle together showing unity and solidarity with their partners. They are a happy group and reliable with their payments which is why they were offered new economic support so that they can continue to grow and develop sufficient capital to improve their quality of life. A large majority of the members work in the commercial sector selling drinks, food, children's clothing, and perfume sales (Avon, Esika, and Ebel). Others work in the service sector in areas like transport, hairdressing, dentistry, sewing, and dental services. They are all conscientious workers with their businesses and they know how important it is to treat the clients well because that differentiates them from their competitors. The loan will be used to invest in their different businesses by purchasing supplies, work materials, and modern tools in order to offer better service to their clients. The primary hope of the group is good education for their children as well as personal improvement and more profitable businesses which will proviD. a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations (sales and services)

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar M. is 28 years old and lives in Sevan with her husband, mother-in-law and two sons. One of her sons is school-aged while the other goes to kindergarten. Gohar is a teacher and worked in this profession for several month before leaving in order to take care of her children. In 2009, Gohar set up her own business in a rented space. She sells women's, men’s and children’s clothes. Gohar is requesting a loan of 800,000 AMD to expand her business by buying spring clothing to resell.

loans.use: To buy spring clothing to resell

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia.  Her two children go to secondary school. Her husband operates a taxi service with his own car. They bought their plot of land with a fence and a ger (a traditional Mongolin housing tent), where they have been living since 2009.  

Bayarmaa and her husband bought their car and plot of land using the profits from their businesses. During the day, she has been renting a room in the Urgoo trading center, near the Ganbogd market, for her hairdressing business. She started working as a professional hairdresser and started her business in 2000. She says, “I would like to establish my own workplace.” She is requesting a 120,000 tugrug loan to purchase products such as hair cream, hair dye and shampoo.

loans.use: To purchase products for hairdressing business

loans.name: Inocente

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	En la comarca las mariitas sector el nance dulce, la señora Inocente C. M., se ha dedicado a la producción agropecuaria donde ha desarrollado actividades como la crianza de ganado y establecimiento de cultivos agrícolas de subsistencia, dentro de estos rubros están la crianza de ganado bobino y porcino y los cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo y en algunas ocasiones frijoles, dichas actividades le aseguran sus alimentos y algunos ingresos para su mantención familiar, doña Inocente C. ha proporcionado con estos rubros lo necesario para la crianza y educación de sus cinco hijos, los que le ayudan en sus actividades diarias, con el crédito pretende comprar alambre para realizar la mejora de sus fincas y la compra de una vaca parida con la que espera mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Inocente C. M. raises livestock and farms in the Las Mariitas region of the Nance Dulce sector. She raises cattle and pigs. She grows crops like corn, sesame, sorghum, and sometimes beans. These activities assure her food and some income to support her family. With these activities Inocente C. has provided the necessities for raising and educating her five children. The children help her everyday. With the loan she plans on buying wire to make improvements on her farm. She will also buy a dairy cow in the hopes of improving the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wire and a dairy cow

loans.name: Ngourn

texts.en:
Ngourn M. is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three children.

M. is engaged in growing bananas on her own plot of farmland, earning an income of 2.50 USD per day to help cover her family expenses. Her husband operates his horse and cart in the village to provide transportation services and buys bananas for resale, earning an income of 4.80 USD per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses.

M. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy bananas to stock for sale when the price is good. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy bananas to stock for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria S. is from Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old and is married with four children. Victoria operates a business which is sari sari (variety) store and her husband is a farmer and sometimes a tricycle driver. She earns approximately earns 5,000 a month from her business. Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financing and to engage in other business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loan of 12,000 from PMPC.This previous loan was used for the expansion of her business. As of now, Victoria has a new loan of 25,000 from PMPC and this loan is intended for the repair of her house. This is her 4th loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for house repair and as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Modi

texts.en:
Modi H. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and firewood at home and is requesting a loan to help her stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Modi is thirty-five years old and is married to a soldier. She has two children, who are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward assisting returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcaol to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Progress People Group

texts.en:
Augustus F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Progress People. He is 22 years old, single and a sophomore student in high school.

For 3 years, he has been selling phone cards and petroleum products (gas) in Gardnesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He started his business with 500 Liberian Dollars that his mother gave him.

He plans to use his 7,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 33,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more phone cards and petroleum products (gas).

His dream is to grow his business, make a profit, save, and be able to go to college so that he can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards and petroleum products (gas)

loans.name: Shahida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Shahida Perveen lives in the second-largest city of Pakistan, named Lahore. She has three children, and her husband has his own shuttering business. She is applying for a loan for her husband’s business so that he can buy more shuttering materials such as timbers and ropes for his shop.

It is always important in any business that you always keep available stock to fulfill the needs of the clients on the spot. Her husband will do the same with the help of the loan to make sure that he doesn’t face any problems of material shortage.

Shahida perveen couldn’t educate her first two sons but she wishes her youngest son will complete his education; he is in 5th class. She is hopeful that an investment in her husband’s business will enable him to increase his income which will bring new happiness to the family and help her son to complete his education.

Note: The women behind these five ladies are not connected with this group.

loans.use: To purchase more shuttering materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda W. is currently in the business of making local Sudanese bread cooked in oil and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and cooking oil .  Roda is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie A. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 young children. Winnie owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Winnie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Winnie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Winnie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Winnie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn O. is from the village of Upperville, Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Merlyn is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business buying and selling of fish as well as dried fish  as her another business aside from doing manicure and pedicure  in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Amintor Mariano

texts.es:
Amintor de 45 años, el es vendedor de ropa y accesorios, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 1 años. 

Cuando era joven el trabajo como mensajero en el ejercito, un día el papa le regalo un reloj que valía en ese entonces $250 sucres (moneda antigua Ecuatoriana),  Amintor al dirigirse a su trabajo se encontró con un amigo que le ofreció $ 800. sucres por el reloj que estaba utilizando, así que lo vendió y consiguió otros para venderlos. Con ayuda del papa que era comerciante de relojes el comenzó a venderlos y comprarlos. Ahora el es comerciante de relojes, ropa y  accesorios.

Para el continuar vendiendo su mercadería quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y accesorios, en el futuro quiere tener un almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
Amintor, 45, sells clothing and accessories. He lives in an urban zone in the suburb of Guayaquil and has 2 children - 10 and 1 years of age. When he was young Amintor worked as a courier for the army. One day his father gave him a watch that was valued at 250 sucres (the old Ecuadorian currency). While making his way to work he bumped into a friend who offered him 800 sucres for the watch he was using, and so he sold it and found others to sell. With the help of his father, who was a watch salesman, he began selling and buying them. Now Amintor is a watch, clothing and accessories salesman. To continue selling his merchandise he wants to use this loan to purchase clothes and accessories. In the future Amintor would like to have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and accessories

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur AMADOU K. est marié à deux  femmes et est père de 2 enfants (1garçon et 1fille). Il est né vers 1971 à KARAGOUAN un des villages de la commune de la préfecture de Kadiolo, (3eme région administrative du Mali).  Il vit dans sa maison avec ses épouses et leurs enfants à KADIOLO.
Il fait commerce général depuis 2 ans  avec la vente de céréales et d’articles divers de boutique qu’il fait durant toute l’année. Expérimenté en raison des années d’activité, il le fait avec beaucoup de réussite. 
Il est à sa première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  Il affirme que cette collaboration  lui sera d’un apport considérable car le montant obtenu lui permettra de satisfaire la demande d’assez de ses clients. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt deux tonnes de maïs, il s’approvisionne à KARAGOUAN et dans les villages avoisinants de KADIOLO.
Il vend au comptant, souvent à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Souvent il vend ses céréales sur commande.
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à KADIOLO ville.
texts.en:
Mr. AMADOU K. is married to two women and is the father of two children (a boy and a girl). He was born around 1971 in KARAGOUAN, one of the villages in the commune of the Kadiolo prefecture (3rd administrative region of Mali). He lives in his house with his wives and their children in KADIOLO . He has been in general commerce for 2 years, selling grains and a variety of items that he makes during the year. Experienced from his years in business, he has a great deal of success. This is his first collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. He declares that this collaboration will be a significant benefit to him because the amount obtained will enable him to adequately satisfy customer demand. With his loan, he plans to buy two tons of corn. He gets his supplies in KARAGOUAN and in the neighboring villages of KADIOLO. His sales are in cash, often by credit (wholesale and retail) to a clientele composed of men and women. He often sells his grains on order. He foresees making a monthly profit of 80,000 CFA, some of which will be used to increase his working capital and the remainder put into savings because he hopes to build a house to live in the town of KADIOLO.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grains

loans.name: Laura Alfonsina

texts.es:
Laura de 49 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Cuando ella era pequeña su familia tenia una tienda. Ella quiso seguir los mismo pasos de ellos y tener su tienda. Poco a poco con esfuerzo compro algunos víveres y los ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para la tienda quiere el préstamo por eso quiere  comprar  arroz, aceites, azúcar. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener una papelería.
texts.en:
Laura, age 49, live in a periurban area called Fortín. It is characterized by its dirt paths and hills. She has a grocery store in the front part of her house. When she was little her family had a store. She wanted to follow in their footsteps and have her own store. Little by little, and with hard work, she bought some groceries and set them up in the front part of her house. She now works from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. everyday. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, oil, and sugar for her store. In the future she wants to expand her business and have a stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Blanca Ofelia

texts.es:
Blanca T. A., trabaja en su negocio desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde junto con sus hijos y esposo en el sacado de las piedras cantera.
Ha trabajado alrededor de 19 préstamos con ceprodel.
 
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de una camioneta para el traslado de las piedras canteras, (complemento).
 Tiene cuatro hijos dos de ellos trabajan por cuenta propia y los otros dos trabajan con ella.
texts.en:
Blance T. A. works in her business from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. with her children and husband in the excavation of quarry stone. She has worked with 19 loans with Cenprodel.

The requested loan is for the purchase of a truck for transporting the quarry rocks. (complement) She has four children two of who work independently and two who work with her.

loans.use: The purchase of a vehicle(COMPLEMENT)

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is 55 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and employs one farmhand. His farm is currently producing milk at a low quantity which is only enough for the family's consumption. He also earns income from his spare-parts shop.

Abdallah has requested this loan of 60,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry business. He says that the proceeds from his poultry business will go towards the education of his children. He says that his major challenge has been disease which is too expensive to treat. In the future, he would like to expand his farm and venture fully into dairy farming.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Luisa Lilliam

texts.es:
La señora Luisa se ha destacado por vender frutas y verduras en el M. Mayoreo donde a diario ofrece los productos a todas las personas que visitan el M.. Ella lleva al sustento a su hogar y también es importante destacar que mantiene a tres pequeñas nietas por lo que duplica sus esfuerzos para obtener dichos ingresos y así sustentar su núcleo familiar.

El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de las frutas y verduras en especial en la compra de naranjas. Ella confía que el crédito le será proporcionado y así venderá dichas naranjas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa has been known for selling fruits and vegetables at the Wholesale Market where she offers her products every day to those who visit the market. It is important to note that she has to support her household, which also includes three young granddaughters. Therefore, she must double her efforts so that she can generate income to provide for her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits and vegetables, especially oranges. Luisa hopes that her loan will be granted so that she can sell these oranges to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase oranges to sell

loans.name: Ashra's Group

texts.en: Ashra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s construction supply business. With the loan he will buy cement, bricks, etc in bulk that will help him to fill larger orders on time. Ashra hopes that her husband’s business will improve with this loan, which will result in improving her family’s lifestyle. Ashra got married 12 years ago and became the mother of two sons. Her financial condition is not good enough to send her children to school yet, but she hopes that her husband’s improved business condition will enable her to send them to school in the near future. Ashra lives with her family in Mianchannu which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives in a two-room brick house. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client and pays her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a construction supply business

loans.name: Santiago Leonardo

texts.es:
Santiago Leonardo M. T. tiene 22 años. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene  hijo 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Santiago    se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Santiago Leonardo  M. T. is 22 years old.  He is single.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the community bank 'Unidos Somos Más' (Together We Are More) is located in  Marañon district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Santiago has been growing corn, rice and beans for 3 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan would help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, crop diseases and changes in the climate.  His dream is to have his own home.  Santiago likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
K. Sherali is 40 years old, married, and has four children. He has spent many years growing wheat and vegetables on land that was given to him by his father.  Together with his wife and brother, he works hard in the field so that he can send his children to school in the future when they are older. Sherali says, "Life in the field is never easy. I plow using the traditional method all day, not minding the heat of the sun because I have an ultimate goal for my kids, and that is to give them a better future." 

Sherali is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you’re giving him.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Guapa, se conformó en  agosto de 2.010, en la ciudad de Carmen del Paraná y renuevan en el 2do ciclo, con 10 integrantes. En el primer ciclo estaban 19 integrantes en el comité, y por una cuestión de diferencia de puntos de vista decidieron dividir el grupo y quedarse  entre las que mejor trabajaba. 

Las actividades a las que se dedican las señoras son diversas, por ejemplo, pesca y venta de pescado, fabricación y venta de ladrillos, al comercio, entre otros. 
La directora general del comité, Ramona A. tiene 56 años de edad  y junto con su marido Juan V. tiene una fábrica de ladrillos en su residencia. Juntos tienen 2 hijos.

Doña Ramona es una señora muy sacrificada y trabaja a la par de su marido para ayudar en la fábrica que tienen juntos. 
Fue beneficiaria de una casa construida por la Entidad Binancional Yacyreta, con lo que pudo acceder a un mejor conford en su vivienda. 
Solicita el préstamo para la  reparación del horno donde se realiza la cocción de los ladrillos.

El comité es nuevo y estan aprendiendo y tomado conciencia de la importancia de trabajar en equipo, además de ser concientes de la importancia de desarrollar el espiritu emprendedor para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa Women's Committee was founded in August 2010, in the city of Carmen del Paraná and they are now in their second loan cycle with 10 members.  There were 19 members during the first loan cycle but, owing to some differences of opinion, they decided to split the group up and retain the  members who worked best.

The ladies' business activities are varied and include fishing and selling fish, making and selling bricks, and sales.

The head of the committee is Ramona A. who is 56 years old.  She and her husband Juan V. have a brick factory at their home.  They have 2 children together.

Ramona is a very selfless woman who works with her husband, helping in their factory.  She was the beneficiary of a house built by Entidad Binacional Yacyreta and this provided her with more comfort in her home.  She is requesting this loan to fix the oven where she bakes her bricks.

This is a new committee and they are learning and becoming aware of the importance of teamwork and the need to develop their entrepreneurial spirit in order to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy clay

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man H. is 52 years old, widowed, and has eight adult children, two of whom are married and six of whom are single.  She lives in Phnom Penh City. Man H. has been earning her living by selling fish in her community since 2005. She sells fish that she buys from her supplier. She also rents her house to make additional income. Presently, Man H. hires motor taxis to pick up her fish for sale in her village, which costs her a lot of money.  Therefore, she hopes to reduce the amount she spends on transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her fish to sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more shoe repairing materials

loans.name: Ne'matullo

texts.ru: Хакимов Неъматулло проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 43 года. Он женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Неъматулло имеет высшее образование, педагог. Он более 15 лет проработал в средней школе. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей на рынке Саховат. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Ne'matullo H. lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Ne'matullo has a higher education as a teacher.  He spent 15 years working at a secondary school.  Today, he is involved in retail sales at the Sahovat market.  He has a store, where he sells food products.  He has been in this business for 5 years.  Ne'matullo is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.  He wants to expand his business.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 42 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de chincheros, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa unión tiene  6 hijos, ella nos cuenta que en la ciudad de chinchero se encuentra una de las más importantes ciudad arqueológicas del Imperio de los Incas y por ende las mayoría de los pobladores se dedican  a la elaboración, venta y compra de artesanía.  Celia pertenece a la Asociación de Artesanos de “AyawasiTocapo” de la ciudad de Chinchero. 

Celia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboración de artesanía como por ejemplo chompas, guantes, chullos y chalinas hechos en base de lana de alpaca.
texts.en:
Celia is 42 years old and was born in the city of Chincheros. She is married and from this beautiful union she has 6 children. She told us that in the city of Chinchero you can find one of the most important archeological cities of the Incan Empire, and because of this, most of the residents work making selling and buying handicrafts. Celia belongs to the Artisan Association of "AyawasiTocapo" of the city of Chinchero.

Celia at this time requires a loan to buy materials to make handicrafts such as sweaters, gloves, caps, and scarves made of alpaca wool.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Obida

texts.ru: Тошпулатова Обида проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 54 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Сыновья занимаются растениеводством. Сама Обида работает на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Этим видом деятельности занимается 3 года. Кредит берет для покупки апельсинов, бананов и киви.
texts.en: Obida T. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 54 years old. She is married and has three children. Her sons are doing agriculture. Obida works on the market where she rents out a vendor space where she sells fruits. She has been in this business for three years. She is taking out the loan to buy oranges, bananas and kiwi.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas and kiwi

loans.name: Fadela

texts.en:
Fadela is a 52-year-old widow and the mother to two children. She has worked at selling clothes since 2008 to keep herself and her children living after her husband's death. She describes life as harsh, because she has to struggle for living and providing the best she can for her children when there's no one to turn to or rely on.

She owns a small business, and wants to improve it through a second loan she requested from Al Majmoua. Her previous loan was effective and helped a lot in improving her social and financial situation. With this loan she plans to buy a new spring/summer clothes collection, in addition to starting a new business for her son. She wants to help him to open his own bakery and hopes he succeeds and helps her with their income and providing their needs. 

Fadela hopes to open a real shop one day, unlike the small table she uses now to put her merchandise on.

loans.use: to buy a new clothes collection to resell

loans.name: Lucy Maribel

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Lucy cuenta con grado de instrucción educación superior. 
La señora  se dedica  a la venta de abarrotes, trabaja  con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio venta de abarrotes.  Trabaja junto con su esposo;  También cuenta que es profesora.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 550.00 nuevo soles comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite, etc., para poder abastecer su tienda.
Su sueño es crecer y superarse en el negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir ideas con las socias y ser solidaria.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the community bank "Dulce Amanecer", located in the Puno district, province and department of Puno.  She is 39 years old, married, and has two school-aged children.  Lucy has one year of higher education instruction.  

She sells groceries.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used the money in her grocery business.  She works with her husband.  She is also a teacher.

With this new loan of 550 nuevos soles, she will purchase rice, sugar, pasta, milk, oil, and other items to stock her store.  Her dream is to grow and improve the business.

The thing she likes about the community bank is sharing ideas with other members and being supportive.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, pasta, milk, oil, and other items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Elenn Rosario

texts.es:
La Sra. Elenn Rosario pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento D. San Martín. Está casada, tiene 48 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, D. los cuales los dos mayores son varones y ya son independientes, solo la menor D. 16 años depenD. D. ella y es estudiante del nivel secundario.

La idea del negocio nace a raíz D. las investigaciones que ella realiza por el internet D. la importancia que le está  tomando la gente a los productos naturales y es así que con el apoyo D. su esposo, que estudio administración, se pusieron a realizar estudios D. mercado sobre productos naturales y se decidieron comprar al por mayor el café saludable (Lingzhi) y venderlos en los principales autoservicios y mercados del Distrito D. Tarapoto.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00, comprará un ciento D. cajas D. café orgánico natural para poder expandir su mercado a nivel Regional que día a día viene ganando mas clientela y ella considera que es importante mantenerlos satisfechos. 

Elenn Rosario, mujer creativa, soñadora se siente muy contenta y quiere continuar trabajando para la realización D. sus sueños y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Elenn Rosario, age 48, is a member of the communal bank “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”; the bank is located in the Tarapoto district of the San Martin province, which is located in the department of San Martin. Elenn is married and has three children: two sons are already grown and independent; only the younger 16-year-old daughter is in her care and is currently in secondary school.

Elenn had the idea for her business as was researching on the internet topics regarding the importance that people give to natural products. Following up on this with the help of her husband, who studied business administration, Elenn researched the market and decided to do a wholesale purchase of healthy coffee (Lingzhi) in order to commercialize it to auto service stations and various markets in the Tarapoto district.

Elenn will use the loan of 2,500 soles to purchase a hundred boxes of organic natural coffee in order to expand her market to regional level. She is gaining new clients every day, and it is very important to her that they remain satisfied with her services. Elenn is a creative woman and a dreamer. She feels happy about  continuing to work in order to realize her dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for providing help and development opportunities to women like her.

loans.use: to purchase natural organic coffee

loans.name: Pabla Petrona

texts.es: Pabla Petrona tiene 45 años, es una mujer luchadora y que le gusta trabajar de manera humilde. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, hace más de 10 años que inicio con esta actividad con el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues algunas veces no vende muchos productos, pero ella sale de manera ambulante a ofrecerlos. El financiamiento que solicito es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de polvos, lápiz labial, perfumes, body, cremas y tratamientos. El sueño de Pabla es que sus hijos sigan adelante con este negocio que es su medio de vida.
texts.en: Pabla is a 45-year-old woman who is a fighter and enjoys humble work. She makes a living selling cosmetics, which she started doing more than 10 years ago with the objective to make headway for her children. There were some times she did not sell a lot of products, but she went out to the streets to offer them. She is requesting the loan to purchase powders, lipstick, perfumes, body wash, creams and other treatments. Pabla's dream is for her children to keep moving forward with the business, which is their livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase powders, lipstick, perfumes, body wash, creams and other treatments.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen, 55, works in the garment industry in the Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh City. She has been working in this field since 2008, and receives a formal salary every month. She is married to Tuy who is a domestic rice farmer who spends most of his time working in the field. They depend on their three children who are employed in diverse jobs; two of them also work in the garment factory, one is employed as a car repairer. Khen would like to request some funds to buy a motorbike for riding to work as well as to go everywhere else.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for riding to work.

loans.name: Fatemah

texts.en:
Fatemah is a 56-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has worked since 1997 at selling baby diapers and sanitary napkins from her house. She intended to work from her house in order to stay next to her children. Taking good care of them at the same time made for the best management of her business.

This is Fatemah's eleventh cycle with Al Majmoua. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her capital through buying big quantities with special prices. In addition, she will help her son in building his own house, through a small payment she will give him.

Fatemah is encouraged by most of her customers, neighbors and family, and this what has helped her to stay this long and expand her business. She hopes to open a big shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying big quantities at special prices.

loans.name: Polo

texts.en:
Polo and his wife, Srong, live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1992 and have three sons and one daughter. 

Polo and his wife are vegetable farmers. He is asking for his second loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

Photo: Polo and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
Firuz is a hardworking man. He is married and the loving father of one child. 

Firuz has been engaged in selling sausages for the last six years. He purchases his products from Khujand and transports them with his own car. He distributes the goods to the local shops in Isfara city. 

He wants to expand his business and increase his working capital to buy more sausages to sell in order to make a good profit for his child. He wishes to give a good education to his child to provide him with the bright future.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy sausages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Yris Madeleini

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la señora Yris; la socia es casada y tiene 35 años de edad, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad; la socia trabaja en una institución  pública ella es asistenta social; la socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de su casa de campo que tiene entre Pisac y Calca y para ello la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en los acabados de esta casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de su casa de campo.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "GRANITO DE MOSTAZA" communal bank which is located in the Huanchac District in the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Yris, 35, is married and has two children, 19 and 12.  She is a social worker at a public institution.  She is requesting a loan for the construction of her country home between Pisac and Calca.  She plans to use it to finish the house.  

She is grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To finish construction of her country home.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Cynthia has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Cynthia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cynthia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Confianza Y Fe Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Confianza y Fe” está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa usada, comercio ambulante, venta de perfumes y venta de abarrotes. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Alma quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila del grupo, vistiendo una capa color azul y su cabello es corto ondulado. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 10 años. Específicamente se dedica a vender productos de confitería, además cuenta con máquinas de juego. Su negocio está ubicado al interior de su casa, en una habitación que habilitó para instalar su confitería. 
Comenta que le ha ido bien en su negocio y que las ganancias le han servido para costear los estudios de sus hijos e invertir en su confitería, ya que hace un tiempo instaló vitrinas para su confitería.
Su mercadería la compra a proveedores directamente.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su confitería, específicamente galletas, chocolates, jugos, leche, entre otros productos. 
Sus metas en su negocio son abastecer aún más su negocio, para captar un mayor número de clientes. Para esto necesita comprar una congeladora en forma de refrigerador para mantener los helados, bebidas y yogurt. 
Alma vive junto a uno de sus hijos quien anhela estudiar una carrera universitaria, para ser un profesional. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo esperanza. Se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del banco comunal, ya que realizan actividades juntos y esto ha generado una muy buena relación entre ellos.  Respecto a las capacitaciones estas le han servido para desempeñarse de mejor manera en sus negocios.  
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called “Confidence and Faith,” is composed of 19 entrepreneurs dedicated to different trades. Among them you will find a used clothing merchant, a street vendor, a perfume seller, and a grocer. They all come from the city of Temuco.

Alma, is in the second row in the photo, wearing a blue cap and has short wavy hair, She has been a merchant for 10 years. Specifically, she has a candy store with some game machines. The store is located in her house, which was modified to include her store.

She comments that the business has been doing well and her earnings have served to pay for her children's studies and invest in the candy store. Some time back, she installed glass cases. She buys her merchandise directly from proveyors.

With this loan she will buy merchandise for the candy store, specifically cookies, chocolates, juices, and milk, among other products. Alma's goal is to increase the store's merchandise in order to capture a larger number of customers. To do this, she needs to buy a refrigerator with a freezer to keep ice cream, drinks, and yogurt.

Alma lives with one of her children who hopes to pursue a university career and become a professional.

She is very content and grateful for the aid offered by the Esperanza Fund. Alma is very comfortable with her communal bank group. They carry out activities together and this generates good relations among them. The training sessions have served to better prepare them to run their businesses.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanian region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago, the captail of Chile. In the surrounding area there is a series of hot springs (including Pucon, Villarrica) and a very attractive native flora and fauna, concentrated in nature parks nearby. It's worth mentioning that 50% of the regions' residents are Mapuche, an indigenous people of our country.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her store; especially cookies, chocolates, juices, and milk, among other products.

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 
Nick has a shop that sells firewood & coconut charcoal. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy firewood to sell.
Nick is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Nick hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Manuel Salvador  se ha  caracterizado por ser una persona  muy trabajadora y se desempeña como ayudante fontanero en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace tres años. Es acompañado y con tres personas a su cargo y para brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. 

El  señor Manuel Salvado  ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para pagar deuda pendiente  con una institución bancaria referente a una tarjera de crédito ya que lo intereses se le ha incrementado y quedarse con una sola deuda.
texts.en:
Manuel Salvador is a hard-working person who works as an assistant plumber for a state institution in the Managua municipality.  He has been doing this work for three years.  He has a life partner and three people under his care, and he wants to give them a better standard of living.

Manuel Salvador has come to Ceprodel to request a loan.  The loan is to pay a pending debt with a banking institution relating to a credit cart.  The interest has increased, and he wants to be left with only one debt.

loans.use: to pay a personal expense.

loans.name: Saby Carol

texts.es:
Saby es socia del Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro” de la ciudad Puno en el departamento Puno. Vive con su pareja y tienen dos hijos de 9 y 11 años. 
Saby confecciona y vende artículos deportivos en una tienda que es suya y que mantiene desde hace más de cinco años. Aprendió a confeccionar gracias a sus padres y también ha heredado las ganas de hacer negocio, como nos cuenta. Inició este negocio por idea propia y sólo con la ayuda de su pareja. Él se encarga de hacer las costuras y estampados, mientras que ella hace las compras y atiende a los clientes. 
Iniciaron su negocio con un capital de S./ 500,00. Saby lleva un año con Manuela Ramos y su nuevo préstamos será de S./ 1,000.00. dinero que invertirá en la compra de telas para los polos y pelotas que confeccionará.
Su meta es tener una máquina bordadora para facilitar el trabajo y ahorrar tiempo. Lo que le gusta de Manuela Ramos son las capacitaciones y las reuniones donde las mujeres comparten anécdotas.
texts.en:
Saby is a member of the communal bank Semillas del Future (Seeds of the Future) located in the city of Puno in the department of Puno. She lives with her partner and they have two children 9 and 11 years old.

Savy makes and sells sporting goods in her own store that she has had for more than 5 years. She learned this occupation from her parents and also she inherited from them the desire to be in business, so she tells us. 

It was her own idea to begin this business only with the help of her husband. He is in charge of sewing and the patterns, while she takes care of purchases and assisting clients.

They began their business with 500 soles. Saby has been working with Manuela Ramos for a year and her new loan will be 1,000 soles that she will use in the purchase of materials needed to produce sport shirts and balls.

Her goal is to have an overlapping embroidery sewing machine to make their work easier and to save time. What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the training and the meetings where women get together and share their stories.

loans.use: to buy material at wholesale prices

loans.name: Turaje Group

texts.fr:
Concilie est une commerçante âgée de 42ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de la bière locale  depuis 28ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’alphabétisation. Elle est mariée a Melchiade ; un maçon et ont ensemble 5 enfants qui étudient. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bière locale à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Turaje»
texts.en:
Concilie, aged 42 years, is a merchant who lives in the town of Kibimba, in the province of Gitega, in the center of the country.  She has been in the business of selling local beer for 28 years.  She is also a farmer.  She has had enough schooling to be able to read.  She is married to Melchiade, a mason, and together they have 5 children who attend school.
The Kiva loan of 100,000 Burundi francs that she will get will increase her working capital and allow her to buy large quantities of local beer to sell in order to make good profits. 
She is a member of the community group “Turaje.”

loans.use: to buy large quantities of local beer to sell in order to make good profits.

loans.name: Alexis Bladimir

texts.es:
Alexis, es empleado y vive con su esposa y su hija, él es vendedor en una empresa pero trabaja en agricultura siembra de granos básicos como: frijoles y maíz el contrata a personas para el trabajo no tienen un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas como: abono, semilla, herbicidas para obtener mejores cosechas y estén libres de plagas para luego venderlo obtener mejores ingresos y dejar una parte para su familia.
El objetivo de Alexis es que a su familia no le falte nada que tenga el sustento diario y poder darle lo mejor a su esposa y a su hija .
texts.en:
Alexis is an employee and lives with his wife and daughter.  He is a salesman for a firm but also works as a farmer growing basic grains like beans and corn.  He hires helpers to do the work and does not have a fixed work schedule.

He will use the loan to buy farm supplies like manure, seeds and herbicides to obtain better harvests that are pest-free to then sell and obtain better income and to keep part of it for his family.  

Alexis’ goal is that his family lack nothing and has daily nourishment and to be able to give the best to his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and herbicide.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, 29, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sun is employed at a garment factory, and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Sun is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase ducks to raise for sale. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Akodjenou Pierre

texts.fr: Akodjenou Pierre est âgé de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Akodjenou Pierre est marié à une marchande du nom de Jeanne. Le couple a quatre enfants  tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a trois autres enfants en charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Akodjenou Pierre exerce depuis une vingtaine d’années le métier de menuisier dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Akodjenou Pierre  est un éleveur de porc. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ces activités, Akodjenou Pierre contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Akodjenou Pierre sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement par Akodjenou Pierre ont été biens remboursés.
texts.en:
Akodjenou Peter is 41 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a retail merchant named Jeanne. The couple has four children all in school and under their care. In addition to their children, they have three other children to care for. The children live together with their parents and the couple shares responsibility for dealing with various household expenses.

To support himself and his children, Peter Akodjenou has worked as a carpenter in his area for the past 20 years. Secondarily, he is also a hog farmer.

With the income generated by these activities Akodjenou Pierre contributes towards his family's various expenditures.

To meet the needs of a steadily growing number of clients, Akodjenou Pierre is requesting for the third time a credit loan from ALIDé. The two previously granted loans were promptly repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy woodworking materials (beams, etc.)

loans.name: Jenni Marisol

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
En este lugar conocimos a Jenni, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 12 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido trabaja en un bus de transporte de la localidad.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende  productos Avon (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, accesorios, entre otras cosas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella sale a recorrer por su localidad los tres últimos días de la semana, ya que en esos días ella consigue a todos sus clientes en sus casas y es más fácil vender sus productos, además en esos días cobra ya  deja sus productos a crédito. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le encanta lo que hace ya así conoce muchas personas.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar perfumes, cremas, y bisutería más que todo los de oferta ya que luego los vende al precio normal y así le queda más ganancias. Lleva más de 4 años en el  Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The "Emprendedora De Los Cerezos" ["Entrepreneur of Los Cerezos"] communal bank meets twice a month in the Los Cerezos area of the city of Portoviejo. This is a highly populated area on the edge of the city.

This is where we meet Jenni.  She is 42 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has four children.  Two are adults, while the two aged 12 and 10 years attend school.  Her husband works in bus transportation in the area.

Jenni is a great housewife who also works in retail selling Avon products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and accessories, among other things).  Her sales approach is going door-to-door and on request.  She travels her area the last three days of the week, as on these days she can find all her customers at home, and it is much easier to sell her products.  It is also on these days that she collects payment and delivers products that have been bought on credit.  She has been doing this work for four years, and she loves what she does as she has gotten to know many people this way.  

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry mostly for her supply, so she can sell them later at the regular price and so make more profits.

She has been in the communal bank for more than four years, and is the president of the bank.  She likes it because of the benefits that the institution provides.

Her dream is to give nothing but the best to her young children.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a farmer who lives in Roma Norte in the province of Cagayan, together with his wife and two children. He has been growing rice for more than 10 years now. He plants and harvests the rice until maturity and sells them to local traders in the village where they live. He needs to improve his crop production so that he can meet all the needs of his family, especially for his children's allowances and tuition fees. As of now, he had insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides use in farming. According to him, crops can produce abundant harvest if fertilizers and pesticides are applied. 

In the future, Alexander would like to earn good income to meet his goal in raising his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 43 years old and is married with two children. She is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. For the past two years, she has owned and operated a bakery, selling baked goods in the local community. She earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. Leonila joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Leonila is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients to bake bread. She plans to use the income generated with her loan to expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to bake bread

loans.name: Ursalina

texts.en:
Ursalina is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Ursalina has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Ursalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ursalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years, married with six children who are all in school.
He deals in coffee farming and trade. He has requested for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings to help him purchase more coffee to sell in his business. He hopes this will increase his cash flow. His future plans are to construct a permanent house for his family. His major challenge is poor storage and processes which affect the quality of his coffee thereby lowering its prices.
Despite these challenges, Charles has tried to employ local storage measures and as a result of those efforts, he has a permanent flow of customers.

loans.use: to purchase coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 42 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Айнуры среднее образование, с 2008 года занимается животноводством и торговлей. В настоящее время в хозяйстве Айнуры есть 5 коров, 50 овец. Также в магазине она продает хозяйственные товары широкого назначения для дома, к примеру, посуду и зеркала, также бижутерию и украшения. Ее супруг изготавливает сани, ворота, металлические печки. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своей деятельности, Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота в магазине. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Ainura is 42 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in animal husbandry and retail sales since 2008.  She currently has five cows and 50 sheep on her farm.  She also sells a variety of goods in her shop.  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to increase her merchandise turnover.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise turnover in her shop.

loans.name: Mary Glory

texts.en:
Mary Glory is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mary Glory has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Mary Glory has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: José Juan

texts.en:
Mr. Martinez has already 9 years working as a technician in refrigeration and air conditioner. Mainly he repairs the air conditioner of the cars and the electrical system. Mr. Martinez takes care of his son, his wife died recently; although his son helps him but just a little time because he studies. Mr. Martinez is asking for a loan of 2,000.dllrs to buy compressing equipment and a computer for fuel codes injection. \"It will help me to give service to all type of vehicle and I will have more clients”. My main objective is to support my son on college because he wants to be Automotive Engineer, like I sometime wanted it to be.

Español

El Sr. M. tiene ya 9 años prestando sus servicios como técnico en refrigeración y aire acondicionado. Principalmente repara aires acondicionados de autos y el sistema eléctrico. El Sr. M. quedó viudo hace poco tiempo teniendo a su cargo un hijo; aunque su hijo le ayuda por poco tiempo pues estudia. El solicita un crédito de 2.000 dlls. Para comprar un equipo de compresora y una computadora para códigos de fuel injection. “Me ayudará para dar servicio a toda clase de vehículos y así tendré más clientes. Mi principal objetivo es lograr que mi hijo sea un profesionista, quiere ser Ingeniero Automotriz, como yo alguna vez lo quise ser”

loans.use: Un equipo de compresora y una computadora para codigos de fuel injection.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Sokodé, Miss Chantal T. is single and has no children. Not having finished her secondary education due to a lack of means, she quickly launched herself into the sale of beauty products and baby outfits.

To increase her income in order to obtain maximum profits, she is asking for a loan of $400 to stock up her store.

She is a very dynamic young woman whose dedication and rigor need no demonstration. This loan will give her a second wind on the economic front.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1981 à Sokodé, Mademoiselle Chantal T. est célibataire sans enfant. N’ayant pas fini ses études secondaires faute de moyens, elle s’est vite lancée dans le commerce des produits de beauté et de trousseaux bébé.

Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce en vue d’un bénéfice maximum, elle sollicite pour cette fin un financement de $400 pour l'approvisionnement de sa boutique .

C’est une jeune femme très dynamique dont le dévouement et la rigueur ne sont plus à démontrer. Ce financement lui donnera un second souffle sur le plan économique.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty products and baby outfits

loans.name: Nelly Morelia

texts.en:
Mrs. Nelly is 40 years old. She is married, and she has a daughter aged 12 and two sons aged 22 and 17. Her husband Miguel is a night watchman and earns a low wage, which is not enough to pay for all the expenses of their home.

In order to help her husband with the family's expenses she decided to go to beauty school and opened her own beauty salon 5 years ago in Merida Yucatan, where she is from. Little by little she has been conditioning the business to offer a better service to her clients.

Now Nelly needs $375 to buy the supplies necessary to offer her services such as sprays, hair coloring and perm liquid products, etc.

Today you can help improve the life of this family. Nelly and her family appreciate your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Nelly tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de 12 años y dos hijos de 22 y 17, su esposo Miguel es velador y recibe un salario muy bajo, insuficiente para solventar los gastos de su hogar, como una manera de ayudar a su esposo en el gasto familiar decidió tomar cursos de belleza y hace cinco años inicio su propia estética en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán de donde es originaria, poco a poco ha ido acondicionando su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus cliente.

Ahora Nelly necesita de un crédito por $ 375 dólares con lo que comprará artículos necesarios para ofrecer su servicio como fijadores, tintes, compra de líquidos para permanentes, etc. Hoy tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia, Nelly y si familia agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en:
Mwasiti is married with two children. She lives in the Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam. She runs a food vending business in a busy area of Kigamboni. Mwasiti thanks all her lenders for her first loan with Kiva. With the loan, she was able to purchase a blender so that she can offer fresh juice to her customers. She also purchased a deep freezer so that she is now able to keep more fish and juice in stock. She is very delighted with these purchases because they have helped her increase her revenue.

Mwasiti has started to build a permanent structure where she can conduct her business. She is requesting a loan worth USD1200 for finishing the structure and buying tables, chairs, food serving dishes, food display cages and ceiling fans.

loans.use: To buy building materials, tables, chairs, and food serving dishes.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
Aziza D. was born in 1956 in Aksu. She is married and has 6 children. Aziza started her business to provide for her family. She rented a space at the central market where she sells fruits and vegetables. Normicro helped her with $500 loan. Now, Aziza wants to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Азиза Джафарова, родилась 1956 году в городе Аксу.Замужем имеет шестеро детей. Чтобы обеспечиват семью она начала заниматься бизнесом. Центральном рынке в городе Аксу арендовала место для продаж фруктами и овощами. Она обратилась за помощью Нормикро Аксуниского филиала. Взяла кредит 500$.Теперь Азиза хочеть расширят свой бизнес.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ni Luh Suryaningsih

texts.id:
Although a teacher's wife, Ni Luh Suryaningsih is definitely a persistent lady worker. Ni Luh Suryaningsih is helping her husband by opening a retail stall in her house. Besides economical needs, this business is worked on to help paying for education cost of her 9th grader child. With an initial capital of Rp 1,000,000 (about US$110), Ni Luh Suryaningsih sells various sales items, like light food, cold drinks, and also vegetables. Ni Luh Suryaningsih opens her stall in the moring 06:00 AM unitl evenings 6:00PM. In the afternoon, Ni Luh Suryaningsih is helped by her husband after coming home from work to wait for the stall, so that Ni Luh Suryaningsih could rest a while. Day's profit could reach up to Rp50,000 (about US$5.50). Ni Luh Suryaningsih hopes that Dinari's loan could be used as additonal capital of her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun sebagai istri seorang Guru, Ni Luh Suryaningsih memang seorang wanita yang ulet bekerja. Ni Luh Suryaningsih membantu suaminya dengan membuka usaha warung dirumahnya. Disamping untuk memenuhi kebutuhan ekonomi, usaha ini ditekuninya untuk membantu menambah biaya pendidikan anaknya yang sudah duduk di kelas 3 SMA. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Ni Luh Suryaningsih menjual berbagai macam dagangan seperti makanan ringan, roti, minuman dingin , dan juga sayur mayur. Ni Luh Suryaningsih mulai membuka warungnya dari pagi hari jam 06.00 sampai jam 06.00 sore hari. Kalau siang hari, Ni Luh Suryaningsih dibantu suaminya yang sudah pulang kerja untuk menjaga warungnya sehingga Ni Luh Suryaningsih bisa istirahat sebentar. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dalam satu hari sampai Rp. 50.000,-. Ni Luh Suryaningsih berharap pinjaman dari Dinari bisa dipakai sebagai modal untuk tambahan usahanya.

loans.use:
To add business capital

Menambah modal usaha

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en: Tawa S. is a 40-year-old mother of 4 and hails from Ajamgbadi in Lagos, Nigeria.   She sells frozen food, drinks and pure water. She has being in this business since 1997. She requests a loan to buy more frozen food and drinks to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food, drinks and pure water

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Mr. H. Pheng, 37, and his wife, Mrs. Noun Kan, 28, have been married since 1995. Pheng and his wife have a restaurant in the village, and sell Chinese noodles, food, coffee, and drinks (pictured with their son in front of restaurant).

They have two children-- one son, one daughter. Their children are studying in the local school. Pheng and his family live along National Road number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Pheng is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA for $1,200. He plans to use this loan to expand his restaurant adding more tables and chairs so he can seat more customers. He will also add items to the menu, such as beer and wine. He needs to purchase kitchen equipment and tableware as well. By offering these specialty items, they will be able to earn a higher profit for the family.

loans.use: For improving restaurant

loans.name: Satnah

texts.en: Satnah, 48, is married to D. and has 5 children. She has a small shop in front of her house where she sells snacks, groceries, etc. She makes $15 a day. Since joined MBK her shop has grown. She is asking for a loan of $125 to add her business capital so she can increase her income to pay for her children's education. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Asha's Tupendane. Group

texts.en:
Asha is 33 years old and is married with 2 children, aged 7 and 3 years . Asha started her small food store in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, May, who sells items in a shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is the widowed mother of eight children and she has six grandchildren.     Four of her children are still in school, while four of them have completed their schooling and are raising families.  She wants to use the proceeds from her business to begin saving to build a house to support her grandchildren.  Afia sells cloth, scarves, and saucepans.   She travels to Tema, Ghana’s major port town, to purchase her products and then returns to her village of Akom.    

Afia is a member of the trust group Yesu Mo (Thank God).    The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more saucepans and cloth

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S. N. is 26 years old living in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have complimentary businesses revolving around sugar palms. Sugar palms are a unique breed of palm tree specific to Cambodia. Her husband, Yon Nal, is a professional palm tree climber of sorts. He collects the raw palm juice from the top of each tree and gives it to his wife who sells the juice and also distills it into palm wine. Their combined revenue amounts to 5 US$ per day. As they already live out in the rural country side, and currently do not have any children, Seng S. N. would like to invest in a second business as a yam farmer. She would use this loan to start up this business and buy land.

loans.use: To rent farmland.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo is 30 years old and lives with his partner, Blanca Otazú, who is 22 years old. They have their own house. Evarista started working with his father as a vendor when he was very young. Later he acquired a motorcycle and started to work on his own over 10 years ago.

He makes his sales going door to door on his motorcyle, covering many kilometers each day.

Two nephews and a cousin work with him and he pays them for the sales they make.
